description.hltext_display: Fujitsu’s Primergy BX400 opens up blade computing
description.author: prajakta
description.content:
Fujitsu announced on Wednesday the global availability of blade server technology designed especially for smaller and mid-size businesses that are looking for scalable efficiencies and consolidation. The new Primergy BX400 is a fully-featured blade system built from the ground up as a user-friendly and versatile infrastructure designed for midsized customers with large computing and storage requirements, including branch offices. The Primergy BX400 is a green datacenter in a box, providing an optimum combination of up to eight server or storage blades in a small enclosure, supported by a comprehensive set of solutions and services.
It combines leading-edge technology, such as a fully integrated virtual storage appliance using technology from Fujitsu’s partnership with NetApp, with impressive input/output flexibility and bandwidth known from the Primergy BX900 ‘Dynamic Cube’ blade system introduced last year. Easy to install and manage, the Primergy BX400 allows companies to spend less time on set-up and management and instead focus on the core business processes essential for profitability. Simplified lifecycle management reduces daily operational costs by up to 60 per cent. The BX400 ships with Fujitsu’s ServerView software suite, allowing easy and integrated system management and monitoring. Additional software components such ServerView Resource Coordinator VE and Virtual IO Manager deliver uniform operations for pools of physical and virtual servers combined with cost-effective high availability.

description.hltext_display: Los bombos de la Lotería de la Navidad empiezan a repartir ilusión
description.author: La Nueva España
description.content:
El Sorteo Extraordinario de la ha comenzado en el salón de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado, donde los niños del Colegio San Ildefonso ya cantan los números
EP / MADRID El Sorteo Extraordinario de la ha comenzado en el salón de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado, donde los niños del Colegio San Ildefonso ya cantan los números.El nuevo salón de sorteos de Loterías y Apuestas del Estado (LAE) en el Palacio de Congresos se ha abierto alrededor de las 08:00 horas de la mañana para permitir la entrada a los espectadores y aproximadamente una hora más tarde comenzará el sorteo de con la extracción de las bolas de los número y los premios por parte de los niños del Colegio San Ildefonso.Previamente, anoche se hizo público el examen y recuento de las bolas de los números y premios, que pudieron ser comprobadas por los asistentes que lo desearon, previa petición y autorización del presidente. Finalizada la operación de recuento, se desalojó el salón y se aseguraron con cerrojos interiores todos sus accesos, a excepción de la puerta del estrado, cuyas llaves quedan en poder de tres diferentes claveros.A las ocho de la mañana, se ha formado la primera mesa que supervisará el llenado de los bombos con las bolas ya colgadas de las liras y el protocolo durante el que el público en general ha podido, desde ese momento y antes de que comience el sorteo, comprobar que la bolita del número que juega está entre las 85.000 que entrarán en el bombo de los números.Esta operación se efectúa tanto con las bolas de números como con las de premios. Por último, los bombos son cerrados y a una señal del presidente se voltean simultáneamente. Un niño o niña del colegio de San Ildefonso extrae una bola del bombo de números y otro niño, a la vez, otra del de premios, con lo que comienza el sorteo, en torno a las nueve de la mañana.Al finalizar el cuando en el bombo de premios no queda ninguna bola, un equipo de más de cuarenta personas se encarga de realizar la lista de premios del sorteo y de las poblaciones agraciadas con los premios mediante un proceso informático controlado en todos sus extremos.De esta forma, aproximadamente a los 45 minutos de terminado el sorteo, y después de haber pasado por varias comprobaciones y punteos, está preparada la cinta y lista de premios para su entrega a la Fábrica Nacional de Moneda y Timbre, encargada de imprimir la lista oficial de premios. Dicha lista se edita y distribuye la misma tarde del día del sorteo a las Administraciones de Loterías y a los medios de comunicación.Las tablas de los números premiados, quedan expuestas siete días al público. Transcurrido este tiempo son abiertas y las bolas contadas y examinadas nuevamente, para cualquier otro sorteo posterior a celebrar por este sistema.

description.hltext_display: NCKU Center for Teaching and Learning Development Inaugurated
description.content:
To elevate teaching quality and student learning efficiency and achieve academic excellence, the Center for Teaching and Learning Development (CTLD) of National Cheng Kung University (NCKU), Tainan, Taiwan, is inaugurated on December 22nd in 3rd floor, Yun-Ping Building, Kuang-Fu Campus. ?The most important function of a university is education, cultivating talents, and then research and social service. It is a university?s mission to educate youth of the next generation. Education should include two aspects, teaching and learning. However, we mainly focus on the teaching of professors, neglecting the learning of students, which is allowing students to absorb as much knowledge as they can,? said President Michael Ming-Chiao Lai of National Cheng Kung University in his opening remark.
President Lai also mentioned, ?National Cheng Kung University had established Center for Faculty Development which focused solely on the cultivation of teachers. Thus, I believe the newly inaugurated Center for Teaching and Learning Development must embody both aspects of teaching, developing teaching methods, and learning, discovering questions, raising questions and finding solutions. I believe this is the essence of education and the development direction of the future education of National Cheng Kung University.? NCKU Senior Executive Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung revealed, ?I am pleased to see that Vice-President for Academic Affairs Tang has established the Center for Teaching and Learning Development. As I have often said, outstanding talents cannot be cultivated without excellent education, and universities cannot transform into top universities without outstanding talents.? Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung also explained, ?As graduates return to their alma mater, they do not recall how wonderful a professor?s research is and they only remember how strict the teaching of a professor is. Students? parents also do not consider how renowned a professor is in the research field and they only care about how well their children can learn from the school. Therefore, a university, especially a top university, needs to take both teaching and learning into account.? Vice-President Hwung-Hweng Hwung stated, ?In Taiwan, teachers often teach what they like and students often learn what they want. This is incorrect. As teachers devote themselves into teaching, they must observe the learning efficiency of the students from a different perspective. I hope the Center for Teaching and Development Learning can spread the concept for the teachers to realize the importance of education.? NCKU Vice-President for Academic Affairs Ming-Jer Tang said, ?After four years of efforts, Center for Teaching and Learning Development finally inaugurated today. For the past years, under the goal set by President Lai, the Office for Academic Affairs has devoted itself to humanistic and innovative education and cross-disciplinary learning. We are excited that the Center for Teaching and Learning Development, established to truly integrate all the resources at NCKU and to promote NCKU to a top university, is finally inaugurated.?

event_or_fact.property: However, we mainly focus on the teaching of professors, neglecting the learning of students, which is allowing students to absorb as much knowledge as they can,?

description.hltext_display: The A-Z of Myrtle Beach Condo Rentals
description.content:
Myrtle Beach is one such place, that if you go there once, you are bound to become a devout. The place is buzzing with energy whole year round and only those who have visited it once know what it is like to have a fulfilling vacation experience. Now, those who like to go with the conventional must have opted to stay at hotels or resorts. But if you were to ask around just a little bit more, then you will get to know about the option of a condo at Myrtle Beach. The condos are easy to afford and take "accommodation on vacations" to a completely new level.
Myrtle Beach condo rentals provide something new and exciting for the fun loving traveler. It provides a respite from the staid and staunch environment of a hotel room. Also, hotel and resort rooms come with a hefty price tag. The condo at Myrtle Beach provides all the facilities that a hotel provides, but at lower prices. Also, with Myrtle Beach condo rentals, one can avail many discount options and package deals.
Of the many advantages that the condo at Myrtle Beach has over hotels, the biggest is that they provide privacy. With large open spaces and neatly organized rooms, they offer the best accommodation in the area. One also has the option of personalizing the rooms, thus giving the guests a complete home-like feel. A stay at a condo at Myrtle Beach is highly comfortable as it consists of 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. The bedrooms are fully-furnished and warm and boast of the finest and cleanest of beddings. The bathrooms have all the latest facilities and also have a Jacuzzi. The living room is very spacious, giving one the freedom of roaming around freely. It has a plasma screen television and a music system for your entertainment.
For some people, the biggest hassle while planning a vacation is that of accommodation. But with Myrtle Beach condo rentals, that problem is surely taken care of and that too, in the most luxurious and affordable manner. Now, where can you book these Myrtle Beach condo rentals? Worry not, booking them is very easy as you only have to surf the internet for Myrtle Beach condo rentals and choose from among an array of package options that best suits your requirement. There are many condos available in the area, which have more or less the same features and luxuries. You can decide upon the location and make a decision.

description.hltext_display: US calls on NK to take concrete denuclearization steps
description.content:
The United States Tuesday urged North Korea to stop provocations and take concrete steps for its denuclearization before the resumption of nuclear negotiations, stalled over the North's shelling of a South Korean island and other hostile acts, Yonhap News Agency reported in a dispatch from Washington.
"We're not going to get a table and a room and have six-party talks just for the feel-good notion of having six-party talks," White House spokesman Robert Gibbs said. "When and if the North Koreans are ever serious about living up to their obligations, then we can think about restarting six-party talks."
Gibbs was responding to New Mexico Gov. Bill Richardson, who said Monday, upon completion of a four-day trip to Pyongyang, that North Korea has agreed to allow International Atomic Energy Agency inspectors to monitor its nuclear facilities in Yongbyon, north of Pyongyang, and negotiate the sale of 12,000 spent nuclear fuel rods.
Speaking to reporters in Beijing, Richardson also said North Korea had agreed to set up a military commission consisting of representatives from the two Koreas and the U.S. and an inter-Korean military hotline to prevent conflicts in the disputed western sea border, the scene of several bloody skirmishes in recent years.
North Korea expelled IAEA monitors early last year in the wake of U.N. Security Council sanctions for a rocket launch seen as a long-range missile test. Months later, Pyongyang detonated its second nuclear device after one in 2006, drawing harsher U.N. sanctions.
Richardson, a former U.S. ambassador to the United Nations who was once nominated as commerce secretary by President Obama, said North Korea took a step in the right direction for the reopening of the multilateral nuclear dialogue.
Gibbs, however, remained skeptical.
"The belligerent actions that the North Koreans have demonstrated over the past many weeks I don't think provide anybody the confidence that they're even remotely ready to resume in a responsible way those talks," the spokesman said. "When they are, then the world will be ready to do what's necessary. But right now the action must come not from their words but from their deeds."
The North's proposal comes amid speculation that Pyongyang might be switching tactics, aiming for negotiation now after creating a series of crises.
North Korea last month revealed a uranium enrichment plant that it claims is producing fuel for power generation. However, it could also produce highly enriched uranium for nuclear weapons.
The return of the U.N. monitors is one of preconditions Seoul and Washington had put forth for the resumption of the six-party talks on ending the North's nuclear weapons programs.
South Korea and the U.S. also want Pyongyang to apologize for the shelling of Yeonpyeong Island and the sinking of the South Korean warship Cheonan. China and Russia want the nuclear talks to reopen as soon as possible unconditionally.
China, a veto power on the Security Council, blocked efforts by the U.S. and its allies to denounce Pyongyang at a council meeting in New York Sunday.
Seoul and Washington officials are cautious about the North's rapprochement efforts as some experts dismiss the proposals as traditional brinkmanship.
"We have throughout many months and even many years, dating back to different administrations, seen the words and the rhetoric of the North Koreans fail to live up to any of their actions or their obligations," Gibbs said. "So speeches and rhetoric aside, the obligations that they must undertake as part of a respected member of the international community, they're aware of what they need to do."
State Department spokesman Philip Crowley, meanwhile, called on North Korea to rejoin the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty.

description.hltext_display: ITC to take Motorola patent case against Microsoft
description.author: prajakta
description.content:
A trade panel that specialises in patent cases has agreed to hear the complaint of Motorola Inc's subsidiary Motorola Mobility against Microsoft Corp, the panel said on Tuesday.
Motorola Mobility, which makes handsets and is being spun off by Motorola, has accused Microsoft of infringing its patents to make some Xbox video game consoles. Motorola Mobility has asked for the infringing devices to be barred from importation into the United States. Motorola Mobility has filed similar lawsuits in district courts in Florida and Wisconsin. Patent lawsuits are frequently filed with the ITC in order to get infringing products banned from importation and in district courts in order to win damages.

description.hltext_display: Putting divorce aside for a day
description.author: KRISTY BROWNLEE
description.content:
There?s no time like Christmas to bring the family - and exes - together.
A growing number of divorced celebrity couples, like Sandra Bullock and Jesse James, are putting their infidelities and differences aside to spend the holiday together for their kids? sake. Psychologists say with more celebs putting their beef aside for turkey, unconventional family gatherings are becoming more accepted. ?A lot of times people say they can handle their spouse for a couple of days a year,? says Calgary-based psychologist Wendy Froberg. ?There?s generally a bit more of an idea that divorces don?t have to be adversarial. If we are mature and cool about it, it really can work out.? Divorce counsellors agree, Christmas spent together as a family is best for the youngsters.
One of the biggest advantages is saving the hassle of arguing about where children will spend which day this year. Every Christmas, courthouses are filled with single parents fighting for Christmas-time custody. And gifts bought for the kids by both parents could curb the need to buy the children's love for individual parents with pricey presents.
Bullock and James are just one of several Hollywood exes to spend Christmas together. Ashton Kutcher, Demi Moore, Bruce Willis, and their offspring have been one big happy family for Christmas and Thanksgiving holidays for years. Also this year, Madonna and ex-husband Guy Ritchie will share Christmas with their kids.
If just the thought of sipping egg nog and eating turkey in the company of a past lover is too overwhelming, consider going for an hour or two.
Peter Doherty, president of Alberta Association of Marriage and Family Therapy, says he tells his clients that they don?t need to spend the whole day in the company of their past partner. ?There is nothing like Christmas to really open you up to wishful thinking,? he explains. Doherty says exes who plan to share the holidays should talk to their kids and avoid confusion. Otherwise, children may get the idea their parents are rekindling romance.
But for some, it may be too soon or too volatile to be in the same room as the ex.
Steve Calder of Red Deer. Alta., who split with his ex-wife nearly three years ago, says ?too many hurt feelings are floating around? to even be in the same room as his former spouse.
The 36 year old plans to spend time with their three daughters in the latter half of the holiday, while their mother will take them for Christmas Day. ?After everything she has put me through, I have no desire to be in the same room with her,? Calder says. He knows other couples who have tried, but not many successfully, especially in the first few years post-break up.
Froberg says moms and dads often forget that there?s no better person to have on your side than their former mate.
The kids love your former spouse and they love the kids too, she says. ?It?s only temporary. You can handle child birth; you just have to get through dinner.? Tips for single parents at Christmas
Plan ahead. Discuss with your partner well in advance of the holiday, about plans for the kids at Christmas. If spending the holiday together is not an option, split time with them. Alternate Christmas Day each year.
Create new traditions. Christmas will be different post-divorce, but be proactive. ?Change isn?t bad, it?s just different,? Calgary-based psychologist Wendy Froberg says.
Avoid being alone. Volunteering over Christmas is a win-win situation. Often the best way to curb loneliness is to think about somebody else.

description.hltext_display: Maharashtra government okays 2.5 FSI for rehab projects
description.content:
The state government has authorised the Pimpri Chinchwad New Town Development Authority (PCNTDA) to allow 2.5 floor space index (FSI) for the rehabilitation projects being planned under basic services to urban poor (BSUP) scheme.
PCNTDA chief executive officer Suhas Divase told DNA, The provision for 2.5 FSI will help slum rehabilitation projects being constructed on PCNTDA land. The authority has proposed to set up a housing project for middle income group (MIG) and low income group (LIG) on a public-private-partnership (PPP) basis in sector 12 on 143.32 acres of land belonging to PCNTDA in Bhosari.
The residential township will be the first under JNNURM (Jawaharlal Nehru national urban renewal mission) on a PPP basis in Pradhikaran. The PCNDTA has made a provision of Rs100 crore for the project.
Around 15,000 houses will built in the township and nearly 5,000 houses will be for LIG. The area of the LIG flats will be 377 sq ft. For MIG, there is provision of constructing 2,023 houses of nearly 570 sq ft and 770 sq ft. The flats will be sold for Rs1,500 to 2,000 per sq ft. The special township will have schools, autorickshaw stand, vegetable market and health centres. Divase said, The PCNTDA had applied for 2.5 FSI separately for the project earlier. But according to the state government resolution, every housing project under BSUP will provided 2.5 FSI. PCNTDA, popularly known as Pradhikaran, was formed in 1972 to provide affordable housing for industrial workers of Pimpri-Chinchwad.
Parts of the villages of Bhosari, Chikhali, Moshi, Nigdi, Akurdi, Ravet and Chinchwad were also included in PCNTDA.

description.hltext_display: Scratching a niche of holiday merriment
description.content:
There's no such thing as a generic prescription for seasonal cheer. But maybe one of these quirky new DVD releases will embolden your Christmas spirit, or prove the perfect little token to drop in the stocking of someone near and dear. As always, kids come first:
*"Legend of the Guardians: The Owls of Ga'Hoole" (Warner Home Video, rated PG, DVD $28.98; Blu-ray Disc $35.99). Owls don't make for a very frightening warrior species -- unless you're a field mouse, of course. But that didn't keep the children's books by Kathryn Lasky from flying off bookshelves. Now "graphic novel" specialist Zack Snyder ("300") has turned the series into a grand-looking fantasy that uses real birds and lots of computer animation to whisk dreamers of all ages off to hobnob with this mythical, medieval breed. One caveat: The very young may be disturbed by its dark vision of a timeless clash between good and evil in tail feathers.
*"Samantha: An American Girl Holiday" (Warner Home Video, rated G, DVD $19.97). Young daughters are the intended audience for this latest live-action film based on the popular line of American Girl books and dolls. It centers on 9-year-old Samantha Parkington (AnnaSophia Robb), living with her wealthy grandmother (Mia Farrow) in 1904 New York. Her lonely life is interrupted when a working-class girl comes to live next door. There's a suspenseful escape and a happy ending, glad to say, and among the bonuses is an inspiring look back at the whole "votes for women" era.
*"Superman/Batman: Apocalypse" (Warner Home Video, rated PG-13, DVD $19.98, Blu-ray Disc $29.99). The ninth original cartoon adventure in the DC Universe franchise finds the Man of Steel joining forces with Batman to rescue a kidnapped alien maiden from the clutches of the evil Darkseid. The disc has two bonus TV episodes, plus a sneak peek at the upcoming "Green Arrow." Also new from Warner and DC Universe at the same price points is "Superman/Shazam! -- The Return of Black Adam," a compilation showcase of original shorts featuring Jonah Hex and The Spectre, among others.
Family holiday cheer
*"Bing Crosby Television Specials, Vol. II: The Christmas Specials" (Infinity Entertainment, not rated, DVD $29.98). We see a lot of the great Bing Crosby this time each year, and not only because of his all-time, chart-topping holiday classic, "White Christmas." He also put his brand on the season with countless other recordings, films and TV specials. Bing Crosby Enterprises (www.bingcrosby.com) has now dipped into its TV archives for four of his Christmas specials, mastered from the original tapes.
Each hour-long program has its moments of hokey comedy and variety, but also its highlights, like Bing's duet with David Bowie on "Peace on Earth" in 1977, his medleys with Mary Martin in 1962, and a delightful musical version of the O. Henry story, "The Cop and the Anthem," from 1971. His hour-long "evening" with Frank Sinatra trading Christmas hymns is also here, filmed in color in 1957 on the set of "High Society." Elsewhere, opera star Mary Costa, the Cosby family, Robert Goulet, Ron Moody and Twiggy provide plenty of old-fashioned enjoyment.
*"The Year Without a Santa Claus" (Warner Home Video, not rated, two-disc Blu-ray/DVD pack $24.98). Also from the heyday of family holiday television comes this 1974 stop-motion animation classic from Arthur Rankin Jr. and Jules Bass. It finds two spunky elves and their helpmates setting off in search of an AWOL Santa. The picture was remastered in high-def and now looks as bright as Rudolph's nose. Warner has also recycled the Rankin-Bass 1974 cartoon "'Twas the Night Before Christmas" (not rated, $19.97), about a grumpy mouse whose skeptical view of Santa threatens a whole town's holiday.
For moms and dads
*"Micmacs" (Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, rated R, DVD $28.95; Blu-ray Disc $38.96). Foreign film fans of "Amelie" director Jean-Pierre Jeunet may embrace this 2010 French import. It could almost be called a Christmas movie in deep cover, as rubber-faced comic Dany Boon of "The Valet" sets out to bring down a pair of Parisian war profiteers with the help of some unemployed circus performers. Light on dialogue and filled with visual wonders and sight gags, it's a charming throwback to the heyday of Jacques Tati, set to music that draws upon classic film noir scores by Max Steiner, of all things!
*"The Town" (Warner Home Video, rated R, DVD $28.98; Blu-ray Disc $35.99). This ensemble crime drama is one of the year's surest hits for dads. A tight-knit band of bank robbers in a blue-collar section of Boston risks exposure from the attractive bank teller they impulsively took as a hostage. Ben Affleck, who also co-wrote and directed, plays the leader who wants to snuggle up with her, and "Hurt Locker" revelation Jeremy Renner plays the group's loose cannon, who wants all threats eliminated. Meanwhile, Jon Hamm of "Mad Men" heads the FBI team that's tightening a net around them all. Affleck misses the opportunity to raise the drama quotient, but his instincts are good for savvy, street-level dialogue. The Blu-ray has an exclusive "extended" version with cut footage, plus a bonus tour of Ben Affleck's Boston and a digital copy of the movie for those on the lam.
*"Mother and Child" (Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, rated R, DVD $28.96; Blu-ray Disc $39.95). For mature women and other "let's talk about our relationship" types, this new drama from director Rodrigo Garcia should be a powerhouse tearjerker -- despite a wanton disregard for male-female privacy in one scene.
Annette Bening and Naomi Watts play damaged women who are individually suffering the emotional distress of broken maternal bonds, even while childless Kerry Washington is going about an adoption. The fine ensemble cast also includes Jimmy Smits, David Morse and Samuel L. Jackson. It's over-long at 127 minutes, but for fans left wanting more, the DVD also has interviews and extras.
Some odds'n'ends
*"Bill Burr: Let It Go" (Image Entertainment, rated R, $14.98). We don't cover comedy concerts in this column, but this is one stand-up who really stands out. Bill Burr has anger-management issues, yet his concerns are better observed -- and more winningly addressed -- than in the usual middle-class, passive-aggressive rants. This is not PC comedy, in any case, but for those who've been to the clubs and think they've seen it all, here's the freshest "ordinary guy" comic to come along since the early days of Tim Allen, Sam Kinison and Louie Anderson. Check him out at www.BillBurr.com.
*"Van Gogh: A Brush With Genius- IMAX" (Image Entertainment, not rated, DVD $19.98, Blu-ray Disc $24.98). Training the giant IMAX cameras on the concise brilliance of Van Gogh's canvases does pay dividends in its exacting looks at the tortured painter's artistry. But why is the voice-over narrator pretending to be Van Gogh's ghost? Who knows. Why adopt a self-aware, bemused tone for a suicide victim? Beats me. And why does the famous Dutchman speak English with such a thick French accent? Anyone's guess. Still, as an introduction to a fabulous period of art history, this 40-minute feature is a clear winner.

description.hltext_display: LAKERS NOTEBOOK: Jackson no fan of Christmas Day games
description.author: Elliott Teaford
description.content:
Ten teams, five games and one hype-filled day and night of basketball.
If it was up to Lakers coach Phil Jackson, however, everyone would be relaxing at home with families and friends instead of trudging to work on Christmas Day. If he was in charge, they would have a day off to celebrate a special holiday.
"I don't think anybody should play on Christmas Day," he said before the Lakers played host to the Milwaukee Bucks on Tuesday, their final game before their Christmas Day showdown against the Miami Heat at Staples Center.
"It's like Christian holidays don't mean anything to them anymore," he continued. "You just go out and play and entertain (for) the TV. It's really weird. It is what it is. You've got to go to
GO INSIDE THE LAKERS:
For the best around-the-clock coverage of the Lakers, visit our Inside the Lakers blog.
work, and we'll do what we have to do and make the best of it.
"It's a game you just throw out there. You don't know what kind of effort is going to be done or how it's going to play out. I don't know if you can adequately prepare for these games. You don't have a walk-through on the day of the game.
"It's just a difficult game."
The Lakers lost badly in their most recent Christmas appearance, when they fell to LeBron James and the Cleveland Cavaliers last season. They meet James and his new team, the Heat, in a possible NBA Finals preview at 2 p.m. Saturday.
The Lakers defeated the Boston Celtics two seasons ago and delivered a minor payback to the team that humiliated them in the decisive Game 6 of the Finals
the previous June. The Lakers were well-prepared for that particular showdown.
As for this game, well,Jackson isn't sure what to expect. "It's going to be Christmas," he said, "and you're going to have little kids putting batteries in toys and putting their Christmas presents together, and there's all kinds of crazy stuff going on, and now your head's got to get focused on the game, in the middle of the afternoon, on Christmas Day."
Jackson couldn't leave it there, firing off another shot.
"When I was in the CBA, we had a commissioner who scheduled a Christmas Eve game," he said. "I had to call him up and say, 'That's the holy time.' He said, 'Oh man, I forgot.' You have to keep reminding them that this is a special day."
Bynum watch
When a group of reporters approached him before the game, Andrew Bynum said he wouldn't talk about the pain in his surgically repaired right knee until after he played his fifth game following a 24-game absence. Bynum's pain was news to Jackson.
"We haven't talked about it," Jackson said. "The trainers haven't come to me with it, so I'm not aware of it. He's had some obvious stiffness during the course of this rehab and training sessions, but he hasn't mentioned anything to me.
"We're not planning on doing anything different."
Ring, ring, ring
Ron Artest will raffle off his championship ring Saturday night at the Conga Room, across the street from Staples Center. Artest reported that he's raised almost $550,000 in sales of raffle tickets.
The proceeds will go to a mental health charity.

description.hltext_display: Brazil: u vladi nove predsjednice najmanje osam žena
description.content:
Predsjednica Rousseff koja će dužnost preuzeti 1. siječnja 2011. godine, već je imenovala 30 od 34 ministra u svojoj vladi.
Prva izabrana predsjednica Brazila u povijestu te zemlje Dilma Rousseff odabrala je osam žena za ministrice u vladi, navodeći da im želi dati mjesto razmjerno njihovom doprinosu u društvu, prenosi AP.
Predsjednica Rousseff koja će dužnost preuzeti 1. siječnja 2011. godine, već je imenovala 30 od 34 ministra u svojoj vladi.
Na čelu ministarstva kulture bit će pjevačica i glumica Ana de Holanda, socijalnog razvoja ekonomistica Tereza Campello, dok će za promociju rasne jednakosti biti zadužena sociologinja Luiza Helena de Bairros.
Žene će, također, biti na čelu ministarstava za proračun i planiranje, ljudska prava, ekologiju, ribolov i poljoprivredu, te komunikaciju.
U vladi odlazećeg predsjednika Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva bile su tri ministrice.

description.hltext_display: Historic Sargent House back on the market
description.author: Michelle Rindels Staff Writer
description.content: A for-sale sign has gone up in front of the Aaron Sargent House, formerly Grandmere's Inn on Broad Street in downtown Nevada City. Andrew and Susan Howard, owners of the nearby Emma Nevada House bed-and-breakfast inn, continue in escrow to buy the historic Victorian. But current owner Bob Yoder, a Truckee-based real estate broker, wants to open the property to back-up offers. The Nevada City Council is expected to hear an ordinance in January that could allow defunct bed-and-breakfast inns to reopen. The Howards are buying the property with the intention of reopening it as an upscale inn. Their plans prompted city officials to take a second look at city rules regarding bed-and-breakfast inns in residential areas. The mansion operated as a popular downtown B&B until it was converted to a private residence in 2004. Owners let the business permit lapse, and the home went into foreclosure in 2009. Yoder bought it at auction this summer. To contact Staff Writer Michelle Rindels Copyright 2010 The Union. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. The Union December, 21 2010 8:51 pm MST

description.hltext_display: Najbolji božićni koncert u Hrvatskoj, a neće ga vidjeti cijela Lijepa naša
description.content:
Iako su nastupila zvučna imena poput Josipe Lisac, Olivera, Đanija Stipaničeva i sestara Husar, kamere HRT-a zaobišle su ovogodišnji koncert
Dok za razliku od dosadašnjih nije bilo mondenih okruglih stolova i šampanjca, sve kako bi u skladu sa situacijom i oni manje imućni građani mogli uživati u njegovoj čaroliji, zvijezde večerašnjega 8. Božićnoga gala koncerta u Bjelovaru, ne samo svojim imenima već odličnom izvedbom dale su doprinos da u punom smislu riječi događaj bude gala.
Dvije i pol tisuće posjetitelja u prepunoj sportskoj dvorani uživalo je u gospel-jazz inačicama stranih i domaćih božićnih klasika i svjetovnih pjesama koje su odlično izveli Josipa Lisac, Oliver Dragojević, Ivana i Marija Husar, Đani Stipaničev i specijalni gost američki gitarist i pjevač Freddie James Cooper, sve uz Revijski orkestar pod ravnanjem Alana Bjelinskog i mješoviti zbor bjelovarske Glazbene škole Vatroslava Lisinskog.
Time je događaj, kako među publikom, tako i među dijelom izvođača još jednom dobio potvrdu najboljeg božićnog koncerta u Hrvatskoj. Jedino ostaje žal što se ostatak Hrvatske izvan dvorane niti ove godine neće moći uvjeriti u točnost takvih ocjena. Naime, već drugi puta za redom kamere HRT-a nisu popratile događaj kako bi barem putem odgođene snimke prenijele njegovu čaroliju, zbog čega je vrlo jasno negodovao dio izvođača, odnosno sestre Husar i Đ. Stipaničev.

description.hltext_display: Digerir lo de Carrillo
description.author: La Nueva España
description.content: Ussía hace que Cospedal cante sobre el malestar del PP por la distinción al comunista JAVIER MORÁN Parece dura en el estómago del Partido Popular la digestión de que el grupo municipal de Gijón votase a favor de hacer hijo predilecto a Santiago Carrillo. Dolores de Cospedal, secretaria general, ha comentado que existe un malestar difundido en todo el partido, lo cual significa que el rechazo no está siendo exclusivo del casquismo, que puede tener sus peculiaridades y tozudeces, pero quien lo encabeza, Álvarez-Cascos, recibió sin aspavientos junto a Carrillo la «Sardina de oro» de la Agrupación Folclórica «Sabugo, ¡Tente Firme!», de Avilés. Sucedió hace tan sólo un año y pico. Por tanto, la cosa queda encuadrada en ámbitos más amplios del PP, pero quien le extrajo a Cospedal -durante una tertulia radiofónica- la declaración sobre las molestias creadas fue Alfonso Ussía, periodista y escritor implacable con Carrillo. Nieto del dramaturgo Pedro Muñoz Seca, ejecutado en Paracuellos, Ussía tiene todo el derecho posible a no olvidar y aunque se mostró partidario del perdón y la amnistía rechazó que el viejo comunista fuera ensalzado de ningún modo.Cada cual puede tener fijados sus objetivos en la vida, y Ussía, aunque simpático, puede resultar incendiario. Ya que estamos en fechas navideñas cabe recordar aquel villancico que hace años propuso en la COPE, en el programa «Protagonistas» de Luis del Olmo, junto a Mingote, Tip, Coll, Ozores, Chumy Chúmez, etcétera. «En el portal de Belén / nadie toca la zambomba / porque un hijo de Setién / ha colocado una bomba». Esto sucedía en 1987, a los pocos días del atentado contra el cuartel de la Guardia Civil de Zaragoza. La cadena de la Conferencia Episcopal expulsó a Ussía del programa, aunque después le readmitió.En cuanto a Carrillo, nada más ser elevado a hijo predilecto de Gijón, soltó que se siente orgulloso de que la derecha le considere enemigo. Evidentemente, su discurso se ha radicalizado en los últimos años, ya que esas cosas no se las decía antes a Fraga, por ejemplo.

description.hltext_display: Wheelchair Lifts - Add More Convenience
description.content:
Wheelchair lifts are a great boon to the mobility impaired and provide them with comfortable access to different floors of a building. The lifts are very reliable and add a great deal of convenience to the lives of persons with physical handicaps.Convenient Access in Residential and Commercial SettingsWheelchair lifts are suitable for limited spaced buildings where elevators cannot be installed. With the help of wheelchair lifts the mobility impaired persons can move through the stairways in a seated position, adds more convenience to them. These devices are obtainable in a variety of models such as inclined platform lift, portable wheelchair lifts, vertical wheelchair lifts and so on. Innovative models that can be used in straight, spiral and curved stairways are also available in the industry. Utilizing these accessibility options, the disabled and wheelchair confined persons can access the spaces of their residences and commercial establishments including offices, hospitals, educational institutions and other settings in a convenient manner.Configured with High-end Safety features To provide increased convenience and comfortable movement through the stairways and other areas for the individuals with disabilities, most of the models of wheelchair lifts are incorporated with superior safety features and user-friendly controls. Majority of the models featured with extremely versatile designs can be even customized and configured accordingly to match with the project needs and aesthetic requirements. The core features that can be found in the various models of wheelchair lifts include:
Emergency stop button Manual lowering device Remote controls Audio-visual alarm Non-skid platform Door interlocks Highly sensitive obstruction sensors Safety brakes Automatic dual access ramps
Additionally, to accommodate wheelchair models of all sizes including powered wheelchairs, adult wheelchairs, sports wheelchairs and child wheelchairs the different models of wheelchair lifts are provided with strong platforms. Some of the models even permit you to keep the unit folded compactly to the wall, when the equipment is not in use. This would help to keep your stairways unobstructed for the other users.Established Dealer for the Purchase In short, wheelchair lifts with its unique designs and all-inclusive features ensure greater convenience for the wheelchair bound individuals. These devices help them to move freely in and around their homes and other areas, significantly enhances their self-assurance. To buy the best model of wheelchair lifts that completely suits your requirements and budgets, ensure to choose an established dealer. Such a distributor can offer branded products, trouble-free installations and timely maintenance services. Search on web-directories and yellow pages would help you to gain information about the industry-best distributors.

description.hltext_display: Barcelone: Vacances prolongées pour Messi
description.content:
Lionel Messi ne jouera pas contre Levante avec le FC Barcelone, le 2 janvier prochain, pour la 17e journée de Liga. Et pour cause, "Leo" sera à peine revenu de ses vacances en Argentine. Le Ballon d'Or 2009 a été autorisé à rentrer le 1er ou le 2 janvier, alors que ses coéquipiers reprendront le 29 décembre. "C'est ma décision, a précisé Guardiola, rapporte Marca. Je veux qu'il passe la fin de l'année avec sa famille".

description.hltext_display: KKO: Stora Enson maksettava tulospalkkiot myös lakkoilleille
description.content:
Työnantaja ei olisi saanut jättää tulospalkkioita maksamatta laittomaan työtaisteluun osallistuneille, katsoo korkein oikeus. Se määräsi Stora Enson Inkeroisten tehtaan maksamaan tulospalkkiot noin kolmellekymmenelle vuonna 2006 lakkoilleelle työntekijälle.
Yhtiö oli kirjannut tulospalkkiojärjestelmään ehdon, jonka mukaan laittoman työtaistelun aiheuttamat menetykset vähennettiin siihen osallistuneiden tulospalkkioista. Korkeimman oikeuden mukaan yhtiö pyrki näin laittomasti rajoittamaan työntekijöiden yhdistymisvapautta.

description.hltext_display: Szász Károly változtatna a bankadón
description.content:
Hosszabb távon a pénzügyi rendszer nemzetközi versenyképessége szempontjából fontos lenne, hogy a bankadó fokozatosan megszűnjön, vagy tervezhető legyen - nyilatkozta a PSZÁF elnöke az MTI-nek.
Az intézményeknek most kell megküzdeniük a pénzügyi-gazdasági válság hatásaival - többek között az eszközminőség romlásával, ami az értékvesztés megképzésén keresztül rontja a jövedelmezőségüket -, ezek ugyanis fáziskéséssel jelentkeznek az amerikai és európai piacokhoz képest, ahol a válság már korábban lezajlott, és hatása "brutálisabb" volt, mint nálunk - mondta Szász Károly az MTI-nek. A magyar pénzügyi rendszer a PSZÁF elnöke szerint viszonylag jól teljesített a válságban, kevésbé sérült a gazdaság többi szereplőjéhez képest, amiben szerepe volt annak is, hogy a válság első szakaszában a bankok pozíciójukból fakadóan még át tudták hárítani a terheket ügyfeleikre. Ezt jelzi, hogy amikor az európai és amerikai bankok már veszteségesek voltak, és felszámolásokra, fúziókra került sor, a magyar hitelintézetek még kiemelkedő eredményeket könyveltek el - tette hozzá Szász Károly. Az idén azonban már összességében nullszaldós, de az is lehet, hogy veszteséges lesz a magyar pénzügyi rendszer. A bankadó bevezetésén túl ez annak is köszönhető a PSZÁF elnöke szerint, hogy jelentősen megváltozott a nemzetközi és a hazai szabályozási környezet, szigorodtak például a fogyasztóvédelmi szabályok. A válság következményeinek felszámolása ezért most már a tartalékok felélésével folyik - tette hozzá Szász Károly. A pénzügyi intézmények már elfogadták a bankadót, mint "a válság terheihez való közösségi hozzájárulás" formáját a PSZÁF elnöke szerint, de szükségesnek tartaná, hogy az adó mértéke és alkalmazása hosszabb távon összhangba kerüljön az uniós szabályozással, vagy fokozatosan megszűnjön. A tervezhetőség hiánya ugyanis ronthatja a nemzetközi versenyképességet, nemkívánatos tendenciák jelentkezhetnek, így például elindulhat a fiókosodási folyamat, a bankok visszafoghatják teljesítményüket.Kulcskérdés, hogy a magyarországi hitelezés elinduljon, ehhez pedig a tőkeerős, devizaforrásokkal rendelkező intézmények mindegyikére szükség van - hangsúlyozta Szász Károly. A hitelezés visszafogása a gazdasági növekedés lassulását jelentené, ezért fontos volna, hogy a vállalati és a lakossági hitelezés is minél előbb visszaálljon a korábbi szintre. A PSZÁF januártól önálló alkotmányos szerv lesz, rendeletet alkothat, a fogyasztók érdekében közérdekű pert indíthat, és a jövő év közepétől pénzügyi békéltető testületet működtethet. Szász Károly nagyon örül a felügyelet által kapott lehetőségeknek, ugyanakkor ennek nagy felelősségét is átérzi. A PSZÁF lesz a felelős a pénzügyi közvetítő rendszer működtetéséért és a pénzügyi szabályozásért, ami óriási feladat, a felkészülést már megkezdte a szervezet.A rendeletalkotási jog Szász Károly szerint nem korlátlan felhatalmazás, hanem az ágazati törvények alapján, konkrét területek szabályozására vonatkozik. A felügyelet azt tervezi, hogy a rendeletalkotással összefüggő jogszabályi előírások betartásán túl általános konzultációs lehetőséget biztosít a szakmának. A közvetítő rendszer érdekképviseleti szerveinek és a jelentősebb intézmények vezetőinek megkérdezése mellett a tudományos, az oktatási és az üzleti szféra tapasztalatait is szeretnék hasznosítani. A pénzügyi békéltető testületek működéséhez a felügyelet létrehoz egy országos hálózatot a fogyasztóvédelmi szervezetekkel együttműködve, s a helyi képviselők segítenek majd abban, hogy a pénzügyi szolgáltatásokkal kapcsolatos ügyfélproblémák közvetlenül a szolgáltatónál megoldódjanak. Ha ez nem sikerül, az ügyfél eldöntheti, hogy a bírósághoz vagy a békéltető testülethez fordul.A pénzügyi békéltető testületek működése a PSZÁF-tól független lesz, de a felügyelet biztosítja, hogy az ezekben az ügyekben eljáró mini választottbírósági fórumok jól képzett jogász, közgazdász "bírókból" álljanak, ami már önmagában tekintélyt teremt.Az intézményeknek mindenképpen együtt kell működniük a békéltető testületekkel. Ez azt jelenteni, hogy rendelkezésre kell bocsátaniuk azokat az információkat, amelyeket az ügyfél kér, és az eljárásban részt kell venniük. Ellenkező esetben a felügyelet határozatával erre kötelezheti, és szankcionálhatja a szolgáltatót - hangsúlyozta a PSZÁF elnöke.Ha valamely intézmény nem veti alá magát a békéltető testület döntésének, a felügyelet ajánlást ad ki, amit a békéltető testület honlapján is közzétesznek, így üzenetértéke lesz. A felügyeleti elnök arra számít, ha a felek látják majd, hogy a testületek szakszerűen, hatékonyan és gyorsan működnek, jobban respektálják majd az alternatív vitarendezési eljárást.
A magatartási kódex előírásait az intézmények túlnyomó többsége igyekezett betartani, a dokumentum azonban módosításra szorul, mert a megszületése óta eltelt több mint egy év alatt számos jogszabály változott (például már egyáltalán nem lehet egyoldalúan módosítani a költségeket, jutalékokat, s a kamatváltozás feltételei is tovább szigorodtak), a felügyelet ezért azt javasolta a szakma képviselőinek, hogy a változásokat figyelembe véve alakítsák át a kódexet - mondta Szász Károly.

description.hltext_display: Gulf states' 2011 growth outlook improves slightly
description.content:
Prospects for growth in Gulf economies in 2011 have improved slightly from forecasts three months ago, a Reuters poll showed on Tuesday, as rising oil prices and generous government spending underpin economic recovery.
The global downturn cut output and froze credit in the world's top oil exporting region in 2009, limiting growth in the six Gulf countries this year. But rising crude prices and a pick-up in credit growth will support growth in 2011, according to the median forecasts of 16 economists polled between December 8 to 21.
Saudi Arabia, the largest Arab economy and the world's top oil exporter, is expected to see economic growth of 4.3 per cent in 2011, up from a forecast 4.2 per cent in a Reuters poll in September. Growth would be higher than a forecast 3.8 per cent this year and a sluggish 0.6 per cent in 2009.
Saudi Arabia on Monday announced an expansionary 2011 budget, with plans to spend SR580 billion ($155 billion) next year, mainly on education and infrastructure projects.
'The 2011 budget demonstrates that the kingdom is dedicated to continuing stimulatory spending to develop the economy and persuade private investors to do the same as they gradually emerge from a phase of deleveraging,' John Sfakianakis, chief economist at Riyadh-based Banque Saudi Fransi, said.
'A slowdown in the pace of budget growth, however, also signals the state's goal to rein in overspending and employ more prudent and efficient fiscal policies in the coming years.'
Saudi Arabia is expected to post a positive fiscal balance of 4.1 per cent of gross domestic product (GDP) in 2011 compared to 2.7 per cent in 2010, the poll showed.
Oil prices, which have recovered since December 2008 lows, will keep Gulf fiscal balances and current accounts in surplus in 2011, the analysts said.
A Reuters poll forecast oil prices will average over $86 a barrel next year on declining inventories and demand growth from Asia. Crude oil was priced at $89.63 a barrel at 0920 GMT on Tuesday.
Qatar, the world's top liquefied natural gas exporter, should easily outperform the region, with real GDP growth of 12.8 per cent in 2011, unchanged from a September forecast, although it will not match expected growth of 16 per cent this year.
The economy of Kuwait is forecast to grow 4.0 per cent in 2011, up from a forecast of 3.9 per cent in the September poll and up from 3.0 per cent growth expected in 2010.
Bahrain and non-Opec member Oman should see GDP growth of 4.2 and 4.6 per cent in 2011, respectively, topping forecasts of 4.1 per cent and 4.3 per cent, respectively, in the September poll.
Giyas Gokkent, chief economist at National Bank of Abu Dhabi, said key risks in 2011 were external shocks affecting the oil price, the outcome of ongoing debt restructuring talks in the UAE, and geopolitical tensions with Iran.
'The whole scenario revolves around where oil prices will be. If global growth is indeed robust, that is very positive and oil prices will remain firm,' he said.
The UAE - the second-largest economy in the Arab world - is seen growing 3.6 per cent in 2011, the slowest pace in the Gulf, but slightly better than 3.5 per cent growth forecast in the September poll.
Analysts said inflation would rise in 2011 in all the Gulf states except Saudi Arabia, although they cut inflation forecasts for all Gulf countries compared with September's poll.
Saudi Arabia should still see the highest inflation rate at 5 per cent in 2011 due to rapid population growth, higher housing costs and rising global food prices. But that is still below the record peaks seen in most Gulf countries in 2008.
Consumer prices in Qatar, which has experienced deflationary pressures, are expected to rise 3 per cent next year versus 2 per cent deflation in 2010.
'Qatar saw deflation in 2010, but will have a rebound in prices next year because of developments in the housing sector,' Gokkent said, adding that a substantial amount of housing had already come to the market, weighing down the consumer price index.
'In 2011, the impact of falling rents will not be of similar magnitude.'-Reuters

description.hltext_display: 12 steps to healthy holidays
description.author: Lisa Tsakos
description.content:
The holiday season is a time of excess -- overspending, overindulging in unhealthy food and alcohol, more socializing than usual, and more stress on the body, mind, and wallet. Keep your budget and your waistline under control this season with these suggestions:
1. Take B vitamins. Don?t skimp on your vitamins during the holidays. The excess calories, most of them empty, create a need for even more nutrients. B vitamins are especially critical during the holidays to manage the added stress. A B-complex supplement taken with meals supplies the vitamins necessary to make brain chemicals. Dark leafy greens, whole grains, beans and lentils provide B vitamins. Ensure that your meals also include protein (which is needed to make neurotransmitters) and magnesium.
2. Load up on green. Green vegetables, such as spinach, kale, and broccoli, supply vitamins, minerals, roughage, and enzymes. Eating a raw salad of mixed greens before each meal -- or as a meal -- fills your tummy and promotes good digestion. Steamed greens help to prevent constipation and are an excellent source of minerals.
3. Go raw for a day. Choose a day each week to eat (and drink) only raw food. There are plenty of foods to enjoy raw: fresh, colourful salads, nuts, seeds, juices, sprouted beans, and even raw chocolate (cacao beans). If you enjoy cooking, experiment with different recipes, such as ?raw apple pie? or ?raw lasagna.? You?ll feel lighter and more energized, and your scale will thank you for it come January. If the idea doesn?t appeal to you, instead, start each day with a delicious fresh-pressed vegetable cocktail.
4. Keep moving. There?s so much to do, so little time. Something has to give, and it?s usually exercise. While your routine may be disrupted, sneak in a few minutes of exercise every day. Whether it?s sit ups before bed, squats while blow-drying your hair, or picking up the pace while walking through the shopping mall, a few minutes of movement several times a day will result in less time in the gym after the holidays. When you do make it to the gym, maximize your time with interval training -- alternating intense bursts of activity with slower activity.
5. Take probiotics. A daily probiotic supplement, as well as eating probiotic-rich foods, such as yogurt and kefir, will help to combat the effects of overindulging in sugar, breads, and other carbs. Keep containers of organic plain and flavoured yogurt handy for a healthy mid-meal snack. If you?re hankering for a snack before bedtime, half a cup of plain yogurt will satiate your appetite and help you to sleep soundly. 6. Don?t eat out. Typical holiday fare served at social gatherings and family dinners provides fewer nutrients and more calories and fat than homemade meals. During the holidays, when you aren?t socializing with family or friends, eat all of your meals at home. Make your meals from scratch to save money and calories.
7. Focus on fibre. Beans, lentils, greens, and vegetables are a yummy, low-cal way to fill your belly (which, like Santa, might be shaking like a bowl full of jelly by January if you aren?t careful!) and promote healthy bowels.
8. Cut back. During this time of excess, save the bread, potatoes, crackers, alcohol, and all sweets for the holiday parties. Avoid eating them at home or work. 9. Designate a ?no spending? day. One day each week or every other week, make it a goal to avoid spending any money, or to spend as little as possible. Bring your lunch to work, make your own coffee, and take the bus to avoid costly parking fees. Bring a credit card and some small change in case of emergency, but do your best not to use them.
10. Drink water, not calories. Avoid calorie-laden eggnog, alcohol and juice, and drink even more water than usual during the holidays. Water will help to control your appetite as well as hydrate your skin in the harsher weather. A fresh-pressed vegetable juice with some fruit mixed in is a healthy exception.
11. Take five to meditate. A few minutes of quiet each day helps to clear your head, de-stress, and to focus on the festive spirit of the holidays -- a welcome relief from worrying about money, family events, and gifts.
12. Gratitude. The holidays are stressful, but they?re also a time for sharing, giving, and spending time with friends and family. Take a moment before each meal and before drifting off to sleep to give thanks for all your blessings.
Lisa Tsakos is a Registered Nutritionist and a regular contributor to NaturallySavvy.com, a website that educates people on the benefits of living a natural, organic and green lifestyle. For more information and to sign up for their newsletter, visit www.NaturallySavvy.com.

description.hltext_display: US-Raumgleiter als Trägersystem für neue Waffen im All?
description.content:
Der jüngste Testflug des unbemannten Raumschiffs X-37B zeugt einem Zeitungsbericht zufolge wahrscheinlich davon, dass die USA an neuen Trägersystemen für ihre Präzisionswaffen basteln.
Das Pentagon weigere sich zwar, konkrete Ziele des X-37B-Projekts bekannt zu geben, die Entwicklung solcher Raumgleiter lasse sich aber in das jüngst angenommene US-Militärkonzept Prompt Global Strike gut einbetten, schreibt die russische Wochenzeitung „WPK“ in ihrer jüngsten Ausgabe, die am Mittwoch erschien.
Die Idee des Konzepts bestehe darin, jedes Ziel auf der Erde binnen 60 Minuten bei Bedarf treffen zu können. Dabei orientiere man sich immer mehr an konventionellen Hochpräzisionswaffen anstatt an Atomraketen. Insbesondere versprächen Hyperschall-Flügelraketen Durchbruch.
Für diese Waffen brauche das Pentagon Trägersysteme. Es stehe nicht fest, dass das X-37B Orbital Test Vehicle ausgerechnet diesem Zwecke diene, seinem Flug könne aber die Entwicklung größerer unbemannter Raumschiffe mit stärkeren Waffen folgen, so der Bericht.
Das unter strengster Geheimhaltung entwickelte Raumschiff X-37B war am 3. Dezember nach sieben Monaten im All zur Erde zurückgekehrt.

description.hltext_display: Graduation rates improve locally
description.author: NICK WERNER
description.content:
MUNCIE -- Most local school districts were successful in improving year-over-year graduation rates and remain higher than the state average overall, according to state figures released today. Thirteen of 22 high schools in Blackford, Delaware, Henry, Jay and Randolph counties graduated 90 percent of students or more, a benchmark set by Indiana Supt. of Public Instruction Tony Bennett in 2009.
And 15 of those schools improved their graduation rates from 2009. One of the biggest winners was Southside High School, jumping from 81.4 percent to 91.4 percent.
Muncie Community Schools performed well overall. The district's other high school, Central, graduated 91.9 percent of graduates, a slight increase over 2009.
The local results reflect an overall improvement statewide. Indiana's 2010 graduation rate improved to 84.1 percent, increasing 2.6 percentage points over 2009. Department of Education spokeswoman Lauren Auld attributed the improvement to increased expectations from state government. The state, however, is leaving it up to local administrators to develop their own programs and plans to meet those expectations.
"I hope other schools are talking to those schools (that met 90 percent) and are saying, 'Hey, what are you doing?' " Auld said.
Winchester High School was one of five area schools to reach the 90 percent goal for the first time since at least 2007. Winchester graduated 111 of 123 students, or 90.2 percent, on time -- a 3-percentage-point increase over 2009.
"We are pleased obviously being at or above the 90-percent mark, especially because that's a goal that's been set," Randolph Central School Corporation Supt. Greg Hinshaw said. "We're trending in the right direction."
At Winchester High School, educators are using online learning to allow students who have failed classes to recover credits. They have also used the district's alternative education program as an alternative to expulsion, given more support to students who need help but don't qualify for special education and involved parents more.

description.hltext_display: Russia leads the world in divorce
description.content:
Marital relationships in Russia seem to be on the rocks as new figures have revealed that the country has the highest divorce rate in the world.
According to the Demographic Yearbook - a statistics collection put out by the United Nations - there are five divorces per every 1,000 marriages in the country, reports the New York Daily News.
Moreover, Belarus, Ukraine and Moldova round out the top four.
The Cayman Islands have the fifth highest divorce rate.
Even the US is not far behind, as the super-power has the sixth-highest divorce rate in the world: 3.4 divorces per thousand people.
However, it seems couples in Massachusetts are getting along well as the state boasts the lowest divorce rate in the US-only 1.8 divorces per thousand people.

description.hltext_display: Rider pulls knife on Sacramento cabbie, leaves tip
description.content:
SACRAMENTO -- A Sacramento taxi passenger may have an anger problem, but he's no Grinch.
Police say a man reportedly pulled a knife on a cab driver during a dispute over the weekend, but still made sure to pay his fare -- plus tip.
The Sacramento Bee reports that the rider argued with the driver about his desired destination on Saturday and then pulled out a folding-blade knife, prompting the driver to flee on foot.
The man also fled the scene, but left behind his cab fare and a tip.
Police say the passenger has not been found.
------
Information from: The Sacramento Bee

description.hltext_display: 4 years and stretching at the Pilates Place
description.author: The Union staff" Photo
description.content: The Pilates Place in downtown Grass Valley is celebrating its fourth anniversary with an open house from 4 to 7 p.m. Wednesday, Jan. 5. The public is invited to tour the studio at 131 Richardson St., experience Pilates equipment with certified instructors and take sample classes - all for free. Food, drink and raffle prizes will be offered. "The Pilates Place was voted best Pilates in 2009 by The Union readers because of our highly trained, versatile staff," said owner Roxanna Cohen, a physical therapist and certified Pilates rehabilitation specialist. "We offer Pilates for fitness and rehabilitation, for the athlete or the novice exercisers," Cohen said. "Programs are custom-designed to fit the individual." For more information, visit www.ThePilatesPlaceGrass Valley.com or call (530) 477-5167. Copyright 2010 The Union. All rights reserved. description.hltext_display: Snack pack tack creates some flak
description.author: Amy Dickinson
description.content:
DEAR AMY: My partner and I are friends with a neighbourhood couple who have a wonderful and loving family. We see them socially on occasion and sincerely enjoy their company.
This year, the boys and their father walked the neighbourhood and asked us to support their youth organization's annual fundraising efforts by purchasing a snack gift pack. Who could resist the request of the boys in their crisp uniforms, respectfully and courteously asking for support?
Being good neighbours and friends, we purchased an item. Immediately after the purchase, buyer's remorse set in. Their national organization does not allow gay leaders.
I feel the parents are close enough that we can broach the subject, and yet I also feel they should have been more sensitive before approaching us. We don't want to lose them as friends. Your suggestion on a best approach would be most welcome. -- Neighbourly
DEAR NEIGHBOURLY: Just as your neighbours weren't making a particular statement in asking you to buy a snack pack, you can also refuse to purchase a snack pack without making a declaration -- unless you want to.
If you're asked or wish to supply an explanation, you should say that because the organization has an exclusionary leadership policy, you can't in good conscience support its fundraising efforts.
It is not these parents' job to determine or decode your sensitivities and avoid you -- or to urge the boys to exclude you (then they'd be doing the same thing their organization's leadership does).
They are treating you to the same opportunity all of the neighbors are being given, and like the other neighbours; you can take or leave the treats, with or without an explanation.
DEAR AMY: My family knows that my husband has been very sick. They have heard this from doctors and from me. If we want my husband around in the future, he must not drink alcohol and must eat well.
He was an alcoholic, but bless him, he has been doing great, despite having many other medical problems. We have all but given up joining my family for any occasion; they go so far as to invite him to taste this booze or that, when they all know how hard it is for him to abstain.
I truly don't know what to do. Any suggestions? -- Sad Sister
DEAR SAD: One quibble -- you say your husband "was" an alcoholic.
He is an alcoholic.
This distinction is important because your husband's alcoholism requires ongoing vigilance.
If your family can't accommodate him or if they continue to diminish or (even worse) undermine his recovery, then you shouldn't spend time with them.
If you are with them and they behave in a way that you and your husband believe is injurious to his health, then you will have to leave.
Recovering addicts know that the key to their continued sobriety is in the company they keep. This lesson will be substantiated if your husband attends a recovery support program like AA regularly.
Your family members sound like bad company -- and your husband should keep his distance.
DEAR AMY: Thanks for your column and levelheaded advice. I'm a lifelong reader of advice columns and have noticed that most of the problems you tackle are due to people's inability to express themselves respectfully and honestly with others in order to resolve simple, everyday conflicts.
They don't know what to say, or they don't have the guts to speak up. Ironically, this comes at a time when we're hearing an excess of angry "self-expression" about political and social differences.
Our society seems unable to engage in civil discourse and open dialogue just when we need it the most. Do you think these two trends are related? -- Northwest Reader
DEAR READER: I do think these two trends are related.
I'm continually surprised at the challenge people face in expressing their own wants, desires or points of view.
Like you, I see an opposite tendency -- and that is the freewheeling and aggressive expression of people who don't mind "getting in someone's face."
I often preach the benefit of balance -- but personal balance is hard to achieve when the rest of the world seems out of whack.
Send questions via e-mail to askamy@tribune.com or by mail to Ask Amy, Chicago Tribune, TT500, 435 N. Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60611. Amy Dickinson's memoir, "The Mighty Queens of Freeville: A Mother, a Daughter and the Town that Raised Them" (Hyperion), is available in bookstores.
(c)2010 BY THE CHICAGO TRIBUNE DISTRIBUTED BY TRIBUNE MEDIA SERVICES, INC.

description.hltext_display: Rescue me! Tips for tricky spots
description.content:
While the escape or utility club is relatively new and has made a big impression in the last few years, it cannot provide the answer to all escape routes we find on the golf course.
We've been doing some research and discovered some very useful tips from top players on avoiding finding even more trouble, while trying to escape from tricky positions Here's a handful of situations and escape routes you might try:
Aim right when the ball's above your feet
Many of us find ourselves with shots where the ball lies above our feet so it's almost guaranteed to go left. Compensate by aiming to the right of your target, standing more upright and gripping down the shaft. It's then a natural tendency to swing around your body with a flatter swing.
Ball in a greenside bunker with no lip
Occasionally you find your ball sitting on compacted sand in a bunker with no lip and only a few feet from the putting surface. Seriously consider taking your putter instead of splashing out with a sand iron. Grip down the handle to hover it above the sand, address the ball slight forward in your stance and strike the ball on the up with top spin.
Ball in a fairway trap
Don't be too greedy. Always assess the trajectory needed to clear the front lip and take a club that will achieve this by about one foot (third of a metre). Make this height your margin for error and chose your club (with enough loft) carefully.
Aim left when ball's below your feet
Faced with a sloping lie and the ball below your feet, align yourself left of where you want the ball to finish. The naturally stooped nature of your posture, when you address the ball, creates a more upright swing. This leads to a natural fade so aim left to compensate.
Use cross wind to your advantage
Many of us hate the crosswind, especially left to right with our slice lurking. Instead of trying to compensate by trying to draw the ball to hold into a left to right wind or cut into into a right the lefter (leave it to the pros), go with thew flow and play along with it. Take plenty of club and allow the wind to blow your ball back on line.
Open the face in the rough
Never square the face at address in deep rough. Open the face a little and re-grip as you take your stance and hold on tight. Allow for the friction of the grass to square the face at impact and the ball will fly out on target.
At last, I believe these tips can help you. When you play the golf, you must attention this.

description.hltext_display: La Lotería de Navidad, a por El Gordo
description.content: La Lotería de Navidad ha llegado. Uno de los acontecimientos más esperados de todo el año y, sin duda, el más ilusionante. Desde primera hora os vamos a ir contando todo lo que suceda en el Sorteo Extraordinario de la Lotería de Navidad, en directo. Recuerda que puedes consultar si tus números han sido premiados en nuestra página especial desde las 9:00 horas, con la caída de la primera bolo del bombo del . 8:25 horas: La Lotería de Navidad se siente La mañana de la Lotería de Navidad es uno de esos recuerdos que quedan en la memoria colectiva. Cada familia goza de sus propias costumbres, pero la tradición se cumple año tras año y, posiblemente, a esta hora, sean ya muchos los que estén desayunando unos churros con chocolate esperando, muy atentos, a que arranque el sorteo. Mientras, en Madrid, ya han llegado los primeros disfrazados al recinto, fieles a la magia. La pregunta ya resuena: 8:50 horas: Diez y contando A falta de diez minutos para que arranque el sorteo de la Lotería de Navidad, la emoción se vuelve más y más patente. ¿Tienen ya los números bien repartidos por la mesa? Mientras que mantienen sus sueños vivos, podemos ser un poco supersticiosos. Al parecer, dicen los expertos, que los desastres naturales traen suerte. En Granada . No diremos más. 9:00 horas: ¡Arrancamos! Las bolas inician su orquesta particular dentro del bombo. La suerte está echada. Hemos sabido que en Granada somos en Lotería de Navidad... ¡A ver si hay suerte! 9:10 horas: La suerte se hace esperar... ¿No empezaba esto a las nueve en punto? Seguimos esperando a la primera bola 9:15 horas: El Gordo cae en Granada Pues sí, como lo oyen, mientras que El Gordo entra en el bombo de Madrid, en Granada ya celebremos la alegría de . ¡Feliz Navidad!

description.hltext_display: AK: Arbeitszeitkalender ist Hilfe zur Selbsthilfe =
description.content: Wien (OTS) - "Bekomme ich alles, was mir zusteht?" - eine gängige Frage in der AK Rechtsberatung. Viel zu oft müssen die AK ExpertInnen feststellen, dass das nicht der Fall ist. "Die Angaben über geleistete Arbeit seitens Arbeitgebern und Arbeitnehmerinnen und Arbeitnehmern weichen nur zu oft auseinander. Und wenn es vor Gericht geht, dann zählen nur die Beweise", sagt Irene Holzbauer, Leiterin der Abteilung Arbeitsrecht in der AK Wien. Arbeitszeitaufzeichnungen führen zwar manchmal nicht zur kompletten Durchsetzung möglicher Ansprüche, aber sie sind jedenfalls eine gute Grundlage für einen Vergleich. Das gilt insbesondere auch für Teilzeitbeschäftigte und LeiharbeiterInnen. Deshalb hat die AK Wien den "Arbeitszeitkalender" entwickelt und stellt diesen allen ArbeitnehmerInnen zur Verfügung. Holzbauer: "Jeder sollte den Arbeitszeitkalender möglichst genau führen, denn: Vertrauen ist gut, aber Kontrolle ist besser." Der Arbeitszeitkalender kann ab sofort unter 01/310 00 10 454 bestellt werden oder steht als Download auf http:/wie.arbeiterkammer.at zur Verfügung. Jeder Arbeitgeber ist verpflichtet, Arbeitszeitaufzeichnungen zu führen und anhand dieser die Lohnabrechnung zu erstellen. "Aber wir merken, dass sehr viele ihre Mehr- und Überstunden nicht korrekt ausbezahlt bekommen. Oft unterschreiben dann die Betroffenen Monatslisten, die nicht mit den eigenen Aufzeichnungen übereinstimmen. Angst um den Arbeitsplatz ist ein häufiges Motiv", sagt Holzbauer und rät, bei unterschiedlichen Aufzeichnungen ein klärendes Gespräch mit dem Arbeitgeber zu suchen. Der Arbeitszeitka-lender kann dabei eine nützliche Argumentationshilfe darstellen. Oft werden Überstunden oder Mehrleistungen nicht alleine erbracht, das sollte man nutzen und sich mit Unterschrift die geleistete Mehrarbeit "bezeugen" lassen. Wer den Arbeitszeitkalender führt, kann überprüfen, ob ihm die geleistete Stunden bzw Überstunden auch tatsächlich ausbezahlt werden. Tipp: Erfolgt keine Auszahlung und gibt es auch keinen Zeitausgleich, sollte man die Überstunden schriftlich beim Arbeitgeber einfordern. Denn: Viele Arbeits- aber auch Kollektivverträge sehen den Verfall von Überstunden oft schon nach drei Monaten vor, wenn der Anspruch nicht schriftlich beim Arbeitgeber geltend gemacht werden. Service: Der Arbeitskalender kann unter 01/310 00 10 454.bestellt oder auf http://wien.arbeiterkammer.at heruntergeladen werden. Rückfragehinweis: AK Wien Kommunikation Thomas Angerer Tel.: +43-1 501 65-2578 thomas.angerer@akwien.at http://wien.arbeiterkammer.at *** OTS-ORIGINALTEXT PRESSEAUSSENDUNG UNTER AUSSCHLIESSLICHER INHALTLICHER VERANTWORTUNG DES AUSSENDERS - WWW.OTS.AT *** OTS0027 2010-12-22/09:27 220927 Dez 10 AKW0001 0336

description.hltext_display: طنز/ دانشگاه خنده!
La Canada Flintridge, Sierra Madre on yellow alert as massive storm approaches
description.author: Brian Charles
description.content:
LA CANADA FLINTRIDGE - With a storm of historic proportions bearing down on Southern California, residents in La Canada Flintridge kept an eye to the sky and rested their hopes on a newly fortified k-rail system.
Meteorologists have predicted torrential rain in California, prompting officials in La Canada Flintridge and Sierra Madre to issue yellow flag alerts. Under yellow flag conditions, residents should be prepared to evacuate.
However, homeowners in La Canada Flintridge are holding out hope that the new k-rail system will keep them safe.
"We constructed this retaining wall and the county nailed down the k-rails," said Skeet McAuley, of La Canada Flintridge, pointing to the concrete wall bordering his property and k-rails meant to corral water down the street. "We are in good shape."
During a February storm, the k-rails - designed to protect homes - began to float down Ocean View Drive, slamming into cars and homes in their path. Los Angeles County Department of Public Works nailed the concrete rails to Ocean View Drive in the fall.
While McAuley said he doesn't want to evacuate, fleeing from mud slides and fires has become part of life on Ocean View Drive where he lives.
"If they evacuate us this time, it will be the eighth time we have been told to leave," he said.
The evacuations date back to the Station Fire in the fall of 2009.
Kirk Habib, of La Canada Flintridge, pointed to recent history as evidence that his home will come through the storm
without any damage.
"That storm missed me and that was the worst-case scenario," Habib said. "I'm not worried about my property, I am worried about the people further down the hill."
Habib's Ocean View Drive home was spared during the last round of heavy rains, but several of his neighbors' homes were caked with mud. Between the spring rains and the recent barrage of inclement weather, Habib and his neighbor constructed a new wall to help keep mud and water off homes and lawns and in the street.
"Those concrete construction blocks," he said, pointing to large blocks that make up the wall. "Nothing is going to move those things."
The rains hammering Sierra Madre have reopened an old wound that dumped mud and debris in Skyland Drive. A rive of mud flow from Andy Dotson neighbor's driveway and backed up in the street in front of his Sierra Madre home.
The culprit, a hillside behind Skyland Drive that dumped tons of mud and debris on the street in February and started again Tuesday.
"It was just pouring down mud this morning," Dotson said about the mud.
Sierra Madre Public Works crews removed four truck loads of mud from behind Dotson's home on Tuesday, giving the homeowner reason to be nervous.
"I am concerned about this storm," he said. "I haven't slept much."
With the rains expected to inundate the San Gabriel Valley during the overnight hours Tuesday, Dotson readied for another sleepless night and a possible evacuation.
"We have the Christmas presents already packed just in case," Dotson said. "My truck's ready in case we have to run out in an emergency.
A trickle of rainwater flowed down Ocean View Drive on Tuesday, as a dense fog hugged the hillside neighborhood known for its upscale homes. The relative calm on the street was contrasted with the roar of the Mullaly Debris Basin, which runs nearly parallel to Ocean View Drive and was swollen with water.
The scene was much the same near the Rose Bowl, where the Arroyo Seco resembled more of a raging river than the creek its name implies.
The storm knocked out power for thousands, according to Southern California Edison officials.
As of 2 p.m. Tuesday, 13,678 customers without power in Southern California, with 809 San Gabriel Valley residents in the dark, said Charles Coleman, Southern California Edison spokesman.
The weather-related power outages are contained to Claremont and Diamond Bar, he added.
Despite the forecast, Habib remains cautiously optimistic.
"The thing about the last big storm was that the rain was concentrated in a small amount of time, this has been spread out," he said. "But if we get a hard downpour again, it will be just as bad."
McAuley has some of the same concerns.
"I want to be hopeful, but I tend to side with reality and realistically we might get more mudslides."
For more information on the storm and any possible evacuations, Sierra Madre residents can go to: sierramadrepio.blogspot.com/2010/12/sierra-madre-issues-yellow-flag-alert; La Canada Flintridge residents can go to: www.lacanadaflintridge.com.

description.hltext_display: Skiunfälle: Fortschritte in der Behandlung von Knochenbrüchen
description.content: Utl.: Krankenhaus Schwarzach behandelt Brüche zunehmend "minimalinvasiv" / "Schlüsselloch-Methode": Nur kleine Hautschnitte, Gewebe wird geschont, nur kleine Narben =Schwarzach/Salzburg (OTS/wnd) - Die bevorstehenden Weihnachtsferien verbunden mit großen Schneemengen bedeuten auch eine deutliche Zunahme von Wintersportlern auf den Pisten. Um Verletzte mit Knochenbrüchen noch besser zu behandeln, wird im Krankenhaus Schwarzach seit einiger Zeit eine neue Operationstechnik angewandt: Brüche werden über modernste Zielinstrumente fixiert, es sind nur sehr kleine Hautschnitte erforderlich. Zurück bleiben nur kleine Narben auf der Haut. "Heute können wir auch Knochenbrüche an Beinen, Armen oder der Wirbelsäule über die so genannte 'minimalinvasive' Technik operieren", sagt Primar Franklin Genelin, Leiter der Unfallabteilung im Kardinal Schwarzenberg'schen Krankenhaus im Salzburger Pongau. Pressetext & FOTOS: http://www.pressefach.info/khschwarzach Rückfragehinweis: Mag.
