description.hltext_display: Swingin' the New Year!
description.content:
ST. PETERSBURG - Swingin' the New Year, a grand New Year's Eve celebration for all ages, happens at the spectacular St. Petersburg Coliseum, and features the world-renowned Bill Allred's Classic Jazz Band.
The evening includes live music, dancing and celebration from 9 p.m. to 1 a.m., plus an intro swing-dance lesson from 8 to 9 p.m. partner needed).
Doors open 7:30 p.m.
The celebration features a midnight countdown and balloon drop; dance performances; a vintage fashion photo shoot and contest; party favors and chocolates; prize giveaways; free parking; and a full cash bar with champagne bottles and toasts available.
The St. Petersburg Coliseum provides historic swing-era ambiance, a smoke-free atmosphere and an unparalleled 15,000 square foot oak dance floor. Dress to impress. New Year's and vintage attire are encouraged.
The St. Petersburg Coliseum is located at 535 Fourth Ave. N., St. Petersburg.
Swingin' the New Year is produced by Swing Time and Swing Gang, and sponsored by Helinger Advertising.
Bill Allred's Classic Jazz Band is a powerhouse of swing, a band that's currently enjoying world-wide acclaim as one of the most talented and versatile in the industry. This eight-member ensemble creates a jazzed-up, full-throttle, big-band sound by combining a five-piece horn section (doubled up on the trumpets and trombones) with a superb rhythm section and outstanding vocals.
In 2010, Bill Allred's Classic Jazz Band celebrated its 20th anniversary. Highly active on the jazz festival circuit, the band regularly plays some of the most prestigious festivals and venues in the world. The band has toured four continents and recorded thirteen albums! They enjoy frequent air-play on the nation's leading jazz radio stations. This has earned them an ever-growing base of followers, plus an international fan club of over 1500 loyal members.
Tickets are $24 in advance or $29 the day of event. Purchase advance tickets online at www.TampaBaySwing.com; by phone at 727-669-7830 or 813-579-4645; or in person at Coliseum Box Office. Tickets also are available at
For more information, call 813-840-3715 or visit www.TampaBaySwing.com.
Article published on Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010
Copyright © Tampa Bay Newspapers: All rights reserved.

description.hltext_display: Messer an Bord: Paris Hiltons Flieger muss warten
description.content:
Los Angeles – Schreck für Paris Hilton: Ein Messer, das an Bord ihres Flugzeugs vor dem Start gefunden wurde, hat am Dienstag ihre Reise nach Hawaii verzögert. Über Twitter ließ das Starlet die Welt wissen, dass sie und die rund 200 anderen Passagiere an Bord wegen der Entdeckung „eines großen Messers" die Delta-Air-Lines-Maschine vor dem Start in Los Angeles vorübergehend verlassen mussten.
„Da bekommt man es mit der Angst zu tun, dass es an Bord gelangte", erklärte sie. „Es ist so merkwürdig, dass ein Messer an Bord kam."
Eine Sprecherin der Fluglinie erklärte, es habe sich um ein Catering-Messer gehandelt, das die Kabinenbesatzung versehentlich vergessen habe. Die Suche sei eine reine Vorsichtsmaßnahme gewesen. Der Start der Boeing 757 verzögerte sich um rund eine Stunde. (APA/dapd)

description.hltext_display: Custom Postcard Printing Made Easy
description.content:
Postcards are print materials that will not go out of style. Years ago, postcards have been used by our families and relatives in keeping in touch with each other. Visiting other places was never complete without sending a bunch of postcards to those left at home. During holiday seasons and special occasions, too, postcards were popular. These were used to send heartfelt greeting to friends and loved ones. These days, when instant messaging and modern technologies, postcards are still used by those who love to have keepsakes. Postcards are placed in memory boxes as memorabilia. These postcards are way more charming that chat messages and emails and are preferred by many people. For sure, postcards will be appreciated by anyone you know.
If you are looking for a way of sending greetings, you may want to make postcards. On your spare time, you can do custom postcard printing which can be really easy to do. For custom postcard printing, you will need paper stock which should be have thicker width, ink type for printing, and of course, your personal computer as well as inkjet printer. See, you do not need special machinery or high tech equipment to do custom postcard printing. In the comfort of your own home and in your most convenient time, gather your friends and family members, so you can do custom postcard printing together. This can be your bonding activity. Kids can do custom postcard printing with the help of adults. They can send their postcards to their friends and classmates come school breaks and summer vacations.
If you are not familiar with how custom postcard printing works, here are some essential guidelines:
- Select the materials you need. You can find paper stock inside your own home. If not, go to the nearest supply store for this printing essential. Choose quality paper stock, one that does not tear easily. Bear in mind that your paper stock should withstand shipping, transport and delivery.
- For the ink type, there are those that give off an unusual sheen. There are ink types that are metallic, adding value to the prints. Find out what ink types have special qualities that you can use. This may come expensive, so if you are working on a limited budget, you can always make use of your laser or inkjet printer.
- Make use of full color when custom postcard printing. You do not want your postcards to look bleak and boring. Use full color especially if you are going to make use of images. Make sure that the images are of high resolutions as the prints may be pixilated in the end.
- Set the measurement for your postcards. Stick with the usual sizes and shapes, but you can also make it doubly fun if you choose non-traditional ones. Kids will surely enjoy getting postcards shaped into their favorite cartoon characters or animals.
- Before you print your cards, have a sample. In this way, you can minimize erros. On the get go, you can already know which design elements you need to improve. You may encounter problems with bordering and indentations, so you need to work on this before mass printing.
- Avail of mailing services if you wish to distribute a huge number of postcards. Mailing companies can offer you services that are affordable and reputable.

description.hltext_display: رتبه راه آهن ایران پایین تر از متوسط منطقه
description.content:
اقتصاد > صنعت - مقایسه حمل و نقل ریلی ایران با کشورهای منطقه
به گزارش خانه ملت، در بخشی از متن گزارش کمیسیون صنایع و معادن پیرامون بررسی وضعیت صنایع حمل و نقل ریلی کشور که در اجراء بند (6) ماده (33) آیین‌نامه داخلی در جلسه علنی روز چهارشنبه اول دی ماه قرائت شد، آمده است:
مقایسه شاخص های مهم حمل و نقل نظیرنسبت طول خطوط به مساحت و جمعیت، نسبت تعداد لوکوموتیو به طول خطوط و نسبت واگن به جمعیت با 16 کشور مهم منطقه شامل کشورهای همسایه، خاورمیانه، آسیای میانه و حوزه قفقاز نشان می دهد ایران از وضعیت مناسبی برخوردار نیست و برای رسیدن به جایگاه شایسته خود باید تلاش و سرمایه گذاری بسیار زیادی دراین زمینه صورت گیرد.
درسال 1385 طول خطوط راه آهن ایران 7265 کیلومتر بوده است که با توجه به یک میلیون و ششصدوپنجاه هزارکیلومترمربع مساحت آن، نسبت طول خطوط به مساحت حدود4/4 خواهد شد. میانگین 16 کشور مهم منطقه 3/9 است که ارمنستان با 28 و عربستان با 47/0 دارای بیشترین و کمترین مقدار می‌باشند. این نسبت در ترکیه حدود 2/11، سوریه11، پاکستان 8/9 و مصر 2/5 است.
در رابطه با نسبت طول خطوط به جمعیت نیز میانگین 16 کشور منطقه 195 و ایران با میانگین 103 در ردیف نهم قرار دارد. قزاقستان با حدود 928 و عربستان با نسبت 39 دارای بیشترین و کمترین رقم دراین مورد هستند. اغلب کشورهای آسیای میانه و حوزه قفقاز بهمراه ترکیه و سوریه دارای موقعیت بهتری نسبت به ایران می‌باشند.
برای دستیابی به متوسط کشورهای منطقه باید طول خطوط به حداقل 13300 کیلومتر یعنی حدود 6000 کیلومتر افزایش نسبت به وضعیت سال 85 برسد. رسیدن به رتبه اول منطقه نیز نیاز به 55000 کیلومتر طول خطوط ریلی دارد که باتوجه به امکانات موجود دسترسی به آن دشوار است.
درخصوص وضعیت موجود و کمبود آلات ناقله به نکات زیر اشاره می‌شود:
1- تعداد واگن مسافری موجود در سال 1385 حدود 1610 دستگاه است که با توجه به جمعیت کشور، برای هر یک میلیون نفر حدود 23 واگن اختصاص می یابد. میانگین این نسبت در 16 کشور مهم منطقه 5/48 واگن است که قزاقستان با 158 واگن و اردن با 5/1 واگن دارای بیشترین و کمترین تعداد هستند. این نسبت در کشورهای آسیای میانه، مصر و سوریه از ایران بیشتر است. برای رسیدن به متوسط کشورهای منطقه باید تعداد واگن مسافری ایران به 3500 واگن و برای کسب رتبه اول به 11140 واگن برسد.
2- میزان جابجایی بار در سال 85 حدود 33میلیون تن می باشد که تقریباً 7 درصد حمل و نقل زمینی را به خود اختصاص می دهد. این میزان بار بوسیله 23هزار واگن بار جابجا شده است. شاخص واحد حمل به تولید ناخالص داخلی نشان می دهد ایران رتبه مناسبی در بین کشورهای مورد بررسی نداشته و برای رسیدن به میانگین، باید تعداد واگنهای باری خود را حداقل به دو برابر میزان فعلی افزایش دهد.افزایش قیمت حامل های انرژی، حمل و نقل بار با راه آهن را به شدت تحت تاثیر قرار خواهد داد.
3- نسبت تعداد لوکوموتیو به طول خطوط از دیگر شاخص‌های مهم حمل و نقل ریلی هر کشور است که متاسفانه ایران با05/0 دستگاه به ازای هر کیلومتر در ردیف آخر 16 کشور مهم منطقه است. میانگین کشورها 12/0
و گرجستان با 24/0 دارای بیشترین لوکوموتیو نسبت به طول خطوط ریلی می‌باشد. برای رسیدن به متوسط کشورهای منطقه باید تعداد لوکوموتیوهای در سرویس ایران به 730 دستگاه برسد. رتبه اول منطقه نیز نیاز به 1750 دستگاه لوکوموتیو دارد. از آنجا که بدلیل مشکلات تأمین قطعه، آماده بکاری لوکوموتیوهای دیزلی حدود 60% است بنظر می‌رسد افزایش تعداد لوکوموتیوها تا 1000 دستگاه این مشکل را برطرف می‌سازد.
استفاده مناسب از خطوط ریلی و آلات ناقله، با توجه به میزان حمل بار و مسافر مشخص می شود. آمارها نشان می دهد در سال 85 نسبت تن کیلومتر بار حمل شده به تعداد واگن باری حدود 96/0 است که 25/0 از میانگین آن در کشورهای مهم منطقه بیشتر می باشد. قزاقستان با 16/2 و عراق با 17/0 دارای بیشترین و کمترین نسبت تن کیلومتر به تعداد واگن باری می باشند.میانگین این نسبت در دنیا حدود 3 است که از کلیه کشورهای منطقه بیشتر می باشد.
نسبت نفر کیلومتر حمل شده به تعداد واگن های مسافری نیز نشان می‌دهد ایران از رتبه مناسبی بین 16 کشور مهم منطقه برخوردار است. میانگین این نسبت در منطقه حدود 2/4 است که پاکستان با 4/15 دارای بیشترین میزان و اردن با 11/0 دارای کمترین میزان بهره وری از واگن های مسافری می‌باشد. ایران با 8/7 در مرتبه سوم بهره وری از واگن‌های مسافربری قرار دارد.
نسبت تن کیلومتر و مسافر کیلومتر به طول خطوط نیز نشان می‌دهد در سال مزبور عملکرد راه آهن جمهوری اسلامی ایران در حد میانگین 16 کشور مهم منطقه می باشد هرچند در مقایسه با متوسط دنیا عملکرد مناسبی نداریم.
با وجود تلاش بسیار زیاد مسؤولین و کارکنان شریف راه آهن، آمار و ارقام فوق و مقایسه آن با کشورهای منطقه نشان می‌دهد در صورت رفع گلوگاهها و برنامه‌ریزی و نظارت دقیق می‌توان از امکانات ریلی و آلات ناقله موجود استفاده مناسب تری به عمل آورد.

description.hltext_display: Hartford City Hamburglars sentenced to 50+ years in prison
description.content:
HARTFORD CITY -- To refer to Glen A. Reynard and Clayton J. Skinner as the Hartford City Hamburglars might actually be considered an insult to the fictional McDonald's character. In recent days, Reynard, 26, and Skinner, 33, were each sentenced to at least 50 years in prison in Blackford County Circuit Court for their involvement in the armed robbery and subsequent beating of a Hartford City McDonald's manager in April.
"I think Lady Justice won one in this particular case," said Matt Felver, Hartford City police chief. "It was a very, very long investigation and a lot of man hours went into it -- myself included -- and we had a pretty good outcome."
Skinner on Monday was sentenced to 50 years in prison after pleading guilty to burglary resulting in bodily injury, a Class A felony.
Reynard, meanwhile, also pleaded guilty on Friday to burglary resulting in bodily injury, but his use of a firearm in the holdup added five years to his sentence, which was set at 55 years.
Felver said Reynard and Skinner on April 2 entered the McDonald's through an outside cooler door and approached an assistant manager, who was reportedly closing the store.
Reynard held the employee at gunpoint and directed him to the safe. From that point, according to Felver, both Reynard and Skinner physically assaulted the employee and tied him up, leaving him battered in the cooler.
"This kid was terrorized, basically," Felver said. "It was unnecessary, in my opinion, to have the force that they used to commit this crime, especially with the level of resistance they got from this kid."
The standard sentence for a Class A felony is 30 years, but the court felt an additional 20 years were justified for the severity of the attack.
According to court documents, McDonald's reported more than $2,100 in total losses, including $1,484.74 stolen from the store and a combined $673.69 to pay for the manager's destroyed cell phone and counseling sessions.
In all, Reynard and Skinner stole $959.74 from the restaurant's safe, $425 in gift certificates and $100 in petty cash, according to court documents.
"We're thrilled about the outcome of the case," Felver said. "I can't say enough good about my guys and the sheriff's office and all the help we had, too."

description.hltext_display: Firms' direct financing edges up in November
description.content:
Korean companies' direct financing climbed 1.6 percent in November from the previous month as they increased stock issuance amid bullish market trading, the financial regulator said Wednesday.
Local firms raised a total of 10.5 trillion won ($9.1 billion) by selling stocks and bonds last month, compared with 10.3 trillion won in October, the Financial Supervisory Service (FSS) said in a monthly report.
"Thanks to a bullish stock market, companies, mostly smaller ones, expanded initial public offerings and right offerings," the FSS said.
Corporate bond sales also inched up slightly as interest rates remained low, it said.
Last month, local firms raised 679.6 billion won from share sales, up 29.3 percent on-month while their bond sales inched up 0.2 percent to 9.8 trillion won, the FSS noted.
The data comes as the country's stock market is widely expected to reclaim the previous peak and hit a new high down the road.
On Dec. 14, the benchmark stock index KOSPI closed above the 2,000 milestone for the first time since the outbreak of the recent global financial crisis, moving closer to the 2,064.85 peak posted on Oct. 31, 2007.

description.hltext_display: 《基金》ING：「雙印」崛起，明年首選新金磚五國
description.content:
全球金融市� �沉浸於量化寬鬆下的低利率環境，熱錢持續推升新興股市上揚，2011年將是「股優於債」� �局，新興單一國家股市最具爆發力。ING投信表示，今年在全球股市中表現最佳的印尼躍登金磚國家之列，與中國、俄羅斯、巴西和印度同列「新金磚五國」，分析未來兩年企業獲利成長幅度，由印度和印尼包辦「新金磚五國」前兩名，可謂最具股價成長空間的青春經濟體。 ING投信投資長黃媺芸表示，� �據EPFR/ Deutsche Bank統計(截至12月17日)，美債基金在上週大幅失血達總資產0.6%，創2008年以來最大流出幅度，至於新興市� �股票型基金則強力吸金達29週之久，創史上最長紀錄，顯示投資人對新興市� �偏好度愈來愈高。在新興市� �中又以印度最受外資青睞，今年以284.62億美元的買超金額位居外資資金流入榜首，金融海嘯後的金融版圖移轉和人口結構轉變，激勵印度企業獲利成長率逐年增長，市� �� �估將在明年出現26%的爆發性成長，2012年也有19.5%，大幅超越中國大陸，成為第一大金磚。 至於今年股市表現讓國際市� �驚豔的印尼，則被摩� �士丹利(Morgan Stanley)證券選為第五塊金磚，截至12月20日的漲幅達40.8%，在全球主要股市中名列前茅。黃媺芸指出，印尼這塊小金磚讓原本的金磚四國不再專美於前，明、後兩年都有17%的企業獲利成長率，股價續漲空間可期，而ING投信也是國內投信業者中，唯一完整擁有「新金磚五國」單一國家基金的業者。
ING印度潛力基金經理人葉菀婷表示，印度今年經濟成長率� �估8.6%、企業獲利成長率29.7%，惟股價漲幅不大，與印度屢次升息抗通膨有關，統計年初至今的累計升息幅度達八碼，但「搶先一步的智慧」已讓印度在經濟和物價壓力之間已取得平衡，最新公佈的11月份躉售物價指數年增率下滑至7.48%，為新金磚五國中唯一物價獲得控制而下滑的國家。此外，印度央行上週三召開利率決策會議，宣佈維持附買回利率和附賣回利率於6.25%和5.25%水準不變，首度暫停升息步伐，未來一季應不會調整利率，印股有落後補漲空間。
葉菀婷指出，外資年初至今累計淨買超金額仍有284.62億美元的高水準，是外資最愛的市� �，主要著眼於印度年輕勞動人口和龐大內需市� �。� �據聯合國世界人口統計(資料日期：2010年)，印度0~14歲的年輕人口高達32%，未來十年的新增勞動人口數將高達1.36億人，對於該國生產力將大有貢獻，且國民平均年齡仍將低於30歲，年輕人口勇於消費，特殊的經濟結構亦創� 貧窮式創新，包括全球最便宜的手機及塔塔汽車都在印度誕生，而這也是印度商機與眾不同的主要原� 。股價創新高忘了回� �，印尼榮登最耀眼小金磚 在金融海嘯後，印尼股市率先於2010年創歷史新高，讓國際市� �刮目相看。ING印尼潛力基金經理人紀晶心表示，從新鑽11國、靈貓六國到金磚第五國，印尼的投資價值獲得外資一致肯定，除了和印度同樣是人口結構年輕的大國外，印尼還有豐富原物料題材。明年印尼企業獲利成長更具持續上揚空間，在整體政經環境安定下，外人投資金額攀升，且2011年企業發行新股將有減稅優� ，� 上二、三線城鎮發展快速，印尼明年企業獲利成長更具持續上揚空間。� �據麥� �里證券估計，明年的印尼企業股東權益� �酬率(ROE)將達27.3%，不僅是東南亞國家之� ，更居新金磚五國之首。 紀晶心指出，1997年底的印尼信評為BBB+，股市本益比約20~25倍，在東南亞金融風暴和金融海嘯衝擊後，印尼股市再創新高，但本益比卻僅18倍(截至2010/12/13)，顯示印尼股市仍有價值重估空間。此外，穆迪(Moody’s)國際信評機構� �估於明年初調升印尼主權評等至投資等級，屆時可望吸引上百億外資流入，不僅股市有機會再創新高，連印尼盾也可望回到1998年金融風暴前水準。

description.hltext_display: Golf Accessories—Your Guide
description.content:
Golf is one sport that has become popular to a lot of people all over the world. It has helped to prosper the career of some of the most famous personalities in sports like Tiger Woods. Playing golf has become a hobby to most people. A lot of them really find this fun and exciting. Golf courses are filled with a lot of enthusiasts who just want to enjoy a time of their life. In this sport, you may need to buy some accessories and tools to be able to play well. At first, it will not be that simple to choose among the types and variety that you will see in the market. Confusion will surely set in and you will be challenged to pick those that you will have. There are some tips that you need to keep in your mind for you to be guided on the things that you have to consider. You surely need beginner golf clubs.
GOLF CLUBS
It is very important that you only get the golf clubs that you will need for you to play well. There are some stores that sell golf clubs in sets too. A golf club set is good for those who do not want to spend time searching for each type of club that he may need. But you can also buy golf clubs that you only want to have. There are Iron and Woods that you will find in the market today. The size of the golf clubs must be determined first. Standard sized ones are available in the market. Get a junior golf clubs.
PUTTER
A putter is one type of club that you can have based on personal choice. You may use different designs and shapes that you can find in the market. In order for you to buy the one that you really need, you have to test it in the store before you buy it.
GOLF BALLS
Golf balls come in different designs. You need to make sure that you will be able to choose one that matches your skill level and your gender. There are golf balls that are covered by surlyn and are filled by rubber core. There are those that are made of 3 layers too.
GOLF BAGS
You need to make sure that you keep your things organized as you play the sport. There a lot of accessories and tools that you bring all the time. Get a bag that can help you organize your things. Determine the number of accessories and tools that you will bring so that you will be able to buy the bag that can surely accommodate all the things that you may need like towels, balls, gloves and a lot of things.
It is very important that you know what accessories you will buy for you to play golf well. Make sure that you will be careful in choosing golf accessories. The tips mentioned will guide you in the choices that you will make. Keep them in mind all the time so that you will be guided well with your choices.

description.hltext_display: Why you must conduct a SWOT analysis for your wholesale business
description.content:
A SWOT (Strength, Weakness, Opportunities and Threats) analysis is a powerful tool and technique for understanding and improving the wholesale business. It is a powerful tool that must be utilized to its fullest to improve your wholesale business. Let's describe few techniques how a wholesaler can use it fully in the business and why it is extremely important to conduct a SWOT analysis.
The main and basic purpose of SWOT analysis is to be honest when stating the strengths and weaknesses of the business and discovering opportunities and threats. Strengths and weaknesses are the internal while opportunities and threats are external factors. SWOT analysis is important in determining the captured skills and expertise to mitigate the risks in favor of your wholesale business. It allows wholesalers to develop techniques and layout plans in several orders to achieve success.
Being in a wholesale business means you are having many competitors and many choices of resources, suppliers and distributors around you and you will have to grow your business remaining within this competition and selecting the best for your wholesale business. This analytical tool is powerful as it unveils the opportunities that you can avail and by managing the threats you can overcome the weaknesses that will remain unaddressed otherwise. It continuously updates the business system. That is why in real sense it makes you the best. This practical framework helps you in developing a business strategy regarding your wholesale products and services that will be competitive and give you extra edge as compared to your competitors.
SWOT analysis gives a deep insight in your business and allows you to grow your business. Growth and expansion gives you the feeling of improvement and capability to march ahead your competitors. You can learn more about the competition of the market around you and develop your work plan accordingly. Make a list of what must be done and what should not be and what will be your next step to keep yourself up to the mark and what value addition can be done in your wholesale products.
In beating the competition, it is not the only important thing to know what your goal is. Instead it is equally important to know what different steps to reach that goal are and what your competitors are doing to reach that point. At this point, you can decide what kind of marketing tactics you can use and what kind of management is required for your business. A realistic SWOT analysis gives you an obvious future reading ability. When you can foresee threats, measure weaknesses and strengths and plan to act according to the opportunities, isn't it a superpower to see the future? Plan what is happening and what is about to come.
These four things can readily let you achieve success through specific strategic planning and consistent working. Major wholesale companies always include SWOT analysis in their strategic planning to get success in wholesale business.

Warum? Weil es jetzt echte Unterstützung gibt: NICOBLOC hilft, die Verführung durch den Glimmstengel leichter zu stoppen. Das Prinzip ist denkbar einfach. Nicobloc blockiert schädliche Substanzen! In der ersten Woche wird ein Tropfen auf den Filter aufgebracht - etwa 33 % Nikotin und Teer werden zurückgehalten. In der zweiten Woche mit 2 Tropfen bereits 66 % und ab der dritten Woche beträgt die Reduktion mit 3 Tropfen bereits 99 Prozent! Endlich eine "Unterstützung" (Nicobloc aus der Apotheke) die tatsächlich hilft, dass gute Vorsätze Wirklichkeit werden! description.hltext_display: DigniCap may help cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy keep hair
description.content:
A new frozen gel-filled cap- called DigniCap-may one day help cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy prevent hair loss.
According to Msnbc.com, four patients in the US are trying out the DigniCap-a hat that contains a cooling gel and fits tightly on the head.
During the treatment, the gel chills the hair follicles, thus restricting the amount of chemotherapy that reaches them.
Heather Millar of San Francisco, one of the patients trying out the experimental treatment, managed to retain most of her hair despite the fact that she's already had three chemotherapy sessions. "I think that if women knew about this, there would be a total stampede," the New York Daily News quoted Millar, as writing on her blog 'My Left Breast.' Some women who are anxious that they will lose their hair decide to either skip or delay chemotherapy, or they choose a treatment that is not as effective, said to Hope S Rugo, of the UCSF Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Care Center. "It's torture for the women. Patients will say to me, 'I know this sounds stupid, it seems so much like my vanity, but the thing I'm most worried about is losing my hair,'" said Rugo. The DigniCap, made by Dignitana in Lund, Sweden, is part of a trial limited to patients whose breast cancer is in the early stages.
Patients wearing the caps, in which the gel is cooled to -30 Celsius, are instructed to change the caps frequently during and after their treatments and sometimes switch caps 15 times during a treatment so that the proper scalp temperature is maintained.
Keeping the scalp cool causes the blood vessels around the hair roots to contract, so that the hair follicles don't get such a big amount of chemo drugs.

description.hltext_display: Casillas: "Chcem pokračovať na víťaznej vlne"
description.content:
Dnes 09:27 - MADRID
Zdroj: Šport.sk,pet, Foto: ilustračné
Na klubovej úrovni síce čaká brankár Realu Madrid Iker Casillas na ďalšie cenné úspechy, takže svoje destské sny si aj v tomto roku plnil v španielskej reprezentácii.
Dva roky potom ako zdvíhal nad hlavu trofej za titul európskeho majstra, ukoristila "La Roja" premiérový titul na majstrovstvách sveta v Juhoafrickej republike. V rozhovore pre FIFA Casillas hovorí o historickom úspechu Španielska na svetovom šampionáte, svojich cieľoch do budúcnosti a ambíciách s Realom Madrid.
Čoskoro budú známe výsledky ankety o Zlatú loptu FIFA 2010 (FIFA Ballon d’Or 2010). Kto je podľa vás najväčším favoritom na prvenstvo?
"Myslím, že je to férové, ak poviem, že by to mal byť španielsky futbalista. Španieli sú v posledných dvoch rokoch v móde. Na túto anketu majú značný vplyv výkony na svetovom šampionáte, takže ako to nezíska Španiel teraz, tak potom neviem."
Aj vaše meno figurovalo na užšom zozname kandidátov, ale brankár ešte nikdy nezískal toto ocenenie. Čo myslíte, prečo je to tak?
"Hráč v poli má vždy väčšiu šancu vyhrať v tejto ankete ako brankár. Chápem to, pretože futbal je o pohybe, pasoch, nahrávkach, góloch a medzihre, práve to sa počíta. Neviem, možnom sme my brankári čierne ovce futbalu (smiech...). V tomto smere sme odpísaní."
Na ceste za cennou trofejou na 2010 inkasovalo Španielsko najmenej gólov. Takže by ste si zaslúžili to ocenenie....
"Hrali sme svoju hru, to platí aj o hráčoch z defenzívy. Je veľmi dôležité, keď obrana hrá spoľahlivo a nedovolí súperovi vytvárať si šance."
„Teší ma fakt, že sme vďaka historickému úspechu urobili šťastných milióny ľudí.“
kapitán Španielska, úradujúcich majstrov sveta a Európy Iker Casillas
Španielski stredopoliari a útočníci dostali už množstvo chvály, ale dosahujú aj obrancovia takú úroveň?
"Rozhodne sú veľmi talentovaní a tiež je to skôr mix mladých a starších hráčov, ktorý funguje dobre. Myslím, že dôležité je to, že si všetci navzájom pomáhajú."
Ako útočník však David Villa nebol na MS v JAR najlepším kanonierom a nezískal tak ocenenie “Adidas Zlatá kopačka“...
„Áno, zrejme hlavne preto, lebo nepremenil penaltu proti Honduras. Je to skvelý hráč. Dal celkovo na turnaji päť gólov, vrátane niektorých veľmi dôležitých a bol veľkým prínosom pre Španielsko. ´El Guaje´ (Dieťa) odviedol skvelú prácu pre tím ´La Roja´ a musíme mu za to poďakovať.“
Od sezóny 2007/08 ste sa prakticky nezastavili, ste v jednom kolotoči. S Realom Madrid hráte vo všetkých možných súťažiach, vyhrali ste EURO 2008, štartovali na Pohári konfederácií FIFA a triumfovali na majstrovstvách sveta. Necítite sa unavený?
„Je to samozrejme náročné stále sa držať na úrovni, pretože som mal veľmi krátke dovolenky za posledné tri roky. Ale keď dostane 15-20 dní voľna, myseľ sa uvolní a potom ste pripravený do toho opäť naskočiť. Baví ma táto skvelá práca, jednoducho niekedy si užívate privilégia, inokedy zasa musíte niečo obetovať. Dúfam, že budúci rok bude trochu pokojnejší.“
V akom smere zmenil váš život európskeho a svetového titulu?
"To vás zmení, pretože ľudia vás poznajú všade, kam vkročíte a hovoria vám na ulici milé veci. Teší ma fakt, že sme vďaka historickému úspechu urobili šťastných milióny ľudí.“
To musí byť úžasný pocit byť kapitánom španielskej reprezentácie...
"Áno, to je. Je potešením robiť kapitána v tomto mužstve, pretože máme skvelých hráčov a môžem byť súčasťou tejto slávnej kapitoly španielskeho futbalu. Ešte v nedávnych rokoch zažíval španielsky futbal na vrcholných podujatiach jedno sklamanie za druhým. Niekedy sa to muselo zmeniť, a my sme to zmenili teraz.“
Na čo najradšej spomínate v súvislosti s MS 2010 v JAR?
"Že sme boli ako tím. Na samotnú atmosféru a zlé chvíle, ktorými sme si prešli po prehre so Švajčiarskom. Všetci vraveli, že sme favoriti na celkovo víťazstvo a zrazu sa znieslo množstvo kritiky. My sme sa však nereagovali, zostali sme koncentrovaní a pomaly sme nastúpili na svoju cestu. Po celom svete sa dá futbalom vyhrať množstvo trofejí, ale žiadna nie je ako táto z MS.“
Mimochodom, boli ste sklamaný z výkonu, ktorý predviedlo Holandsko vo finále?
"Nie, vôbec. Holandsko odohralo fantastický turnaj a hrali kvalitný futbal. Problémom bolo, že narazili na španielsky tím, ktorý vedel ako dominovať pri držaní lopty a oni sa museli snažiť to nejakým spôsobom zastaviť. To bol ich spôsob, ako sa s tým chceli vyrovnať, ale príliš im to nefungovalo.“
Čo okrem španielskeho úspechu ešte zaujalo vašu pozornosť na svetovom šampionáte v JAR?
„Tím Nemecka. Myslím, že majú veľmi silné mužstvo a disponujú aj kvalitnými mladými hráčmi. Na finálový turnaj prišli dobre pripravený, čo dokázali aj v zápasoch s Anglickom a Argentínou. Ešte ich v najbližších rokoch veľa úspechov.“
A kto vás sklamal v Juhoafrickej republike?
"Francúzsko, kvôli spôsobu akým sa prezentovali a potom Taliansko, ktoré tiež skončilo v skupinovej fáze. Fakt, že dvaja finalisti MS 2006 išli domov tak skoro domov, je len dôkazom ako rýchlo sa veci vo futbale môžu zmeniť. A to sa môže stať aj iným mužstvám.“

description.hltext_display: Hokies hope not to be rusty after Holidays in Miami
description.content:
Virginia Tech quarterback Tyrod Taylor, the ACC offensive player of the year, scrambles for extra yardage.
» 0 Comments | Post a Comment
BLACKSBURG — In terms of timing and execution, Virginia Tech’s football team couldn’t have asked for a better offensive performance in the Dec. 4 ACC Championship game against Florida State. The Hokies rolled up 442 total yards and didn’t turn the ball over in a 44-33 win.
But almost a full month will pass between No. 12 Tech’s pasting of FSU and its Orange Bowl clash with No. 5 Stanford on Jan. 3 at Sun Life Stadium in Miami Gardens, Fla.
Such a long layoff could certainly have an effect on the Hokies’ offensive rhythm.
"In some regards, you’d like to go out there and continue to play (as soon as possible) and maintain that (timing) aspect of it," Tech offensive coordinator Bryan Stinespring said. "What’s important is we get back out on this (practice) field right now and we seize that energy level, we seize that competition level and make sure we’re not just out there working out the kinks."
Tech has taken bowl preparation much more seriously in recent years, and that newfound approach in practice has certainly had a positive effect in the games.
The Hokies had lost four out of five bowl games from 2003-08 when they decided to change things up back in 2008.
Since then, they’ve practiced more and with more intensity leading up to their bowl games. And the result has been back-to-back convincing postseason victories – a 37-14 win over Tennessee in last year’s Chick-fil-A Bowl and a 20-7 victory over Cincinnati in the Orange Bowl following the 2008 season.
More bowl practices and more intensity in drills has translated into better offensive production the last few years. Against both Tennessee and Cincinnati, the Hokies offense found its rhythm early and used balanced and disciplined play to bury its opponents.
The Hokies had 438 total yards (229 rushing, 209 passing) and only one turnover in last season’s win over the Volunteers, and they put up 398 total yards (258 rushing, 140 passing) and only one turnover against the Bearcats the year before.
Tech’s offense has been able to perform despite long layoffs the last two years. That’s a very encouraging sign for this year’s offensive unit, which was performing at its very best the last month of the season.
That was especially true of senior quarterback Tyrod Taylor, the ACC’s Player of the Year who has gone four games — 107 straight pass attempts — since throwing his last interception.
As long as he is playing well and he and his receivers still have their timing down, Tech’s offense should be just fine.
The extra work in bowl preparation will go a long way in helping the Hokies maintain that rhythm.
Tech coach Frank Beamer and his staff have made sure his players have been working hard in an effort to prepare for the Cardinal. The Hokies practiced six straight days from Dec. 16-21. They’ll get some time off for Christmas break before reconvening in South Florida on Dec. 28.
Once down there, Tech will put in a normal practice week from Dec. 29-Jan. 2.
"I can remember my freshman year (in 2007) just having more days off," Taylor said. "And when we did practice, the seniors got a couple days off. I guess it was just too much rest time.
"The following year when we played Cincinnati, we stayed here (in Blacksburg) longer and practiced more and everyone practiced. Seniors didn’t get a day off, so we treated everyone the same. So I think that helped us stay together and have a good time together."
Bowl trips are fun for the players and coaches, but they’re much more gratifying when they include a win.
"You always want it to be a reward for a great season … but the real reward I’ve found is being able to win the game," Beamer said. "Then you don’t have to answer those questions (about bowl losses) at all those Hokie Club meetings."

description.hltext_display: 《社會》立委提案要求，教育部訂反霸凌專法
Mail pickup Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve
description.author: The Union staff
description.content: Still need to send that special gift to a friend or relative miles away? Post offices in western Nevada County will be open Christmas Eve, Friday, Dec. 24, and New Years Eve, Friday, Dec. 31. Holiday hours will be posted at each post office, and check the hours, as some post offices will close at 12 p.m. For specific post office hours, visit www.usps.com or call (800) ASK-USPS. Outgoing mail should be placed in blue collection mailboxes before 12 p.m. for early pickup Christmas Eve and New Years Eve. Customers using the postal services later that day are encouraged to contact their local postmaster for pickup information. Post offices will be closed Saturday, Dec. 25, and Saturday, Jan. 1. Express mail will only be delivered on Christmas Day and New Year's Day in most metropolitan areas. Post Offices will resume regular operating hours on Monday, Dec. 27 and Monday, Jan. 3. Copyright 2010 The Union. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. The Union December, 21 2010 7:18 pm MST

description.hltext_display: La Copa cierra el 'annus mirabilis' de nuestro fútbol con un Madrid-Levante como partido estrella
description.author: Diariocrítico
description.content:
Cinco partidos de la ida de los octavos de final de la Copa del Rey cierran este miércoles el curso futbolístico 2010, con diez equipos ansiosos por terminar con victoria y afrontar las vacaciones con tranquilidad, sobre todo el Real Madrid que no quiere que la marejada haga zozobrar al equipo antes de las fiestas navideñas.
Durante los cinco meses que llevan de temporada José Mourinho ha sido el protagonista indiscutible del equipo blanco y en el cierre el año no podía ser menos, aunque en este caso lo será por su silencio, ya que, tras su polémica rueda de prensa del pasado domingo, este martes cedió su asiento en la sala de prensa a Aitor Karanka, sin ofrecer explicaciones para este cambio.
De esta forma, la noticia es la ausencia de noticia, ya que el vasco, que se sentó en el banquillo cuando el luso estuvo lesionados, algo que no sucederá ante el Levante, se ha limitado a asegurar que no existe problema alguno y que en lo único que piensan es en estar en Cibeles.
Así, lo único destacable son las bajas para el partido en el que los blancos buscan dar su primer paso hacia cuartos. Mourinho sólo da descanso a Sergio Ramos, que forzó para estar ante el Sevilla, y cuenta con todos los disponibles, además de los canteranos Pacheco, Juanfran y Morata.
Por su parte, el Levante llegará al Santiago Bernabéu con la intención de dar la 'campanada', a sabiendas de que el objetivo es complicado debido al nivel del equipo rival. En el caso de no conseguirlo, la premisa que es han marcado los jugadores que entrena Luis García es anotar al menos un gol en el feudo madridista.
El preparador levantinista no podrá contar los lesionados de larga duración, ni con el portero Reina, que finalmente no se ha recuperado de sus molestias. El que finalmente sí que ha entrado en la lista de 21 convocados es el delantero Felipe Caicedo. El técnico podría dar minutos a los menos habituales, ya que considera que el equipo no baja el nivel por la igualdad que existe en la plantilla azulgrana.
El Sevilla, vigente campeón, recibe al Málaga en uno de los peores momentos de los últimos años, sin conocer la victoria en los últimos siete compromisos entre Liga BBVA y Europa League, y con la necesidad imperiosa de salir de esa dinámica negativa, ante un conjunto de Manuel Pellegrini que tampoco encuentra la manera de corregir el mal juego de los suyos, y que ocupa actualmente uno de los puestos de descenso a la Liga Adelante.
El equipo de Gregorio Manzano no tiene otra que conseguir una victoria a costa de un rival teóricamente propicio y ante su público, que comienza a perder la fe en que se cumplan los objetivos marcados, pero que, a la vez, tiene en la campaña pasada el precedente de una temporada irregular que puede resultar exitosa gracias a la Copa del Rey.
Los malagueños, a la espera de la llegada de refuerzos en el mercado invernal, tratarán de poner las cosas difíciles en un Sánchez Pizjuán que se les da especialmente bien. No obstante, la preocupación por la situación liguera puede suponer una losa en la moral de los albiazules.
Por su parte, el Atlético de Madrid y el Espanyol se ven las caras en un duelo al que ambos llegan con trayectorias diferentes, ya que si los madrileños se reencontraron con el triunfo este fin de semana, los barceloneses vieron cortado su gran momento con una goleada en el derbi ante el FC Barcelona.
Los de Quique Sánchez Flores se aferran a la Copa del Rey después de caer eliminados en la primera fase de la Europa League, conscientes de que esta competición y la Liga BBVA son ahora sus únicos objetivos tras el traspié continental.
Y es que el Atlético, con la duda de Diego Forlán, inmerso en un estado febril, aspira a repetir presencia finalista como hiciera este año y para ello debe empezar tomándose la revancha de finales de noviembre cuando cayó por 2-3.
El Espanyol encara el viaje al Vicente Calderón con las ganas de olvidar la derrota del pasado sábado en el derbi contra el Barça (1-5) repitiendo su gran partido de aquél día, una de sus pocas actuaciones brillantes a domicilio en esta campaña.
Pochettino viajará pendiente de Manu Molina, que entrena con una protección nasal tras su fractura del tabique y con las bajas de Javi López, a pesar de estar recuperado de su lesión en el recto anterior izquierdo, y de Aldo Duscher, que el lunes viajó a Argentina para asistir al funeral de un familiar.
EL BETIS QUIERE SEGUIR SOÑANDO
Además, el Betis, líder destacado de la Liga Adelante, y cuya única derrota como local esta temporada fue, precisamente, en la Copa del Rey frente al Zaragoza (0-1), recibe al Getafe con la intención de conseguir, en esta ocasión, un buen resultado en la ida ante el equipo de Míchel que se encuentra en su mejor momento de la temporada, tras obtener cuatro victorias seguidas en Liga BBVA.
Los hombres de Pepe Mel, después dejar en la cuneta a un conjunto de la máxima categoría, buscarán repetir éxito con la ayuda de la gran pegada de la que están haciendo gala en la 'categoría de plata', donde son los máximos anotadores, con 11 dianas de ventaja sobre el segundo en este apartado. Sin embargo, la principal estrella verdiblanca, el camerunés Achille Emaná, se perderá el encuentro debido a los problemas que arrastra en su tobillo.
Para el Getafe, el choque se presenta importante de cara a seguir avanzando en un torneo donde ha ofrecido grandes prestaciones en los últimos años con las dos finales perdidas ante Sevilla (2007) y Valencia (2008), y las semifinales del año pasado, por lo que apostará por un buen once para acabar del mejor modo posible un gran año.
Los de Míchel llegan en una línea ascendente de juego y resultados, y a su buen momento victorioso esperan unir un buen resultado en el Benito Villamarín donde desean repetir su actuación en casa del gran rival de la ciudad de los béticos, con el triunfo por 1-3 en el Sánchez Pizjuán. En cinco visitas al Betis, cuando ambos coincidieron en Primera, el 'Geta' ha marcado siempre, salvo en una ocasión (2005-2006 --1-0--), logrando una victoria, dos empates y dos derrotas.
El Almería, que atraviesa un momento difícil tras volver a fallar como local, y caer ante el Getafe (2-3) en un partido en el que se dejaron remontar una diferencia de dos goles, recibe al Mallorca de Laudrup, que se encuentra en mejor situación pese a caer en casa del Villarreal (1-3) la jornada pasada.
Los hombres de Oltra tratarán de repetir victoria en el Estadio de los Juegos Mediterráneos, algo que esta temporada sólo han conseguido en Copa del Rey, frente a la Real Sociedad. Con ello, buscarán dar una alegría a su afición y obtener un resultado positivo que les ayude a olvidar las malas sensaciones ligueras.
El equipo bermellón quiere avanzar en una competición en la que, visto el rendimiento que está ofreciendo en Liga BBVA ante los equipos grandes, puede tener mucho que decir. Y es que Laudrup ha compuesto un equipo difícil de superar y que se crece en los partidos complicados.
MIÉRCOLES 22.
Betis-Getafe. Ayza Gámez (C. Valenciano) 20.00 horas.
Almería-Mallorca. F. Teixeira Vitienes (C. Cántabro) 20.00 horas.
Sevilla-Málaga. Iturralde González (C. Vasco) 20.00 horas.
Atlético-Espanyol. Fernández Borbalán (C. Andaluz) 20.00 horas.
Real Madrid-Levante. Turiezo Álvarez (C. Cast-León) 22.00 horas.

description.hltext_display: Pinellas gets ready to celebrate 2011
description.content:
Plenty of things left to do in the final days of 2010, including making plans to celebrate the New Year.
First Night St. Petersburg
ST. PETERSBURG – Touted as the state’s largest New Year’s Eve celebration, the city of St. Petersburg will celebrate its 17th annual First Night St. Petersburg on Friday, Dec. 31, 5 p.m. to midnight at multiple venues in downtown St. Petersburg.
The event features family-oriented festivities with music stages, entertainment, drama, dance, games, art and fireworks. Tickets are $10 for adults, $5 for children ages 6 to 12. Call 823-8906 or visit www.firstnightstpete.com.
Participants will find programs and presentations such as Great Explorations’ Bubble Blast, 7-11:30 p.m., at South Straub Park, Beach Drive Northeast, between First and Second avenues; St. Petersburg Opera, 7:30 and 9:30 p.m., at St. Peter’s Cathedral, 140 Fourth St. N.; Joe Hall Louisiana Cane Cutters, 8 to 11:30 p.m., at the Plaza Courtyard, 111 Second Ave. N.; and Tampa Bay Steel Drum Orchestra, 7 to 11:30 p.m., at the Museum of Fine Arts Colonnade, 255 Beach Drive NE.
Headlining the event will be Michael Lynche, performing 11 p.m. to midnight, in North Straub Park, on Beach Drive between Third and Fifth avenues.
Salute to Vienna
CLEARWATER – A Clearwater tradition, the Strauss Symphony of America will present Salute to Vienna on Friday, Dec. 31, 8 p.m., at Ruth Eckerd Hall, 1111 N. McMullen Booth Road. Guests will celebrate the New Year with this sensational performance inspired by Vienna’s world-famous New Year’s Concert. Tickets start at $42. Call 791-7400 or visit www.rutheckerdhall.com.
The show will bring the same splendor, charm and beauty to North America. Attendees will fall in love with Vienna’s “Waltz King,” Johann Strauss Jr., in this unforgettable and uplifting performance of music, song and dance.
The production features a cast of more than 75 musicians, European singers and magnificent dancers and a new program showcasing operetta excerpts, popular waltzes, polkas and marches.
Christian Schulz of Vienna will conduct. The cast also includes Beatrix Lazin, soprano, Budapest; Joachim Moser, tenor, Vienna; and dancers from the Kiev-Aniko Ballet of Ukraine and International Ballroom Dance Champions.
New Year’s Eve Gala
PINELLAS PARK – A New Year’s Eve Gala will be presented Friday, Dec. 31, 8 p.m., at the German American Society, 8098 66th St. N. Guests will ring in the New Year with a high energy performance by Sepp and Heinze on accordion and zither. The event will include music, dance, champagne toast, balloon drop and lentil soup. Tickets are $25. Dress is semi-formal. Doors and cash bar will open at 8 p.m. The band will begin playing at 9 p.m. Guests may bring snacks. Call 548-5234 or visit germanamericansociety-st.petersburg.com.
Gulfport’s New Year’s Eve celebration
GULFPORT – There will be a New Year’s Eve Celebration Friday, Dec. 31, at Gulfport Casino Ballroom, 5500 Shore Blvd. S. Doors will open at 7:30 p.m. Dancing will run from 8 p.m. to 12:30 a.m. The event will feature champagne toast, snacks, party favors, prizes, dance demonstration and full cash bar. Cost is $20. Call 893-1070.
Swingin’ in the New Year
ST. PETERSBURG – Swing Time and Swing Gang will present Swingin’ the New Year, a New Year’s Eve celebration, on Friday, Dec. 31, at the St. Petersburg Coliseum, 535 Fourth Ave. N. Doors will open at 7:30 p.m. The evening will include music, dancing and celebration 9 p.m. to 1 a.m. with a midnight countdown and balloon drop, dance performances, a vintage fashion photo shoot and contest, party favors and chocolates and prize giveaways. There will be an introduction to swing dancing from 8 to 9 p.m. Tickets are $24 in advance or $29 the day of the event. Call 669-7830 or visit www.tampabayswing.com.
Masquerade ball
ST. PETERSBURG – Revelers will enjoy a masquerade ball Friday, Dec. 31, 9 p.m. to 3 a.m., at Scene Premium Night Club, 211 Third St. S. The event will include a champagne toast and balloon drop at midnight and complimentary party masks, horns and a breakfast buffet. Cost is $15. Call 269-9345 or visit www.scenenightclub.com.
Aqua-Eve
TAMPA – The Aqua-Eve New Year’s Eve Party will be Friday, Dec. 31, 9 p.m. to 1 a.m., at The Florida Aquarium, 701 Channelside Drive. The event will feature food, beer and wine; live entertainment and a dazzling view of fireworks, underwater wonders housed in the 250,000-square-foot aquarium and a champagne toast at midnight.
Entertainment will include performances by the Lounge Cat Band, Inspire Entertainment and Casey Stidham. Cost is $100 for adults. For $160, attendees can enjoy both the party and a boat cruise around the channel, viewing the fireworks on the water. Boarding will begin at 10:45 p.m. and the cruise will leave the dock at 11:30 p.m. Call 813-273-4568 or visit www.flaquarium.org.
Outback Bowl Beach Day
CLEARWATER - Outback Bowl Beach Day is Thursday, Dec. 30, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m., at the Clearwater Beach Resort next to Pier 60, 400 Mandalay Ave. on Clearwater Beach. Outback Bowl teams, marching bands and cheerleaders will be out enjoying the sun and local beaches. The day includes live music, skydivers a tug-of-war and more. For more information, call 461-3222.
Holiday Poinsettia Tree
ST. PETERSBURG - Sunken Garden’s Holiday Poinsettia Tree remains on display through Jan. 1. View the 15-foot tall tree and 360 flowers on display. Price is $10 for two guests and a pet; $20 for four guests and a pet. Sunken Gardens is at 1825 Fourth St. N. in St. Petersburg. Call 551-3100 for more information.
Holiday Lights in the Gardens
LARGO - Holiday Lights in the Gardens continues through Jan. 2, 5:30 to 9:30 p.m. at Florida Botanical Gardens, 12520 Ulmerton Road, Largo. The 10th anniversary of the Florida Botanical Gardens is being celebrated this year, starting with the season of Holiday Lights in the Gardens, the premier Pinellas County community tradition for visitors and residents to enjoy. The Gardens’ transformation into the holiday wonderland with more than 425,000 LED twinkling lights is a free celebration to children under 12 with a $2 donation requested of adults. This annual event is sponsored by the Florida Botanical Gardens Foundation. Call 727-582-2100 for more information.
Holiday Decorations in the Village
LARGO - Heritage Village presents a festive display of trees and decorations during the month of December. The village is open Wednesday to Saturday, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m., and Sunday, 1 to 4 p.m. Heritage Village is at 11909 125th St. N., Largo. The historic homes are decorated true to their time period, locality and lifestyle, ranging from an elaborately decorated Victorian home to a simply adorned 1852 log cabin. Be sure and save time for unique shopping at the beach Cottage Gift Shop. Closed Dec. 24, 25, 31 and Jan. 1. Visit www.pinellascounty.org/heritage or call 727-582-2123 for more information.
Article published on Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010

description.hltext_display: Chinese population in S. Korea tops 600,000
description.content:
The Chinese population in South Korea topped 600,000 for the first time last month, accounting for nearly half of all foreigners in the country, the Justice Ministry said Wednesday.
As of the end of November, 606,408 Chinese nationals, including illegal immigrants and those on short- and long-term stays, were living here, making up 48 percent of some 1.25 million foreign residents, the ministry said.
The tally at the end of October was about 597,000.
Chinese nationals of Korean descent accounted for two thirds of the total, numbering 404,000 last month.
The majority of the Chinese residents, or 87 percent, had legal justification to live here, while the rest were illegal immigrants.
The Chinese also took up large portions of marriage immigrants and visitors to South Korea. Of some 140,000 marriage immigrants in the country, 66,000, or 47 percent, were Chinese, including about 31,000 of Korean descent.
The number of Chinese visitors rose sharply this year, helped by an easing of visa regulations, and hovered around 1.62 million as of the end of November, marking a 44 percent increase from the same period last year.
Chinese students also accounted for three quarters of all foreign students in the country, numbering 67,000.
The second-largest foreign community was that of U.S. citizens, with 128,000 residents, while Vietnamese, Filipinos and the Japanese rounded out the other top five nationalities.

New Computer for Christmas? Keep Your Kids Safe with PC Pandora...
description.content:
What parents tend to forget is that these high tech toys aren’t necessarily for kids... It’s your job to make sure you are keeping your kids safe from predators and not enabling a cyberbully.
Las Vegas, NV (Vocus/PRWEB) December 22, 2010
It’s no secret that our kids live their lives fully immersed in a digital world. With Christmas just days away, it is more important than ever for parents to take the necessary steps to make sure this year’s ‘big gift’ doesn’t open Pandora’s box.
Despite the warnings from experts against giving a child their own computer, a teenager having their own PC is an unavoidable reality today. Times have changed; school work very often requires a computer and there is immense pressure from peers to be socially active online.
“What parents tend to forget is that these high tech toys aren’t necessarily for kids,” explains Jamie Leasure, co-founder of Pandora Corp. “A computer that can connect to the Internet can connect your child with the rest of the world… and visa versa. That’s not something that should be shrugged off. It’s your job to make sure you are keeping your kids safe from Internet predators and not enabling a cyberbully.”
Pandora Corp., makers of PC Pandora monitoring software, is reminding parents to be smart when giving teens and even younger children their own computer this holiday season. Parents must adopt and enforce a new set of rules, such as leaving the door open and a “no Internet after __” time. Also, visiting a child’s room often when they are online and asking them questions about what websites they are visiting and who their online friends are needs to become standard family practice.
“In addition, as you get ready to give them the ‘big gift’ this year, make sure it is outfitted with the proper parental control and monitoring software,” says Leasure. “Tools like our PC Pandora make it easy to find that safe, happy medium between teens being able to freely use the Internet socially, and parents being able to keep their kids safe from Internet predators and out of trouble.”
PC Pandora is computer monitoring software that records all user activity on a computer. First-rate monitoring capabilities take sequential snapshots of everything that happens on the screen, allowing parents to see first-hand everything their child does both on and offline. Further details of user activity are made available in text-based files and easy-to-read charts, including websites visited, instant messenger chats, emails sent and received, peer-2-peer files shared, keystrokes logged, programs accessed, Internet search queries and more. The IRIS feature will send those text-based files right to a parent’s email, and the PC Pandora LIVE! add-on allows parents to check screenshots and adjust parental controls though a secure web login – an invaluable feature for working parents who can’t always be home when their kids are online.
“PC Pandora is essentially a DVR for your child’s computer,” says Leasure. “If your child is talking to strangers on social networks, creating and maintaining multiple social network profiles, visiting websites you don’t approve of, downloading illegal music and movies, or falling victim to or – even worse – acting as a cyberbully, you will know about it if you are monitoring their internet activity.”
As a special promotion for the holidays, the company is offering the software at a discounted price. Parents can use the code ‘holiday2010’ at the pcpandora.com store to get $20 off their purchase.
About PC Pandora: Pandora Corporation was formed with one goal – to help our customers monitor, control and protect their families and themselves online. First released in mid 2005, PC Pandora has been constantly upgraded to industry-leading specifications and has received accolades from users, reviewers and even school districts and law enforcement agencies, who use the program to help in the day-to-day supervision of the children and citizens they are charged with protecting. The company website devotes space to helping parents by providing them with 18 Tips to Safe Surfing and Pandora’s Blog, where current news in the world of online safety is discussed regularly. In addition, the Pandora Corp. has made the PD Pandora Internet Safety Symposium available to schools and law enforcement as a free resource for spreading internet safety awareness to parents. Over the past few years, PC Pandora has vaulted into a leadership position for parental control software by boasting a combination of features that are unparalleled in the monitoring industry. In 2010, Version 6.0 was released, again widening the spectrum of coverage and protection offered by the program. Concurrently released with 6.0, the web-based PC Pandora LIVE! service affords parents the ability to keep their kids safe from anywhere at anytime. PC Pandora is also now available through the Pandora Corp. store at Amazon.com.
Reporters and Producers: Looking to cover this topic? We are your technology solution component. Software is available to journalists for review and testing. Staff members are available for interviews. Let us help you show your audience how easy it can be to keep their kids safe.

description.hltext_display: Snow on way, just in time for Christmas
description.content:
MUNCIE --A storm system expected to hit the West Coast today could mean "several inches" of snow in East Central Indiana by Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. Joe Skowronek, a meteorologist with the National Weather Service in Indianapolis, said the system currently making its way through California "has the potential to bring the storm" to the area in the form of snow on Thursday and Friday -- possibly lasting through the weekend.
"Most of our storms originate off the West Coast -- at least our major ones," Skowronek said. "There's a possibility we could get a lot snow, and there's a possibility it could miss us totally."
The threat of snow and ice has been a constant worry for local residents whose most recent challenge was an overnight snow shower significant enough to cover the area's roads on Tuesday.
In all, seven car accidents -- and just one with apparent injuries -- were reported to Delaware County emergency dispatch personnel by 6 p.m. Tuesday, despite predictions of freezing rain that was expected to wreak havoc on snow-covered roads.
Duke Campbell, Delaware County highway superintendent, said Tuesday morning that his crews had been out since 3 a.m. plowing the county's bridges and main and secondary roads.
"It's clearing up pretty decent in the county," Campbell said.
Emergency dispatch personnel in Delaware, Blackford, Henry, Jay and Randolph counties said by about 10:30 a.m. that they had not had any major collisions or slide-offs on their roads, bridges and intersections.
Though some of the area's intestates, state roads and county roads were slushy and slick, the Indiana State Police reported just a few slide-offs and minor crashes throughout the day.
Sgt. Rod Russell with the Indiana State Police said Interstate 69 from Delaware to Madison counties and Interstate 70 from Henry to Wayne counties were experiencing "wet to slushy" driving and passing lanes. The U.S. and state highways, Russell said were "snow covered, slushy and slick," while secondary roads -- such as county roads -- were "snow covered and slick."
The threat for freezing rain in today's forecast appears to have vanished. Skowronek said any freezing drizzle felt Tuesday night should turn to flurries or light snow overnight and into the day today. Highs are predicted in the low 30s.

description.hltext_display: Plans To Make House Cleaning Easier
description.content:
House Cleaning is something some people like to do and even hire out for that purpose, while others do as little as possible. It is possible for the average homeowner to plan their cleaning so it does not become a burden. If it becomes a routine it becomes a natural thing to do and no big deal.
The majority of people could really lighten the load of house cleaning if they got in the habit of cleaning up after themselves. In other words, hang up the coat when arriving home, don't throw it over a chair. When done with newspapers discard them or fold them up neatly and so forth. A great deal of house cleaning is picking up things that have been strewed about.
If one has children, start at an early age and give them a two or three rooms and a regular day or days of the week when they have to pick up everything that is laying around and put it away. There will be a battle at first but, if one is consistent, it will not be long until it is a habit. This is an excellent way to train them for later in life.
Light cleaning is what one does every day and heavy cleaning is what one does once a year. The latter is when one goes all out. This means taking down the curtains, washing the windows, cleaning out the cupboards and getting rid of the clutter.
One can make their daily, or light, cleaning meaningful. In addition to sweeping, moping, washing counters, dusting and picking up one can, little by little, get rid of the clutter. Having a box in the garage or basement and putting things in it to be given away or sold at a yard sale later will do a lot to reduce the amount of cleaning one has to do.
If one plans carefully, heavy duty house cleaning does not have to be a burden. It is a lot of work to completely clean a room but if it is done one room at a time, stretched out over a planned period it is not difficult. Doing one room at a time, once a week, with a 6 room house one would be done in six weeks and one would not have to worry about it for another year.

description.hltext_display: Heavy rain, fallen trees force lake closure at Bonelli Park
description.content:
SAN DIMAS -- Downed trees and high lake levels have forced the closure of Bonelli Park to motorists, a result of heavy rains in the past four days.
About 15 trees have fallen in the park, blocking roadways, according to park authorities. Vehicles are being turned away from the two main entrances, but determined fishermen who want to take advantage of the rainy weather could still get in.
"If they want to walk in and fish on the shore, we're not going to kick them out," said Jim Hughes, lake aquatics manager at Bonelli Park.
Los Angeles County Parks and Recreation crews are working to clear the downed trees, but authorities expert the park to remain closed at least through Wednesday as storms continue.
Many trees at Bonelli Park have shallow root systems, making them susceptible to falling during high winds and rain.
"Right now with the weather, more trees may come down," said Silvia Pena, a clerk at the park.
Puddingstone Lake closed to boating Sunday because high water levels from the rains inundated launch ramps, Hughes said. Heavy debris also came down from the canyons.
Hughes wasn't certain when the lake might reopen.
"It all depends on the next storm coming in and what our (water) elevation is going to be," he said.
Bonelli Park is usually open year-round, closing only on Christmas Day, according to the park website.

description.hltext_display: Vorratsdatenspeicherung: De Maizière kompromissbereit
description.content:
Berlin (dpa) - Bundesinnenminister Thomas de Maizière (CDU) zeigt sich im Streit mit der FDP um die Vorratsdatenspeicherung kompromissbereit.
«Mir ist sehr daran gelegen, dass wir beim Thema Vorratsdatenspeicherung fast zehn Monate nach dem Urteil des Bundesverfassungsgerichts endlich zu einer Lösung kommen», sagte er der «Neuen Osnabrücker Zeitung» (Mittwoch). Er sei bei der Mindestspeicherfrist für Telefon- und Internetverbindungsdaten, dem Umfang der gespeicherten Verkehrsdaten sowie möglichen Zugriffshürden für die Strafverfolger kompromissbereit, betonte er.
So sei es denkbar, die von der EU vorgeschriebene Mindestspeicherfrist von sechs Monaten für Telefon-, Handy- und Internetverkehrsdaten in Deutschland gestaffelt nach Nutzungsarten zu gestalten, wenn die EU-Kommission dem zustimme. Der Innenminister schlug zudem vor, über die Zugriffsrechte der Strafverfolger auf die Verkehrsdaten zu sprechen. Ein Abruf aller bei den Providern gespeicherter Verbindungsdaten käme nur bei schwerer Kriminalität in Betracht.
Er könne sich auch vorstellen, bei der Strafverfolgung auf die Speicherung oder den Abruf von Standortdaten zu verzichten, die beim Telefonieren mit dem Handy anfallen. Am wichtigsten sei die Möglichkeit, auch rückwirkend an die Bestandsdaten über die IP-Adressen also die Namen der Nutzer, zu gelangen. Dies sei grundrechtlich am wenigsten problematisch, sagte de Maizière.
Der Innenminister betonte erneut, dass er den von Justizministerin Sabine Leutheusser-Schnarrenberger (FDP) ins Spiel gebrachten Ansatz eines schnellen Einfrierens von Verbindungsdaten nicht für eine Alternative hält. Auf dieser Basis sei kein Kompromiss denkbar. «Auf Anordnung der Strafverfolger lassen sich nur jene Daten einfrieren, die zu diesem Zeitpunkt nicht bereits gelöscht sind.» In der Regel würden Verkehrsdaten von Telefon- und Internetanbietern aber nur noch wenige Tage gespeichert, eine sogenannte Quick-Freeze-Regelung liefe also weitgehend ins Leere.

description.hltext_display: Many GCC firms in 'incoherent sectors'
description.content:
In pursuit of top line growth, many GCC companies have ventured into different businesses that are not coherent with their traditional capabilities, according to a new study by Booz & Company.
A review of leading conglomerates has shown that most were involved in three or more unrelated sectors as executives and shareholders of these companies were taken by the abundance of market opportunities, the study said.
Strategy development follows a well-worn path from the market back to the boardroom, focusing first on external positioning and opportunity, as opposed to internal capabilities. However, results are often disappointing, argue Booz’s Paul Leinwand and Cesare Mainardi in their upcoming Harvard Business article “The Coherence Premium.”
The companies pay an 'incoherence penalty' when strategy doesn’t begin with internal capabilities, the duo pointed out in the study.
'Companies succumb to intense pressure for top-line growth and chase business in markets where they don’t have the capabilities to sustain success,' remarked Leinwand, a partner in Booz & Company’s Chicago office.
'Their attempts at growth emanate not from the core but from the acquisition of ‘adjacencies’ and the exploration of market opportunities that don’t align properly with their central strengths,' he added.
In many cases, the strategy development usually starts at the wrong place – the Market, said the global management consulting firm in its study.
Many of the world’s market leaders – from Procter & Gamble to Coca-Cola to Mars and its Wrigley division – wind up benefiting from a “coherence premium,” which is measurable and proven.
“Stand-out performers start from the opposite direction when it comes to strategy,' said Mainardi, managing director of Booz & Company’s North American business.
'They figure out what they’re really good at and then develop those three to six capabilities, which can involve anything from knowledge to processes to tools, until they’re interlocking and best in class – and thus form a powerful capabilities system. From there, strategy becomes a matter of aligning the distinctive capabilities system with the right marketplace opportunities,” he explained.
Leinwand pointed out that though this sounds simple, it’s extremely hard to internalize. 'Yet the rewards for this discipline are huge,” he added.
“Unfortunately, many companies don't have a clear capability agenda at all. And those that do often pursue capabilities, or competencies, separately from the strategy itself. They then wind up with a long list of competing priorities – and aren’t able to support the business with the right capabilities system that is required to win,” he observed in the study.
Ahmed Youssef, a partner in the Dubai’s office, said this phenomena was very common within many GCC companies and was particularly apparent in the last few years.
'Several leading conglomerates are involved in three or more unrelated sectors. Executives and shareholders of these companies were taken by the abundance of market opportunities and they focused on entering new sectors instead of scaling the businesses, where they have the right to win,” he pointed out.
Leinwand and Mainardi discuss the power of coherence and a capabilities-driven strategy; what they consist of; how companies can attain them; and what can happen when leaders put the market before coherence and capabilities in the study.
Citing Wal-Mart's success, the duo said, 'It isn’t successful simply because of impressive logistics and an ability to get vendors to fall in line. Underlying Wal-Mart’s competitive advantage is a system of mutually reinforcing capabilities that lowers total value chain costs in a differentiated way.'
The retailer achieves maximum efficiency by integrating four capabilities: aggressive vendor management, expert point-of-sale data analytics, superior logistics and rigorous working-capital management, they added.
“Every Wal-Mart product and service fits with the company’s ‘way to play’ – its ‘everyday low prices’ – and capabilities system. It’s coherence at its finest,” explained Mainardi.
'In refining and fixing its consumer health care business in 2002, Pfizer identified six interlocking capabilities: science-based innovation around formulations; its ability to influence regulatory management and government policy; new-product development focusing on prescription to over-the-counter switch; claims-based marketing featuring a demonstrable health benefit; channel management in both general stores and pharmacies; focused portfolio management of aggressive and moderate growth brands; and geographies,' said Leinwand.
'With those capabilities at the core of its strategy, Pfizer sold its confectionary products and its shaving businesses, which enabled it to focus more attention on growing health care brands like Listerine, Zyrtec and Nicorette at above-market rates and acquiring new brands, like Purell, that could be differentiated based on claims.'
“Pfizer Consumer Healthcare became a premier company in its category, delivering a growth rate double the industry average,” said Leinwand. “As a result, when Pfizer decided to sell these businesses, it realized a huge profit.”
“A capability is something you do well that customers value and competitors can’t beat. It’s more than an activity or a function: It’s the interconnection of people, knowledge, IT, tools and processes that enable a company to out-execute rivals on some important measure,” explained Mainardi.
A company becomes coherent when its system of three to six capabilities is consciously chosen and implemented to support a focused strategic purpose and is aligned with the right product and service portfolio.
Coherent companies have no problem answering these questions: How are we going to face the market? What capabilities do we need? What are we going to sell, and to whom?
*Data show that coherence correlates strongly with greater profitability, as measured by EBIT margin; coherence thus leads to the so-called coherence premium.
The duo said the Booz & Company approach to scoring coherence is similar across industries and involves: defining the segments each company servers; identifying the capabilities that drive value for the company in each segment; determining the number of common capabilities across all the segments the company serves.
*Coherent companies focus day in and day out on what they are best at, and thus continually improve their capabilities.
*Coherence also hones strategic investment on what matters: Companies make better organic growth decisions and pursue acquisitions that line up with their capabilities. Coherence also produces efficiencies of scale and creates alignment between strategic intent and day-to-day decision-making.
The coherence test
To determine how coherent or incoherent a company is, leaders should address these folowing questions:
*Are we clear about how we choose to create value in the marketplace?
*Are we investing in the capabilities that really matter to our way to play?
*Can we articulate the three to six capabilities that describe what we do uniquely better than anyone else? Have we defined how they work together in a system?
*Do all our businesses draw on this superior capabilities system? Does our organizational structure and operating model support and exploit it? Does our performance management system reinforce it?
*Have we specified our product and service “sweet spot”? Do we understand how to leverage the capabilities system in new or unexpected areas?
*Do most of the products and services we sell fit with our capabilities system? Are new products and acquisitions evaluated on the basis of their fit with our way to play and capabilities system?
The cost of incoherence
*ConAgra Foods created incoherence through an unfocused acquisition binge in the 1990s. By the mid-2000s, its portfolio spanned three segments that drew on distinctly different capability sets: prepared foods, which required superior merchandising and supply chain capabilities; snacks, which relied on strong product innovation; and staples, like flour and processed meat, which depended on efficient sourcing and production.
As a result, the company suffered from sub-par performance between 2002 and 2007. (It has since begun moving toward coherence.)
*Similarly, Sara Lee operations were incoherent: Businesses ranged from bakery goods to Hanes underwear to Kiwi shoe polish – and financial performance was at the bottom of the pack. (Sara Lee has also taken steps to begin to tap into the coherence premium, having started to divest many non-core brands.)
*Incoherent companies struggle to make the right capability choices. Because they need to support diverse strategies with diverse capability requirements, incoherent companies wind up investing in too many capabilities and lack the focus to do any of them well.
“Given the natural tendency of organizations to devolve into incoherence, it takes extraordinary leadership to pursue a capabilities-driven strategy,” explained Leinwand.
'Focusing on one way to compete and a system of differentiating, mutually reinforcing capabilities often requires hard choices, including divesting businesses, streamlining nonessential functions and paring down product and service lines.'
'It also means resisting the temptation to leap into a hot new market where your capabilities system can’t help you or to pursue, in boom times, easy profits at the expense of strategic focus,' he noted.
There is no better time for GCC companies to assess the coherence of their business and focus their capital, human resources, and other assets on creating a more coherent business, Leinwand added.-TradeArabia News Service

description.hltext_display: Richtingloze handel op Europese markten
description.author: DePers.nl
description.content:
De Europese aandelenbeurzen openden woensdag vlak bij gebrek aan richtinggevend nieuws. Volgens handelaren is het onderliggende sentiment echter positief, mede dankzij goede macro-economische cijfers en overnamenieuws dat dinsdag naar buiten kwam.
Kort na de opening noteerde de AEX-index van meest verhandelde fondsen in Amsterdam 0,1 procent hoger op 356,40 punten. De MidKap-index van middelgrote fondsen was onveranderd en stond op 634,10 punten. Ook in Frankfurt, Londen en Parijs stonden de graadmeters onveranderd.
Chemieconcern DSM (min 0,3 procent) was een van de sterkste dalers in de AEX. Amerikaanse advocatenkantoren onderzoeken of DSM de aandeelhouders van Martek Biosciences genoeg betaalt voor hun stukken. Na de aankondiging dinsdag van de overname voor circa 1,1 miljard dollar steeg het aandeel DSM 3,9 procent.

description.hltext_display: Arbeitszimmer absetzbar durch das Jahressteuergesetz 2010
description.author: Robert Kracht
description.content:
Bis vor kurzem war das heimische Büro steuerlich nur noch dann absetzbar, wenn es den Mittelpunkt der beruflichen Tätigkeit darstellte. Makler, Außendienstmitarbeiter oder Lehrer gingen leer aus. Das ändert sich - und zwar schnell und rückwirkend auf mehrere Jahre.
Stand Beschäftigten außer dem Arbeitszimmer in der Wohnung kein anderer Arbeitsplatz zur Verfügung, durften sie bis zum Jahr 2006 noch 1.250 Euro pro Jahr absetzen. Hierdurch wurden besonders Berufsgruppen wie Außendienstmitarbeiter, Handelsvertreter, Versicherungsmakler, Lehrer oder Dozenten begünstigt. Ab 2007 gingen sie jedoch leer aus. Ab sofort gibt es wieder bis zu 1.250 Euro als Werbungskosten, und dies sogar rückwirkend ab 2007.
Das Bayerische Staatsministerium der Finanzen weist aktuell darauf hin, dass der Gesetzgeber auf die Vorgaben des Bundesverfassungsgerichts zum häuslichen Arbeitszimmer rasch reagiert hat. Die Finanzämter werden die Neuregelung so schnell und unbürokratisch wie möglich umsetzen. Hintergrund für diese Handlungsfreiheit ist die Veröffentlichung der neuen Vorschriften zum häuslichen Arbeitszimmer im Bundesgesetzblatt.
Nach dem Jahressteuergesetz 2010 können Aufwendungen für ein häusliches Arbeitszimmer wieder bis zu einem Betrag von 1.250 Euro als Betriebsausgaben oder Werbungskosten abgesetzt werden, so wie es vom Bundesverfassungsgericht am 6. Juli 2010 gefordert worden war. Dies setzt voraus, dass zur Ausübung der Tätigkeit kein anderer Arbeitsplatz zur Verfügung steht. Stellt das Arbeitszimmer den Mittelpunkt der betrieblichen oder beruflichen Tätigkeit dar, ist weiterhin ein unbegrenzter Abzug der Aufwendungen möglich. Diese Neuregelung gilt rückwirkend zum 1. Januar 2007. Sie ist anwendbar für noch ruhende Einspruchsverfahren und Steuerbescheide mit einem entsprechenden Vorläufigkeitsvermerk.
Soweit bereits in den Steuererklärungen ab 2007 Aufwendungen in der Anlage N für ein häusliches Arbeitszimmer geltend gemacht wurden, können die Finanzämter diese Fälle automatisch erkennen und die Bescheide ändern. Die Finanzämter werden sogleich beginnen, diese Fälle abzuarbeiten. Das wird einige Zeit in Anspruch nehmen.
In allen anderen Fällen ist es dem Finanzamt nicht möglich, selbständig und von Amts wegen tätig zu werden. Die betroffenen Steuerzahler sollten sich dann unter Mitteilung der entstandenen Aufwendungen an das zuständige Finanzamt wenden. Hierzu genügt ein einfaches Schreiben.
Bisher mit der Verfassungswidrigkeit der Regelung zum häuslichen Arbeitszimmer begründete ruhende Einspruchsverfahren werden von den Finanzämtern entsprechend der neuen Gesetzeslage zeitnah entschieden. Darüber hinaus wies der bayerische Finanzminister Fahrenschon auf die Notwendigkeit hin, Aufwendungen zu melden, falls sie noch nicht über die Anlage N der Steuerklärung dem Finanzamt bekannt sind. Denn anders als bei der Umsetzung der Entscheidung des Bundesverfassungsgerichts zur Pendlerpauschale sind die Finanzämter beim häuslichen Arbeitszimmer verstärkt auf die Mitwirkung der Steuerbürger angewiesen.

description.hltext_display: 不滿取締撂11人襲警 替代役男重傷 (TVBS)
description.content:
員警執勤，又再次遭到民眾襲擊，而且越來越誇張，日前，在宜蘭有便衣員警執行取締違規勤務時，一個沒戴安全帽的騎士發現自己被拍照了，竟然去叫了11個人來對員警動粗，其中，一名當時跟一起執勤的替代役男傷勢最嚴重，頭部撕裂傷腦震盪，右手還骨折，而他當天是代替車禍的學長執勤，才會碰到惡煞，真的是無妄之災。
協助員警執行勤務，沒想到卻遭到圍毆的替代役男陳慶郁，躺在醫院病床上，相當虛弱，看了讓人鼻酸，不過他的學長站在一旁，心更是難過不捨。
原來20日當天，應該要和員警出勤務的人，其實是受傷替代役的學長，但因為他出車禍，才會改班表，讓他覺得很過意不去。員警：「全部叫回來，全部叫回來。」
警方拿槍對著嫌犯，讓他背著雙手趴在地上不敢動彈，另一個人被員警制伏，站在機車旁邊，20日深夜，2名便衣員警和一名替代役男，在宜蘭執行交通取締勤務，負責拍下違規民眾的照片，騎車雙載的民眾沒戴安全帽，還企圖遮掩車牌，甚至回頭找11個人來打警察。受傷員警：「我就表明我是警察，就莫名其妙一群人圍過來。」
便衣員警見狀況不對，拔槍要控制場面，還趕緊叫替代役男去請求警力支援，沒想到落單的他，卻變成顯眼目標，被打得渾身是血，還有輕微腦震盪，讓家人很心疼，另外2名便衣員警也掛彩，警方後來逮捕6名嫌犯，發現其中還有2名未成年少年，他們把拿來毆警木棍都被打斷，凶狠作風讓人不敢領教。
