广东茂名彩民30元中2822万 创当地彩票最高纪录
description.author: www.qq.com
description.content:
中新社茂名12月22日电 (葛燕梅 杨炯)广东茂名福利彩票发行中心22日证实，21日晚，中国联销双色球电脑福利彩票2010149期开奖，茂名市区一名彩民投注30元人民币，命中2822万元大奖，创当地彩票史上奖金最高纪录。
据检索，中奖彩票出自茂名市区人民北路电力招待所对面的44161008号福利彩票投注站，中奖彩民仅以一张投注额为30元的5倍单式票命中，就轻松获得2822万元的大奖。
茂名福彩中出2822万元历史大奖的消息不但震撼了铁杆福彩迷，更让想粘财气的广大市民“心痒痒”。当街头巷尾的福彩迷们都还在兴致勃勃地谈论这位幸运的“千万富翁”时候，彩民林先生对记者感叹地说：“原来用爱心、善心支持福彩，想一夜暴富也不是梦。”
据介绍， 21日茂名福彩可谓双喜临门。先是在20时44分，茂名福彩“中福在线”高凉中路销售厅刚刚喜中全国累积奖25万元大奖。后在21时30分双色球开奖，该市又一幸运彩民中得双色球2822万元大奖。
茂名福利彩票发行中心负责人叶秀盛称，茂名自1988年发行福利彩票以来，奖金千万元以上的已有5次，21日晚“出炉”的2822万元大奖再次刷新历史纪录。(完)

description.hltext_display: The DC Area: On a Slow But Sure Path towards a Diversified Economy
description.content:
Washington, the nation's capital, is slowly rebranding itself as a great business destination. The same city that is closely identified to the Federal Government is now trying to attract entrepreneurs to set up shop in the city. The city known for the White House, the Washington Monument and the Lincoln Memorial now wants to be known for commerce and industry.
In an effort to diversify its economy, Washington and surrounding communities are inviting businesses to establish or expand their presence in the city. Although the DC area is already home to several Fortune 500 and Fortune 1000 companies, the Federal Government remains to be single largest economic entity in the region. Much of the city's workforce and businesses are either directly or indirectly dealing with activities of the Federal Government.
So far, the efforts of local officials to invite businesses to the DC area are paying off. In 2006, a business magazine considered the DC area as one of the top ten locations within the United States that are favorable for business expansion. Slowly but surely, private enterprises that are engaged in areas such as science and engineering, biotechnology, research and media are setting up shop in the region and have become steady contributors to the growth of its economy.
The influx of businesses in the DC area has caused an increased in the demand for office space. For example, demand for Fairfax VA office space has been on all-time high as businesses pour into this particular Washington suburb. The same story can be said about office spaces in other areas of Northern Virginia, Southern Maryland and the District of Columbia itself.
In response to the increase in demand for the likes of Fairfax VA office space from businesses, real estate developers are making urgent but great responses. New office buildings and commercial complexes are being developed all throughout the DC area. Old, dilapidated inner city communities, particularly in Washington, are being renewed to make them ideal locations for businesses.
Things such as high demand for Fairfax VA office space by private enterprises and the establishment of businesses that are unrelated to government activity were once unheard of in the DC area. As new realities slowly sink in, Washington and the rest of the DC area are assured of one thing: A diversified economy will work well for people of Washington on the near future.

description.hltext_display: No looking back for Pelosi in House
description.author: noreply@allvoices.com
description.content: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi strode into the chamber, which Tuesday morning was silent and mostly empty...On what was probably her last full day as speaker, Pelosi held the gavel for no more than five minutes...Pelosi still had history to make, inequities to erase, strategies to craft.

description.hltext_display: Kathleen Vallee Stein: Time of year to reconnect with friends
description.content:
THIS is the time of year when we get in touch with people we only get in touch with once a year. Many people I send cards to are in that category. Still, I want to let them know how I am doing and hope they will also send a card to me. Most of them are people I knew in the past but they still matter today.
One of those people is a co-worker I haven't seen for 25 years. I worked with her at a retirement community in Van Nuys. We were called retirement counselors but we were really rental agents. Betty had been in the business for a few years; I was brand new. She quickly became my teacher and I learned as I watched her gain the confidence of the most skeptical and worried adult child of a frail senior in search of a safe place to live. She would be there the day they moved in and hovered like a mother hen until the tenant was settled.
When we weren't showing apartments, we worked together in the rental office. After dealing with stressed-out families all day we often found humor in the absurdity of life and often laughed so hard we cried. We worked all day with people who were nearing the end of their lives, living in one room, often ill and alone, having outlived most of their friends and family. We admired them in many ways and treated them with utmost respect and affection, but we needed our downtime, too.
Betty had been happily working at a state-of-the art retirement community in Montana but moved back to Los Angeles because her 30-something
daughter, her only child, was ill. Her daughter's health was precarious and she had to be hospitalized from time to time. I came to understand that Betty's job was a respite from her difficult home life with her daughter.
Several years earlier, Betty's husband was tragically killed on the job as steelworker due to negligence on the part of the company. After a protracted lawsuit, Betty received a settlement but she was still alone in the world with her daughter to care for. I admired her resilience, her constant good humor and positive outlook.
Eventually I moved to another job and Betty followed her heart and moved to Arizona with a man she had become reacquainted with through mutual friends. We talked on the phone occasionally and exchanged Christmas cards.
After a couple of years passed with no phone calls or cards, I called Betty's daughter's phone number a few times but never got a call back. Her number in Arizona was disconnected. I called the corporate headquarters of the retirement community company and spoke to the marketing manager, who knew Betty too. He had lost touch with her as well.
It has been more than a decade since I heard from Betty and I have assumed the worst. I have to conclude that her daughter never let any of her mother's many friends know what happened to her. I don't know why her daughter didn't go through Betty's address book and call her friends. When someone passes, lots of people who knew them well, even if it was years ago, still care.
In this electronically connected society there is no excuse for not letting people know when a loved one passes. It leaves a gap in the relationship that can never be filled.
When a former neighbor passed, his son stopped by to tell me in person and I was very grateful. I wasn't family, or even a close friend, but it gave closure.
When a loved one passes, it is better to err on the side of giving their friends a call or an e-mail. It is best to let people know, especially at this time of year when people stop to think about old friends and miss them still.
Kathleen Vallee Stein is a freelance writer who lives in Monrovia.

description.hltext_display: Biggest storm yet heads for Calif; homes evacuated
description.content:
LOS ANGELES -- After days of relentless rain, Southern California is awaiting the most intense storm system yet, with evacuations ordered, rescue crews on standby and residents anxiously eyeing already saturated mountainsides denuded by wildfires.
Forecasters expected more rain across the state Wednesday, but the focus clearly was on Southern California where a monster storm was expected to bring torrential rain, thunderstorms, flooding, hail and possible tornadoes and water spouts. Forecasters warned of possible rainfall rates of .75 inch to 1 inch an hour and thunderstorm rates of 2 inches an hour in the region.
Steady rain began falling late Tuesday and was expected to intensify into early Wednesday.
An unidentified Charter cable technician works to restore service to homes in Carnelian Bay around Lake Tahoe, Ca., Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. Over 10 feet of snow fell in parts of the sierra during the latest storm.
- Scott Sady /AP Photo
Motorists drive along Pacific Coast Highway in the rainy weather, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010, in Santa Monica, Calf.
- Danny Moloshok /AP Photo
A sign alerts traffic to flood conditions on Black Star Canyon Road early Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in Silverado Canyon, Calif. The latest in a series of powerful storm systems is bearing down on California, pelting mountain areas with heavy rain, snow and high winds, prompting evacuations and leaving thousands without power. (AP Photo/Orange County Register, Mark Rightmire) NO SALES; MAGS OUT; LOS ANGELES TIMES OUT.

A rain-swollen Silverado Creek runs beneath Black Star Canyon Road early Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in Silverado Canyon, Calif. The latest in a series of powerful storm systems is bearing down on California, pelting mountain areas with heavy rain, snow and high winds, prompting evacuations and leaving thousands without power. description.hltext_display: 男子致富后回报村民自掏腰包发过节费坚持十载
description.author: www.hexun.com
description.content:
“这是第十个年头了，因为有马大哥的捐款，每年的春节都会过得宽裕些”。今天上午，通州区企业家马文彦自掏腰包40万，为通州区台湖镇董村村民每人发放500元过节费。60年前，马文彦就出生在董村，曾是村里最穷的放牛娃。经过多年打拼，马文彦终于脱贫致富，但他始终没有忘记乡亲们，此次捐款已是他“群发”红包的第十个年头。
今天上午10点，上百户村民聚集在台湖镇董村9号院，每个人的脸上都洋溢着喜悦的笑容。几分钟后，马文彦和家人走进院子。“马哥新年好啊”，问候声此起彼伏。在家人的陪同下，马文彦将手提包打开，把40万元现金交到村干部手中，按照每人500元的标准，再由村干部把钱分发到每个人手中，一个四口之家就能领到两千块钱“过节费”。村民冯先生手握现金，激动地说：“有了这笔钱，我家孩子明年的学费就不愁了”。
“现在，能有这样行为的人不多了。”今年76岁的徐大爷非常感慨。据徐大爷介绍，60年前马文彦就出生在董村，他家当时特别穷，几个孩子都上不起学，有时家里吃不上饭，是吃着董村的百家饭长大的。徐大爷说，那时马文彦常去学校“蹭课听”。有一年春节，村里有个外出打工的有钱人开辆车回来，给每个娃发放了3块钱的过年费，村人羡慕极了，“从那时起，马文彦就立志，致富以后不能忘了村里人。”
“小时候穷，现在有钱了，也得想着咱村的父老乡亲们。”马文彦说，做人要懂得饮水思源的道理。数年前，他开始创业，刚赚了些钱，就拿出省吃俭用攒下的几千元钱，帮村里新建了小学。2002年5月，他又出资6万多元购买一辆面包车，捐给本村的45名小学生，“从那时起，孩子们上学不用走路了，基本解决了娃娃们上学出行的困难。同时，家长也减轻了负担，没有了担忧。”
“这个捐赠我还要坚持下去，只要我的企业还在，就不会忘记咱村人。”看着兴高采烈的乡亲，马文彦坚定地说。

description.hltext_display: Greg Miller to be honored by Yorktown High School Boys Basketball Boosters
description.content: YORKTOWN The Yorktown High School Boys Basketball Boosters will have a reception for coach, physical education teacher and former athletic director Greg Miller in the YHS cafeteria after Thursday's Yorktown-Shelbyville game. Friends, family and fans are invited to join in recognizing Miller's basketball accomplishments. The Indiana Basketball Hall of Fame selection committee recently named Miller and 17 other former players to its 2011 Silver Anniversary Team based on their outstanding play as seniors in the 1985-86 season.

description.hltext_display: Learning the Best Way to Perform Steel Welding
description.content: While thinking of learning steel welding, we first need to determine the types of steel that are to be welded along with its appropriate thickness. Steel is generally available in the form of mild steel, used for structural and some other applications like automotive bodies and many more. On the other hand, stainless steel include different metal pieces and also require certain specialized equipments for welding purpose. The best way to distinguish the mild steel from the stainless steel is by trying and connecting a magnet to the metal. Mild steel is also a form of magnet while stainless steel is not. Described here are four major techniques of welding that can be used when learning best way of how to weld steel. They are as follows.MIG weldingMIG welding is the easiest way of steel welding. It operates in the same way as arc welders, except when the electrode is in the form of a continuous wire feed operating for a longer period without replacing the wire. This type of welder also make use of a shielding gas in order to prevent contamination at the weld area. In addition, MIG welding is the best way to learn about how to weld in a proper manner.Gas weldingGas welding, also referred to as oxy-acetylene welding, is rarely used these days by the welders to weld steel. The process include two metal pieces that are heated and fused together with the help of a filler that is made up of steel. It is best used for light metals and sheet metals.TIG WeldingTIG welding is considered as a specialized process that need great welding skill. This welding is ideal for sheet metal work where appropriate and clean welds are required.Arc or stick Arc or stick welding is ideal for home use or maintenance. Arc welders can easily weld metals with the thickness, starting at 1/8th inch thick up to 1 inch thick. Moreover, through this welding thinner metals can also be welded, however it too require more skill. The process also uses flux coated electrodes that are used to generate the electric arc, and act as a filler material to fuse the steel.

description.hltext_display: CARTIER - Les nouveautés du SIHH 2011
description.content:
La griffe française présente en avant-première les nouveautés du Salon International de la Haute Horlogerie de Genève.
Communiqué
Fleuron de la créativité Maison, la Haute Horlogerie Cartier défie l’avenir à travers la volonté toujours plus marquée d’allier la maîtrise d’un savoir-faire à l’expérimentation technique, la connaissance à la différence, l’amour du métier à la passion du fini et du détail.
Un pari renouvelé dont cette 21ème édition du Salon International de la Haute Horlogerie signe la réussite avec la modernité d’une montre Calibre de Cartier Astrotourbillon en titane, la folie artistique et animalière d’une complication féminine Poinçon de Genève et la révélation d’une véritable tentation joaillière gourmande.
Montre Calibre de Cartier Astrotourbillon, calibre 9451 MC © Cartier
Montre Calibre de Cartier Astrotourbillon Calibre 9451MC
Puissance et légèreté, envergure et confort
Le mouvement Astrotourbillon, dévoilé l’an dernier après cinq années de recherche au sein de la Manufacture Cartier, anime aujourd’hui la montre Calibre de Cartier. Cette montre de caractère au diamètre spectaculaire, pondéré par l’extrême légèreté du titane, dévoile des finitions soignées tant sur le boîtier que sur le mouvement. Une oeuvre exclusive de Haute Horlogerie signée Cartier, disponible en série limitée et numérotée de 100 pièces.
Un mouvement créatif et technique
Le mouvement 9451 MC comporte une cage de tourbillon comprenant les différents organes de l’échappement et du balancier-spiral. Comme dans un tourbillon classique, la cage est entraînée par la troisième roue de l’engrenage. De même, le pignon de la roue d’échappement s’enroule autour d’une roue de seconde fixe (quatrième roue du train d’engrenage) afin d'entraîner l’échappement. Ce tourbillon spectaculaire, baptisé Astrotourbillon, présente plusieurs particularités qui en font un tourbillon unique.
Tout d’abord, cette cage a un axe de rotation particulier puisqu’il se situe au centre du mouvement, ce qui implique bien entendu une conception totalement différente du train d’engrenage depuis les deux barillets du mouvement, jusqu’à l’affichage des minutes et des heures.
Par ailleurs, et c’est ce qui fait la particularité visuelle du mouvement Astrotourbillon, l’axe du balancier et l’axe de la roue d’échappement ne sont pas sur l’axe de rotation de la cage. Ils sont disposés d’un côté de la cage, linéairement par rapport à son axe de rotation.
Enfin, la cage de tourbillon est disposée « au-dessus » du mouvement, entre deux cadrans, et non directement intégrée au mouvement, comme c’est le cas pour un tourbillon classique.
Cette construction inédite pour un tourbillon central a des conséquences esthétiques et techniques. Visuellement, la cage ainsi allongée effectue un tour en une minute sur toute la surface du cadran. Le pont de balancier, excentré et dessiné en forme de flèche, permet ainsi de lire les secondes. Techniquement, il a fallu assurer l’équilibre de la cage, en apportant de l’autre côté de la cage un contrepoids en platine, dissimulé sous le cadran central. De plus, afin de maîtriser l’inertie de la cage lors de sa rotation, son poids a dû être limité (0,39 g pour la totalité de la cage hors contrepoids), d’où le choix du titane pour sa fabrication.
Un boîtier racé
Imaginé en 2010, le calibre 9451 MC trouve avec ce nouveau boîtier de 47mm un cadre d’envergure à la hauteur de sa technicité créative. Une puissance et une présence allégées de titane et confortées par le naturel et l’évidence d’un porter exceptionnel qui doit son ergonomie aux quatre cornes qui plongent vers le poignet pour en épouser la forme.
Profil racé ponctué d’un double épaulement satiné et poli qui protège la couronne à pans d’éventuels chocs pouvant en altérer le bon fonctionnement. Tous les détails parlent d’exigence et de créativité jusqu’aux chiffres romains qui réinterprètent avec virilité les codes horlogers de la Maison avec un chiffre XII extra-large qui domine le cadran avec démesure. Une signature sublimée par une succession de finitions en arc de cercle qui inscrit la montre dans la dynamique du XXIème siècle.
Montre Calibre de Cartier Astrotourbillon, calibre 9451 MC © Cartier
Montre Calibre de Cartier Astrotourbillon, calibre 9451 MC
Boîte en titane
Diamètre : 47 mm
Couronne à pans en titane ornée d’un saphir facetté
Glace saphir
Fond saphir
Ếtanchéité : 30 mètres
Bracelet en alligator noir
Boucle double déployante réglable en or gris 18 carats
Calibre 9451 MC, Astrotourbillon
Mouvement mécanique Manufacture à remontage manuel, Astrotourbillon
Diamètre : 17 lignes ¾, soit 40,10 mm
Ếpaisseur : 9,01 mm
Nombre de rubis : 23
Nombre de pièces : 192
Balancier : 21 600 alternances/heure
Réserve de marche : environ 48 heures
Numérotation individuelle du mouvement
Montre tourbillon et crocodile Poinçon de Genève calibre 9458 MC
Une grande complication au féminin
Pour ce tourbillon volant, beau et artistique, Cartier a souhaité de l’onirisme et du merveilleux. L’horloger a inversé le mouvement pour révéler le mécanisme et ses ponts squelettés qui entrent alors dans le décor.
Il était une fois un tourbillon fabuleux
Une oeuvre au coeur de laquelle un crocodile de diamants veille sur le temps, reptile d’or gris sculpté aux yeux d’émeraudes dont Cartier fleurit la présence d’un parterre de nénuphars d’émail translucide rouge et vert.
Un enchantement joaillier, animé par le battement alternatif d’un tourbillon volant d’exception : le calibre 9458 MC avec Poinçon de Genève.
Mouvement mécanique Manufacture à remontage manuel, ce calibre est constitué de 167 pièces dont 19 rubis. D’une épaisseur de 5,58 mm, il est animé d’un tourbillon volant avec indication de la seconde par la cage en forme de C. D’un diamètre de 17 lignes 1/2, il bat à raison de 21 600 alternances à l’heure et dispose d’une réserve de marche de 50 heures. Au lieu de placer la cage de tourbillon de manière traditionnelle, protégée entre les ponts et la platine du mouvement, le tourbillon volant de la montre a été conçu afin d’en magnifier l’esthétique. La cage de tourbillon semble en effet « voler » sur les ponts, comme en apesanteur au-dessus du cadran, davantage exposée aux chocs qui pourraient la déséquilibrer. Ce choix, plus esthétique mais techniquement risqué, a conduit les maîtres horlogers à porter une attention toute particulière à la conception de la cage de tourbillon qui permet d’avoir une résistance aux chocs équivalente à celle d’un tourbillon traditionnel.
C’est lui qui donne le rythme horloger à cette montre ronde entièrement sertie de diamants dont la réalisation a nécessité plus de 50 heures de travail.
Une symbiose absolue entre deux savoir-faire, celui du joaillier et celui de l’horloger qui composent en duo pour mettre à jour ce qui se cache : la beauté et l’expression d’un mouvement mécanique Manufacture dont toutes les finitions s’exposent d’autant mieux qu’elles répondent aux très sélectifs critères d’exigence du Poinçon de Genève.
Montre tourbillon et crocodile, calibre 9458 MC © Cartier
Montre tourbillon et crocodile, calibre 9458 MC

description.hltext_display: 2010 SAN DIEGO NEWSMAKERS: Restaurants & Dining
description.content:
Going gastro, meat markets and budget menus
Last updated Tue, Dec 21st, 2010
With economic uncertainty hanging a cloud over 2010, who’d have thought going into this year that the dining scene in San Diego would generate so many stories centered around growth, rebirth and success? Not this openly pessimistic food journalist, that’s for sure! But the fact is many restaurateurs and chefs found ways to adapt to the down economy thanks to foresight, innovation and guts.
It was a step in the right direction that took us from a year where survival trumped innovation to a culinary landscape where people are daring to try new things that, while still inside the box, provide the tools by which to once again venture beyond it. It’s my hope that the cream of the crop will realize life outside four walls in 2011. But for now, let’s reel back thoughts of tomorrow for a look back at the year that was.
Big Names in New Places: Local toques are becoming household names and several opened new restaurants this year, including Carl Schroeder (Bankers Hill Bar + Restaurant), Jason Maitland (FLAVOR), Wade Hageman (Blue Ribbon Artisan Pizzeria) and former Top Chefs contestants Rich Sweeney (R Gang Eatery) and Brian Malarkey, the latter of which is enjoying the runaway success of Downtown’s Searsucker, the most bustling new spot to open in a great while.
Going Gastro: Gastropubs like Proper, Quality Social, Sessions Public, Urge and the anything but plain Jayne’s Gastropub are to 2010 what places offering local, thoughtful, sustainable upscale twists on comfort food classics were to 2009—casual neighborhood proving grounds for edible fare that raises the bar to meet the lofty expectations of a largely foodie patron base.
Dining 101: After years of the same ol’ same ol’, the strip of historic Highway 101 that runs through Encinitas is becoming a hotbed for new dining spots thanks to buzz generated by the South American fare at Q’ero, mammoth burgers at Encinitas Ale House and Lumberyard Tavern and Grill, the top notch pies at the aforementioned Blue Ribbon Artisan Pizzeria and the soon-to-open Solace and the Moonlight Lounge, a coastal two-story version of North Park’s Urban Solace.
Road Warriors: We’re not at the forefront of the gourmet food truck movement, but we’re catching up quick thanks to mobilized gastronomads like Dave de Jour, Devilicious, Joe’s on the Nose and the MIHO Gastrotruck who prefer to spread the edible love via the open road versus a permanent locale. Even chef Deborah Scott of the Cohn Restaurant Group is getting in on the act with her porky Pan-Asian inspired Chop Sooey truck.
Meat Market: Once the type of Slow Food from-scratch vittles only available at white linen restaurants like Jsix, A.R. Valentien and Rancho Valencia, charcuterie has become commonplace countywide. From the cafeteria environs of Liberty Station’s Tender Greens to the Gaslamp’s upscale dive bar, Quality Social, salumis, rillettes and balantines are the cure for what ails you.
Little Italy’s Side Trips: When people think Little Italy, they think India Street, but in 2010, several new gems popped up to lure fans of good food and drink off that Mediterranean main drag and into side street eateries offering creative departures from the norm like Craft & Commerce, Bencotto Italian Kitchen and Red Velvet Wine Bar.
Yes on Fat…No on Fowl: Never before has bacon been as prevalent in our traditionally health-conscious city as it was this year. Pork belly waddled its way onto just about every menu in San Diego. Meanwhile, most restaurants yielded to pressure and removed another rich and fatty delicacy, foie gras, from their menus (though you can still get it on request at a number of fine dining spots…but you didn’t hear that from me).
The Week Link: This year, local event planners and event fully embraced multi-day fests honoring everything from restos to suds to seafood courtesy of events like the San Diego Brewers Guild’s San Diego Beer Week, Cooks Confab’s Sustainable Seafood Week, the (damp) San Diego Bay Wine & Food Festival and the San Diego Spirits Festival, which followed the fruitful model of the bi-annual San Diego Restaurant Week.
Our Cups Runneth Over: Maybe it’s because they take us back to a simpler time. Maybe it’s the fact that their petite size allows for a less guilty sweet tooth fix. Maybe it’s cutesy names like Cups, Cupcakes Squared, Heavenly Cupcake, Sprinkles and PubCakes (adult cakes made with beer). No matter the reason, there’s no denying that tiny gourmet cupcakes were the biggest dessert trend of the year, proving good things come in small packages.
20 Below: Many new restaurants opened with entire menus made up of items priced at $20 or less while a number of veteran eateries like AVE 5, Stingaree and Suite and Tender dialed down their bills of fare significantly to keep up with this popular trend. It’s the way God intended for us to eat, but history tells us the Andrew Jackson diet can only last so long. So be sure to gobble up these discount eats while they last!

description.hltext_display: Executions come down in US
Newmark Security PBT down 59% in first half
description.content:
Electronic and physical security systems provider Newmark Security plc reported a 59% fall in first-half pre-tax profit but said it expected a better second half.
Revenue for the six months to October 31 was �6.09m, 13% down on the previous �6.99m.
Profit before tax was �0.36m compared with �0.88m in H1 2009.
Chairman Maurice Dwek said trading in the first few months of the period was variable due to delays in customers placing orders before the general election and emergency budget.
'Unfortunately this pattern has continued with the state of the economy affecting most of the group's customers and in particular the public sector.'
In the Electronic division, turnover was �2.93m (2009: �3.40m) and operating profit �0.44m (2009: �0.80m).
Asset Protection turnover was �3.15m (2009: �3.59m) and operating profit �0.33m (2009: �0.39m).
Dwek said trading continued to be difficult but the board anticipated an easing of current market constraints resulting in a more positive second half.
Longer term, developments included the Cash in Transit protection case, the SATEON access control system, a potential new market in the US for OEM products and the Wavetec distribution agreement in the UK and Europe.
These developments would provide Newmark with a strong portfolio of products and valuable revenue streams going forward.

event_or_fact.property: trading in the first few months of the period was variable due to delays in customers placing orders before the general election and emergency budget
trading continued to be difficult but the board anticipated an easing of current market constraints resulting in a more positive second half

description.hltext_display: Large-scale tree felling near Bhimashankar?
description.content:
District collector Chandrakant Dalvi on Monday asked Khed tehsildar and the forest rights committee to conduct an inquiry into the allegations by the local villagers against the clean energy company, Enercon, which is setting up windmills near Bhimashankar wildlife sanctuary.
Dalvi had convened a meeting of the officials from Khed and the company officials along with villagers. The villagers had alleged that the company had cut more than two lakh trees while the company had claimed that it had cut only 26,000 trees as per the permission of the
authorities.
The villagers had also alleged that more area was used for constructing the approach road by the company.
Dalvi asked the tehsildar and the committee to conduct a detailed survey to ascertain as to how many trees were cut. He asked the villagers to give representation to the local revenue officials about the damage to crops and their fields after the company had used their fields to build the approach road.
The company said the project would generate 116 MW of power on an area of 701.11 acres at Kud village in Khed taluka in Pune district, which is in the vicinity of the Bhimashankar sanctuary.
The company officials maintained that being a non-conventional energy generation project, the company had paid Rs24 lakh to Maharashtra Energy Development Authority (Meda) while
constructing the road.
Dalvi asked revenue officials to ascertain whether the company had used the prescribed area for constructing the approach road and asked the villagers to get the panchanamas done for the said land to ascertain the facts.

description.hltext_display: Salud colabora con MSF en la campaña 'Pastillas contra el dolor ajeno'
description.author: EUROPA PRESS | LOGROÑO
description.content: El Gobierno de La Rioja, a través de la Consejería de Salud, colabora desde noviembre con la ONG Médicos Sin Fronteras para el desarrollo de un proyecto de sensibilización de la sociedad respecto de los enfermos olvidados. Se trata de la campaña 'Pastillas contra el dolor ajeno', iniciativa que quiere implicar a personas de todas las edades para luchar contra las enfermedades olvidadas. Salud y Médicos Sin Fronteras suscribieron un convenio de colaboración para poner en marcha dicha campaña. El Ejecutivo riojano ha apoyado esta iniciativa, ofreciendo todo el apoyo institucional a este proyecto y facilitando su desarrollo en La Rioja. Las 'Pastillas contra el dolor ajeno' son un símbolo de apoyo y de compromiso con MSF en su lucha por tratar a personas que padecen enfermedades olvidadas. En realidad, las pastillas son caramelos de menta que se presentan en un envase de seis unidades, una por cada enfermedad olvidada. Los fondos de esta acción se destinarán a financiar proyectos de MSF de tratamiento de estas enfermedades. Las 'Pastillas contra el dolor ajeno' son un nuevo concepto de ayuda: simbolizan la situación médica que viven en los países de desarrollo. Con un sencillo gesto y de forma muy accesible, con tan solo un euro, podemos contribuir a mejorar la vida de miles de enfermos olvidados. Con la ayuda de todos los españoles, MSF quiere lograr que estas 'pastillas', que solo se pueden adquirir en farmacias, sean el medicamento más vendido en el plazo de un año, con el fin de realizar una acción de sensibilización muy visible, en un lugar idóneo para empatizar con el dolor ajeno. description.hltext_display: 印度南部制药厂发生疑似毒气泄漏事件6人死伤
description.author: www.hexun.com
description.content:
据美国媒体12月22日报道，印度南部一家制药厂发生疑似有毒气体泄漏事件，截至22日凌晨，已经造成至少2名工人死亡、4人中毒入院治疗。
印度警方表示，这起毒气泄漏事件发生在雷迪博士制药公司的一家工厂。据悉，这家工厂位于南部安得拉邦首府海得拉巴市郊的工业园内。
当地警方目前正对这起案件展开调查。

description.hltext_display: EBEL - Deuxième shooting de Louise Ebel
description.content:
La seconde collaboration de Ebel avec Louise Ebel met en lumière la montre Beluga.
Communiqué
Une empreinte laissée sur le temps dans une esthétique néo-romantique.
Dans l’univers de Miss Pandora, la Beluga dévoile son élégance intemporelle, à la fois surannée et contemporaine. Ses courbes voluptueuses répondent à celles d’une robe vintage caressée par le mouvement d’une chevelure ondoyante.
Selon Miss Pandora, « l’ambiance s’inspire du passé, mais est profondément empreinte de modernité, à l’image de la Villa Turque de Le Corbusier. La montre en reprend les volumes dans une dialectique entre lignes fortes et courbes féminines. Elle harmonise sa sensualité avec une robe des années 40, silhouette d’un autre temps remise au goût du jour. »
© Ebel
Les Architectes du Temps ont fait appel à l’une des bloggeuses les plus en vue du moment pour interpréter les univers de six modèles phares.
Depuis 1911, Ebel façonne le temps et lui donne corps et âmes en concevant des montres qui mêlent fonction et émotion. Reflets d’une époque, elles sont le fruit d’une interprétation, d’une inspiration. Celle qui associe l’architecture et le design à l’horlogerie pour mieux les inscrire dans le temps et leur permettre d’y laisser leur empreinte. En faisant appel à Louise Ebel pour exprimer à sa façon la signature artistique de ses collections, la marque leur offre un nouveau mode d’expression. Au gré des mises en scène imaginées par la jeune femme et photographiées par Pauline Darley dans le décor Art Déco de la Villa Turque, les montres se dévoilent différentes, sous un nouveau jour.
© Ebel
Jeune étudiante de 22 ans, Louise Ebel a créé son blog il y a deux ans. Aujourd’hui, ce sont plus de 25'000 visites quotidiennes uniques qui l’ont propulsé parmi les dix meilleurs du moment. Ses pages empreintes d’art et de mode donnent la part belle à des séries de photographies thématiques inspirées de l’histoire, des contes, de l’univers gothique ou encore du romantisme du XIXème siècle. Entre robes néoclassiques et perfecto de cuir, bottines rock et attitude mélancolique, l’univers de Louise Ebel se dessine. Allégorique. Avec la précision de celle qui sait ce qu’elle souhaite. Un univers qui n’est pas sans rappeler celui des montres Ebel .
© Ebel
Depuis toujours, la marque Ebel fascine la famille de Louise. Même nom, même orthographe, les coïncidences s’arrêtent pourtant là. Détenteurs de montres Ebel depuis plusieurs générations, les parents de Louise ont contacté la marque il y a plusieurs années pour vérifier s’il n’existait pas un lien… Aujourd’hui c’est Ebel qui fait appel au talent de cette jeune femme devenue une icône générationnelle en France mais également au-delà des frontières. Entre ses mains, les montres Beluga, Ebel Classic Sport, Ebel Classic, Brasilia et 1911 se révèlent avec un naturel désarmant.
Shooting 1 : http://www.misspandora.fr/jean-genie
Shooting 2 : http://www.misspandora.fr/the-lady-is-a-tramp

description.hltext_display: 广州一男子持刀闯入银行 大批警察封锁现场(图)
description.author: www.qq.com
description.content:
现场已被警察封锁 记者陈辉摄事发银行。南都记者 陈辉 摄事发银行内部拉起警戒线。南都记者 陈辉 摄南方网12月22日报道 大批警察突然封锁广州中山六路新宝利大厦一楼深圳发展银行广州越秀支行营业大厅，之后一名男子被警察带走。据目击者称，今日中午12时许，一男子持刀闯入该行营业大厅。该男子持刀进入银行大厅后，劫持了一名正在柜台办理业务的女子，并声称抢钱！
男子约30岁、身高1米7左右、体态微胖，被警察带走过程中一言不发。目前该银行仍未恢复营业，银行工作人员也未对此事进行解释。

description.hltext_display: The Economic Reinvention of Washington, DC
description.content:
Edit Article | Posted: Dec 21, 2010 |Comments: 0 |
Share
Washington, DC is the capital of the United States and a major global city. Founded on July 16, 1790, Washington and its surrounding areas are home to 5.4 million individuals, with most of them working for the Federal Government. Washington is where the Federal Government conducts its daily business. Major international organizations also have headquarters on Washington, DC.
More recently, however, Washington is rebranding itself, although not distancing much on its reputation as a center of government activity. The Federal Government is the largest single employer in the city. The Washington Metropolitan Area is currently encouraging the growth of private businesses within it in an effort to diversify its economy.
So far, the rebranding effort is working, as a lot of new businesses are starting to flock to Washington. Joining the already existing businesses within the DC area engage in the areas of biotechnology, science and engineering, research work and tourism. Washington has been ranked as one of the top ten areas in the United States that are favorable for business expansions.
For this reason, Washington DC office space is valued highly. The presence of both government and non-government entities in the DC area has proven favorable to real estate developers in the city. Some areas of the city are now being subjected to urban renewal programs to make them more attractive to businesses.
Real estate developers in the DC area are now happier than ever. The demand for DC office space from businesses and other entities are higher than ever, thanks to those who wish to have easier access to the corridors of power and the rebranding effort of the city as an ideal business location. Some of the office spaces are located close to key sites such as the United States Capitol, the White House, IMF headquarters, World Bank headquarters, and the campuses of Georgetown and George Washington universities.
The increasing demand for DC office space and the influx of businesses into the DC area have benefited a lot of residents. The city's economy, although still reeling from the effects of the recent economic downturn, is now revitalized. Washington, the nation's capital, is now on its way towards reinventing itself as a great city for both government and business activities.

description.hltext_display: House prices to fall 2% in 2011
description.content: Dec 2010LONDON (SHARECAST) - House prices are likely to drop by 2% over the coming year and could fall by as much as 5% if government austerity measures derail the economy, the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS) said. The housing market is likely to see a downward trend that stabilises in spring, with prices then creeping back up towards the end of the year, RICS said. It describes the anticipated 2% fall in prices as negligible but adds that restricted bank lending and government spending cuts and tax rises could hit prices harder. Even in this environment, our judgment is that the lack of new supply is likely to prevent the decline amounting to very much more than 5%, RICS said. Government austerity measures are expected to kick in next year, with a VAT rise to 20% from 17.5% early in January a taste of things to come. The effect of public sector job cuts has already been felt, with the number of people employed in the public sector falling by 33,000 to 6.01m in the three months to October. About 10 times that number are expected to lose public sector jobs in the next four years. Figures from the Council of Mortgage Lenders earlier this week showed that mortgage lending was down 5% in November compared with the previous month and was almost 10% lower than the same time last year.

description.hltext_display: 山西煤焦领域反腐败打黑九百余政府官员落马
description.author: www.hexun.com
description.content:
中新社太原12月22日电 (记者 张恩)记者22日在山西煤焦领域反腐败专项斗争查处案件情况新闻发布会上了解,山西省加大煤焦领域发腐败专项行动,提高办案的整体效能,今年1至11月,906名政府公职人员 相继“落马”,依法受到严厉惩处。
山西省检察厅副厅长邢顺喜介绍,截止今年11月,山西各级煤焦领域发腐败专项斗争领导组办公室共立查案件2185件,处分2353人。今年1至11月,山西全省共受理民众信访举报759件,立案591件,初核煤焦领域违纪线索718件,立案查处591件,处分违纪干部906人,涉及厅级干部7人,县处级干部109人,乡科级干部262人。
记者在此间获悉,今年山西已查处及正查处的典型案件令人触目惊心。如大同市原副市长王雁峰在煤矿置换过程中收受巨额贿赂案、大同市公安局原局长申公元在煤矿置换过程中收受巨额贿赂案、晋城市煤炭局总工程师、党组成员刘俊文收受有关煤矿负责人贿赂108万元人民币,巨额财产441万元来源不明案等。
有关人士指出,山西煤焦领域案件查办行动将继续进行。今后要健全办案的激励和制约机制,重点查处政府官员插手煤焦业务入股、牟取暴利、利用审批监管、资金划拨、票据管理、权钱交易,利用资源整合倒卖国有资源、利用批煤发煤、基本建设、资产评估、大宗物资采购,从事商业贿赂以及私挖滥采背后黑“保护伞”等违纪违法案件。
这位负责人强调,山西在煤焦领域专项行动中实行严格问责制,对瞒案不报、压案不批、有案不查者,加大责任查究。
【免责声明】本文仅代表作者本人观点，与和讯网无关。和讯网站对文中陈述、观点判断保持中立，不对所包含内容的准确性、可靠性或完整性提供任何明示或暗示的保证。请读者仅作参考，并请自行承担全部责任。

description.hltext_display: TAG HEUER - Les gagnants de "Art of Watchmaking"
description.content:
TAG Heuer, the leading Swiss luxury watch company, and Parsons The New School for Design today revealed the winners of the “Art of Watchmaking,” a 10-week competition that charged eight teams of Parsons product design students with reinterpreting TAG Heuer’s classic Monaco chronograph. Each member of the three teams will receive a monetary prize and a TAG Heuer timepiece. Additionally, TAG Heuer has the potential to produce one of the first-place designs as a limited-edition piece.
The winners were selected by an illustrious panel of judges that included: Narciso Rodriguez, CFDA award-winning womenswear designer and Parsons alumnus; Renaud Dutreil, Chairman of LVMH North America and New School trustee; Ulrich Wohn, president & CEO of LVMH Watch & Jewelry North America; Marion Fasel, contributing jewelry editor, InStyle magazine; Michael Thompson, editor, International Watch magazine; Rama Chorpash, director of product design, Parsons; and Andre Fortier, vice president of after-sales service, TAG Heuer.
Sera. © TAG Heuer
During the review, each of the student teams showcased three concepts, and discussed their inspiration, target consumer and design philosophy. Ideas ranged from a Monaco with a rotating case to designs inspired by the New York City transportation system. “The students’ enthusiasm for this program was clearly evident in the quality of their designs,” said Wohn. “They truly immersed themselves in the brand and presented ideas that embraced the avant-garde, daring spirit of TAG Heuer. We are inspired by the students’ perspective on luxury timepieces and their unfettered creativity. It’s nice to look at your brand through new eyes.”
First-place honors went to the team of Yong Yi Lee, Yoav Menachem and Amit Ran, whose designs included a sleek, black model with a shield over the watch face and edition numbers to appeal to collectors; second-place honors went to the team of Enrique Diaz Rato de Zabala, Michelle Organ and You Jin Sung, whose designs included a black ceramic timepiece with neon accents; and third-place honors went to the team of Yusuke Sekiguchi, Christopher Beatty and Helen Kim, whose designs included a piece with naturally grown crystals in its dial.
Black Shield. © TAG Heuer
"We partner with industry leaders like TAG Heuer because they provide our students the kind of professional challenges they'll face when they graduate," said Joel Towers, executive dean of Parsons. "These types of projects are integral to design education."
Added Chorpash, "This is a project that is ultimately about constraint. Our students were pushed to think innovatively about the design, while keeping in mind the parameters of the client's design brief and the technical requirements of the manufacturing process."
The partnership and competition—a first for TAG Heuer—began in early September, when TAG Heuer presented the 24 students with a comprehensive overview of the Monaco, which was first introduced in 1969 and shattered the conventional codes of watch design and engineering with the world’s first self-winding automatic chronograph movement and waterproof square case.
Conquest. © TAG Heuer
Under the guidance of faculty members Anna Rabinowicz and Peter Allen, students were charged with creating their own iteration of the Monaco. Many aspects of the timepiece were open to interpretation, including the material choice, color and design of the dial, subdials, hands, indexes and folding buckle. However, students could not alter the distinctive shape of the Monaco’s case, whose clean, geometric lines marked a radical departure from the rounded watch dials of the ’60s and ’70s.
The teams each rendered 100 original concepts, and throughout October and November, narrowed down these initial ideas into three final designs. During this time, students received constructive feedback from TAG Heuer executives during milestone visits, as well as toured the brand’s New Jersey-based facility to experience firsthand the precision and craftsmanship that assembling a luxury watch demands.
TAG Heuer Celebrates 150 Years of Watchmaking Innovation
The year 2010 marks TAG Heuer’s 150th anniversary – a milestone that celebrates the brand’s evolution from a small workshop in the Swiss Jura Mountains to its status today as a leader in the luxury watch market. Since its inception, TAG Heuer has demonstrated a passion for accurately measuring even the smallest increment of time. It is the only watchmaker to develop a mechanical automatic chronograph movement that displays 1/10th, 1/100th and 1/1000th of a second, as well as the only brand to capture 1/10,000th of a second. The brand’s 150-year legacy is peppered with displays of engineering prowess, including the world’s first oscillating pinion, patented in 1887, and the recently launched Monaco V4, which features a double-patented belt-driven movement that shatters the basic tenets of how a watch keeps time. Through a constant pursuit of excellence and innovation, TAG Heuer creates timepieces that are a defining symbol of state-of-the-art originality.
About Parsons The New School for Design
Parsons The New School for Design is one of the most prestigious institutions for art and design education in the world. Based in New York but active around the world, the school offers undergraduate and graduate programs in the full spectrum of design disciplines. Critical thinking and collaboration are at the heart of a Parsons education. A student-centered curriculum allows for both focused and interdisciplinary learning, with unparalleled internship opportunities and industry partnerships laying the groundwork for entrepreneurship and professional success. An integral part of The New School, Parsons builds on the university’s legacy of progressive ideals, scholarship, and pedagogy. Parsons graduates are leaders in their respective fields, with a shared commitment to creatively and critically addressing the complexities of life in the 21st century. For more information, please visit www.newschool.edu/parsons.

description.hltext_display: Foodies fight with film school for space in LA
description.content:
LOS ANGELES -- Fans of the Hollywood Farmers Market are hoping for a permanent resolution to the permitting dispute that's been threatening the weekly produce bazaar.
Organizers have until mid-April to reach an accommodation with the adjacent film school that has been refusing to sign off on the market's permit.
Los Angeles Film School officials say the market blocks an entryway into one of the school's parking lots for several hours each Sunday.

description.hltext_display: Peru felon jailed on meth, neglect charges
description.content:
DALEVILLE A Peru woman caught shoplifting at a Daleville gas station faces multiple felony charges after police found she was in possession of several drugs with her son in the car. Jessica A. Lewis, 30, is preliminarily charged with possession of methamphetamine, reckless possession of drug paraphernalia, theft and neglect of a dependent -- each class D felonies -- and possession of marijuana, a Class A misdemeanor.
According to the probable cause affidavit, Lewis, a convicted felon, was apprehended by police after she was caught stealing items from the Pilot Travel Center in Daleville. During a search of Lewis and her vehicle -- where her son and a friend were sitting -- police found several bags of a white powdery substance Lewis referred to as "crank," as well as a bag with a green leafy substance and a smoking device.
Lewis has served two recent prison terms, both for convictions stemming from arrests in Miami County. She was most recently released in October 2009 on charges of possession of meth.
Lewis has also been convicted of theft three times (2004, 2000 and 1999), driving while suspended twice (2002 and 2001) and conversion (2000), according to court records.
Lewis was released on her own recognizance Monday night from the Delaware County jail.

description.hltext_display: Eugene Robinson: An important milestone for Obama and the left
description.content:
PRESIDENT Obama must be tempted to respond to his progressive critics with a quote from the old-school rapper Kool Moe Dee: "How ya like me now?"
Repeal of the military's bigoted and anachronistic "don't ask, don't tell" policy on gays in the military - a campaign promise that seemed to be slipping out of reach - doesn't fully mend the relationship between Obama and the Democratic Party's liberal wing. But it's a pretty terrific start.
Progressives needed a clear, unambiguous victory to ease the sting of those extended tax cuts for the rich. They got one Saturday with the Senate's historic vote to end "don't ask, don't tell" - and Obama won vindication for the slow, patient, step-by-step approach that drove gay and lesbian activists crazy but ultimately produced a stunning result.
Administration officials believed from the beginning that getting the discriminatory policy repealed, and allowing homosexuals to serve openly in the armed forces, would require getting the Pentagon brass on board. The military leadership had to support the change, or at least accept it. Otherwise, repeal-minded members of Congress might balk at casting a vote that could be portrayed as somehow weakening America's defense.
So the White House spent months demonstrating that Defense Secretary Robert Gates fully endorsed the end of "don't ask, don't tell" and that the service chiefs would implement the change. A key part of this painstaking strategy was the
Pentagon's 10-month study of the impact of eliminating the policy - which concluded, essentially, that there was likely to be no adverse impact at all.
The study included a military-wide survey, which found that two-thirds of service members believed ending the policy would have positive, mixed or neutral effects. Perhaps more significant was the study's description of the experience of the British, Canadian and Australian militaries, which changed their rules and allowed gays and lesbians to serve openly. What happened? Nothing at all.
"Uniformly, these nations reported that they were aware of no units that had a degradation of cohesion or combat effectiveness, and that the presence of gay men and lesbians in combat units had not been raised as an issue by any of their units deployed in Iraq or Afghanistan," the study reports. None of those other nations had problems with recruiting or retention, either. The change turned out to be a non-issue.
Opponents of ending "don't ask, don't tell," including Sen. John McCain, had insisted that Congress not act until the Pentagon study was completed. When it finally came out, they promptly began moving the goalposts, demanding yet more hearings and testimony. It looked as if they were going to run out the clock and leave the issue for the new Congress, which will be far more conservative.
But then Joe Lieberman and Susan Collins came to the rescue.
I've been sharply critical of Lieberman in the past, and I suspect I'll have occasion to be equally critical in the future. But on "don't ask, don't tell," he was pure gold. Sometimes it seems as if Lieberman, who serves as an independent, delights in driving liberal Democrats crazy, but on social issues he still has a righteous sense of fairness and justice. His well-established record as a hawk on military matters gave him the credibility to push this change - and push it he did, even when all seemed lost.
And as for Collins, I've wondered how she can be called a "moderate" when she reliably stands with the archconservative, down-with-the-president GOP leadership in the Senate, especially on important procedural votes. But she was brave and principled on "don't ask," and by linking arms with Lieberman she allowed seven other Republicans to cast their votes on the correct side of history.
Now that Congress has acted, the military will move with caution to implement the change. Judging by what has happened in other countries that took this step, however, the process will probably move much faster than anyone expects. A year from now, we'll all be wondering what the big deal was.
For gays and lesbians currently serving in the military, this doesn't mean they necessarily have to make public their sexuality. It just means that soon they won't have to fear being discharged for being who they are.
And for President Obama and the left, this is an important milestone - a reminder that even in dysfunctional Washington, what Sarah Palin derided as "that hopey-changey stuff" can still produce real hope and change.

description.hltext_display: Chronology of News Events in 2010
description.content:
» 0 Comments | Post a Comment
Jan.1
Iran's opposition leader, Mir Hossein Mousavi, pledges to remain defiant in the face of new threats including calls by hard-liners for his execution and says he is ready to sacrifice his life in defense of people's right to protest peacefully against the government.
Jan. 2
A northwest Pakistani village that tried to resist Taliban infiltration mourns the victims of an apparent revenge suicide bombing that killed 96 residents during a volleyball game.
Jan. 3
Britain and the U.S. say they will jointly fund a counterterrorism police unit in Yemen amid fears of an increasing threat of international terrorism emanating from that country.
Jan. 4
The suicide bomber who killed eight people inside a CIA base in Afghanistan was a Jordanian-born terrorist working as a double agent who had been invited to the base because he had information targeting Osama bin Laden's second-in-command.
The U.N. food agency suspends the distribution of desperately needed aid in Somalia because of attacks on its staff, a decision that could affect up to one million people.
Jan. 6
British Prime Minister Gordon Brown fends off a challenge to his leadership from within his own ruling Labour party just months before general elections.
Cuba accuses a U.S. government contractor arrested in December of being a spy for American intelligence services.
Jan. 7
Thousands of Egyptian Christians go on a rampage after six members of their community were gunned down as they left midnight Mass for Coptic Christians in a southern town.
Jan. 8
Lawyers for the Nigerian defendant in a Christmas Day attempt to bomb a US-bound airliner enter not-guilty plea.
Jan. 9
The Jordanian doctor who killed seven CIA employees in a suicide attack in Afghanistan says in a video broadcast posthumously that all jihadists must attack U.S. targets to avenge the death of Pakistani Taliban chief Baitullah Mehsud.
Jan. 10
China edges past Germany in 2009 to become the top exporting nation, yet another sign of its rapid rise and growing economic influence.
Jan. 11
Northern Ireland's leader is forced to step down at least temporarily amid outrage following revelations of his wife's affair with a teenager. The move poses a new challenge for the peace process.
Jan. 12
A powerful 7.0 earthquake strikes Haiti, killing tens of thousands and collapsing hundreds of homes, government buildings and churches.
Jan. 13
U.N. Taliban suicide bombings and other attacks cause Afghan civilian deaths to soar in 2009 to highest level of the war.
Jan. 14
Iraq's electoral commission bars 500 candidates from running in March parliamentary elections, including a prominent Sunni lawmaker, deepening sectarian divides.
Jan. 15
Guinea's wounded military leader gives into intense pressure to stay in temporary exile in Burkina Faso, a move that eases fears of renewed conflict and clears the way for a transition to democracy.
Jan. 16
Precious water, food and early glimmers of hope begin reaching parched and hungry earthquake survivors on streets of ruined Haitian capital Port-au-Prince.
Jan. 17
The archenemy of Ukraine's pro-democracy movement wins a first place finish in the initial round of presidential voting, setting him up for a showdown with the heroine of the 2004 Orange Revolution.
Jan. 18
Taliban militants wearing explosive vests launch a brazen daylight assault on the center of Kabul with suicide bombings and gunbattles near the Afghan presidential palace and other government buildings that paralyze the capital for hours.
Jan. 19
In a major upset, Republican Scott Brown captures the U.S. Senate seat held by liberal champion Ted Kennedy for nearly half a century, leaving President Barack Obama's health care plan in doubt and marring the end of his first year in office.
Jan. 20
Despite government efforts to quell sectarian violence in central Nigeria, several days of fighting between Christians and Muslims leave 200 dead with many charred bodies in the streets of Jos.
Jan. 21
A bitterly divided U.S. Supreme Court vastly increases the power of big business and labor unions to influence government decisions by freeing them to spend their millions directly to sway elections for president and Congress.
Jan. 22
China issues a sharp response to criticism by U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton that it is jamming the free flow of words and ideas on the Internet, accusing it of information imperialism.
Jan. 24
Afghan government postpones parliamentary elections for four months, citing security concerns, logistical problems and a lack of enough money from the country's international partners to pay for them.
Jan. 25
Ali Hassan al-Majid, known as Chemical Ali for his role in gassing 5,000 people in a Kurdish village is hanged, leaving behind a notorious legacy that stamped Iraqi President Saddam Hussein's regime as capable of unimaginable cruelty.
An Ethiopian airliner goes down in the Mediterranean after taking off from Beirut in a fierce thunderstorm. All 90 people aboard are killed.
Jan. 26
Toyota suspends U.S. sales of several popular vehicle models, including the Camry, to fix sticking accelerator pedal. The suspension comes on top of a recall of 23 million vehicles last week.
Jan. 27
Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa wins a second term in office, defeating his former army chief by 17 percentage points in the first presidential election since his government defeated the Tamil Tigers and brought an end to decades of war.
Jan. 28
Afghan President Hamid Karzai warns that foreign troops must stay in his country for another decade, as world powers agree on an exit map, including a plan to persuade Taliban fighters to disarm in exchange for jobs and homes.
Jan. 29
A jury in the U.S. takes just 27 minutes to convict an anti-abortion activist of murder for putting a gun to the head of abortion doctor George Tiller and pulling the trigger in the foyer of a church.
Jan. 30
Israel submits its response to a U.N. report that accused it of deliberately targeting civilians during last year's Gaza offensive, but an Israeli spokesman a key U.N. demand for an independent commission to investigate war crimes allegation.
Thousands of demonstrators from across Japan march in central Tokyo to protest a U.S. military base on the island of Okinawa that Washington considers essential to Asian security.
Jan. 31
Malawi's President Bingua wa Mutharika elected president of the African Union replacing Libya's Moammar Gadhafi.

description.hltext_display: 'Stone pelting suspects let off without recording statement'
description.content:
Police inspector Bhimsen Rathod, who is the prosecution witness in the Yashwant Natu case, on Tuesday, told additional sessions judge Usha Thakare that the police had let off the five suspects involved in stone pelting at Natus house without recording their statements.
Rathod said it was a lapse on part of the duty officer of Phadgate police chowky. On the day of the incident, the police had reached the spot in time and had nabbed the suspects but the duty officer of Phadgate police chowky released the suspects without recording their statements. This was a mistake on part of the duty officer, he said. Yashwant Natu is the complainant in the alleged land-grabbing case involving city Congress vice-president Deepak Mankar and others.
During examination of witnesses by additional public prosecutor SM Kalbhor, Rathod said, On February 28, 2008, I was on duty at Kasewadi area. The control room had informed me about the stone-pelting incident while I was passing through Shukrawar Peth. I rushed to the spot. However, another police team had already reached the spot. Two of the suspects were nabbed inside Natus house while three were caught outside the house, he said. Defence lawyers Suresh Bhosale and Sudhir Shah, who cross-examined Rathod, asked him to identify the five suspects, whom he had nabbed from the spot.
He successfully identified two suspects Sankar Gaud and Parsuram Naik while he failed to identify the other three.
Another prosecution witness Nalini Dilip Sarathe (56), retracted her statement in the court saying that she was not present when the panchnama was being done.
She said it was the anti-extortion cell unit of the crime branch and police, which made her sign the panchnama.
When the court asked her to identify the suspects, she said, When I was neither present at the spot nor during the panchnama, how can I identify the accused? She denied being under any pressure or influence from any of the suspects in the case. Sarathe is the third prosecution witness, who retracted her statement in the case.

description.hltext_display: 应对极端天气不力欧盟要机场给说法
description.author: www.hexun.com
description.content:
圣诞节即将来临，恶劣天气仍未与欧洲“妥协”。受新一轮强降雪影响，欧洲多国航空、铁路和公路交通出现混乱，大批旅客滞留机场，列车晚点，公路堵塞，给欧洲人圣诞节前出行造成极大不便。对于欧洲各大机场在应对极端天气方面的欠佳表现，欧盟方面21日提出了批评，并要求做出解释。
西班牙巴塞罗那埃尔普拉特国际机场已经取消了14个航班，所有被取消的航班都来自或者飞往英国、法国和德国。
在德国，21日凌晨新一轮强降雪导致欧洲最繁忙的机场之一法兰克福机场的航班起降中止了3个半小时。
在英国伦敦的希思罗机场，由于航班被取消，大量旅客被困机场。
在法国，由于恶劣天气，大约4000名原计划乘坐飞机或火车的旅客出行受阻，不得不在巴黎的两个机场和数个火车站过夜。在比利时首都布鲁塞尔机场翘首等待的数千名乘客也得到坏消息，由于飞机用的防冻液耗尽，所有离港的航班都被推迟到了今天。
通往法国和比利时的“欧洲之星”快速列车也受到了强降雪的影响，该列车在英国和法国境内行驶时已经被迫减速，这导致列车的运营时间比平时增加了两个小时。
为减少因强降雪造成的交通拥堵和交通事故，德国、比利时、荷兰、卢森堡和法国政府不得不做出决定，禁止重量超过7.5吨的大卡车上路。由于交通管理部门用来防止路面结冰的盐正慢慢耗尽，比利时一些城市已经开始将盐与沙子混合使用。欧洲各大机场的负责人正准备开紧急会议，商讨对策。

description.hltext_display: Our View: Minnesota maintains clout; will Northland?
description.content:
Go ahead; breathe that sigh of relief because Minnesota will keep all eight of its congressional seats for the next 10 years. The more seats a state has, of course, the more clout it can toss around in Washington, D.C., and in presidential elections.
Go ahead; breathe that sigh of relief because Minnesota will keep all eight of its congressional seats for the next 10 years. The more seats a state has, of course, the more clout it can toss around in Washington, D.C., and in presidential elections.
More than a few observers predicted Minnesota would lose a House seat when the Census Bureau released its 2010 population figures, not because the Gopher State isn’t growing but because other states are growing faster, especially in the South and West. Minnesota was on the bubble. But when the new numbers came out yesterday morning, Minnesota edged out, by a mere 15,700 souls, North Carolina. Minnesota held on to the 21st spot on the list of most populous states.
Population is everything when it comes to federal influence. The U.S. Constitution guarantees every state two senators, but the House’s 435 members are based on how many people live where.
Federal influence is something the state couldn’t bear losing. Not now, Gov.-elect Mark Dayton said in a statement: “As our state faces dire budget circumstances and Minnesota families continue to struggle in a tough economy, we simply could not afford to lose an important voice in our national policy discussion, nor the billions of federal dollars that are allocated to our state based on population.”
Minnesotans who returned their census cards can be credited for the retention of House seats. Minnesota had one of the highest census participation rates in the nation, state demographer Tom Gillaspy said in a Star Tribune report. He and others aggressively encouraged that participation.
While Minnesota may be maintaining its House seats, Minnesotans, especially those of us living outside the fast-growing Twin Cities suburbs, can’t be entirely relieved in the wake of the release of the new numbers. Those figures will drive lawmakers’ pens when they go to work in the new year redrawing political boundaries for congressional and legislative districts. That work is always bitterly battled. Redistricting has ended up in court the past four decades.
“We need to make sure Northeastern Minnesota keeps its voice,” Rep. Mary Murphy, DFL-Hermantown, told the News Tribune editorial board before being re-elected Nov. 2. She placed redistricting at or near the top of her list of priorities for the upcoming legislative session.
Other Northland lawmakers can do the same. The focus seems especially necessary this go-round with the Legislature now controlled by Republicans and the Northland’s delegation still DFL-dominated. Their voices will need to be as loud as ever.
Tags: our view, opinion, editorials, politics

description.hltext_display: Samuel Eto’o melhor que Abedi Pele, Drogba e Gyan
description.content:
O prémio nas mãos do melhor jogador africano
Imprimir
Enviar a um amigo
2
Comentários
310
Leitores
Comentário do leitor
+ VOTADO
Bruno Silva 21.12.2010 10:21, Lisboa
O título desta notícia não conseguia ser mais confuso mesmo que o jornalista que a escreveu tentasse. Pelo título apenas se perceb...
O camaronês Samuel Eto’o do Inter de Milão foi nomeado pela quarta vez na sua carreira o Melhor Jogador Africano do Ano, superando na votação o marfinense Drogba (Chelsea) e o ganês Gyan (Sunderland).
Em 2010, o avançado venceu no Inter de Milão, então sob o comando de José Mourinho, a Liga dos Campeões, o Campeonato e a Taça de Itália, e, mais recentemente e sem o treinador português, com o espanhol Rafa Benítez, levantou o troféu do Mundial de Clubes, tendo sido considerado o melhor jogador da prova.
Samuel Eto’o, que já tinha ganho em 2003, 2004 e 2005, sagrou-se assim o primeiro jogador a vencer em quatro ocasiões o galardão de Melhor Jogador Africano do Ano, superando o ex-futebolista ganês Adebi Pele (1991, 1992 e 1993).
A votação foi efectuada pelos treinadores e directores-técnicos das selecções africanas.

description.hltext_display: City Water Tested For "Erin Brockovich" Chemical
description.content:
California rating not bad, but not exactly healthy
Last updated Tue, Dec 21st, 2010
The Washington, D.C.-based Environmental Working Group recently released results from tests of 35 U.S. cities for chromium-6 (or hexavalent chromium), which it terms the "Erin Brockovich chemical."
The highest level of this carcinogen was the college town of Norman, Oklahoma, with a reading of 12.9 parts per billion. San Diego wasn't tested in this go-round, but four other California cities were: Riverside (1.69 ppb), San Jose (1.34), Los Angeles (0.20) and Sacramento (0.16).
Chromium-6 gained national attention in Erin Brockovich, the 2000 film starring Julia Roberts. The movie is named after a resident of Hinkley (in San Bernardino County, some 14 miles west of Barstow) who became an activist after scores of residents became seriously ill following a toxic spill at a nearby Pacific Gas & Electric plant. Incidents of breast cancer, miscarriages, kidney and ovarian tumors and other maladies were blamed on polluted water.
Chromium-6 is a natural byproduct of soil and rock erosion, but the EWG says it can also result from steel and pulp mill discharges, as well as waste from metal-plating and leather-tanning facilities.
Brockovich spearheaded a lawsuit against PG&E that ended in a $333 million settlement for 600 local residents. PG&E had been using chromium-6 to fight corrosion in its area cooling towers at a nearby compressor station. The wastewater from the towers was discharged, eventually making its way into the drinking supply.
Though no tests in San Diego were done in this EWG study, some fairly recent data is available, as late as 2008. Three Borrego Water District locations in 2005 checked in with chromium-6 readings of 1.8, 1.6 and 1.2. Several Camp Pendleton sites were tested, ranging from a low of 1.1 to a high of 5.6.
Sharp estimated if readings for the greater San Diego area were done now, they would be anywhere from 1.4 to 2.0 ppb, many times above the limit the OEHHA proposed.
"That's not bad,'' Sharp said, "if you compare it to (Norman) or the higher levels. But if you compare it to a total health goal, it's quite high.''
Of the 35 cities tested, 31 registered some level of chromium in its tap water, and only six had levels below the 0.06 ceiling that the Office of Environmental Health Hazard Assessment proposed for California last year. The city average was 0.18 ppb.
The California Department of Public Health doesn't have a standard for chromium-6 in drinking water. The Environmental Protection Agency has set a total chromium limit of 100 ppb, but that includes chronium-3, which regulates glucose metabolism and is an essential mineral.
"It would make more sense to regulate the awful one,'' said Renee Sharp, director of the California office and senior scientist at EWG.

description.hltext_display: Viking Line vahvisti laivatilauksen Turun telakalta
description.content:
Viking Linen laivatilaus STX Finlandin Turun telakalta on varmistunut. Vikingin mukaan sopimus astui voimaan tänään, kun osapuolet sopivat sen ehdoista. Aiesopimus tehtiin lokakuussa.
Yksi niistä oli Viking Linelle myönnettävä 28 miljoonan euron ympäristötuki, josta liikenne- ja viestintäministeriö päätti eilen.
Uusi risteilijä maksaa noin 240 miljoonaa euroa. Sen rakentaminen tuo Turun telakalle noin 2 600 henkilötyövuotta.
Viking Linen ja STX Finlandin sopimus sisältää myös option toisesta laivasta.

description.hltext_display: 联合国大厦异味笼罩人员疏散
description.author: www.hexun.com
description.content:
位于美国纽约东河河畔的联合国总部大厦21日早晨因散发不明难闻气味，导致安全理事会和联合国大会相关会议更改开会地点。
由于散发异常气味，联合国安全人员当天早晨临时疏散联合国秘书处大楼、联大大会堂以及联合国院区北侧草坪一座4层临时建筑的外交人员和工作人员。受疏散人员一度撤到联合国院外等候。
安全人员最初担心，不明气味由燃气泄漏导致。经专家现场勘察确认，东河潮水破坏了联合国建筑部分下水系统，难闻气味由下水道污物散发。
联合国秘书处大楼虽然正在装修，但安理会经常在大楼地下层开会。毗邻的联大大会堂也一直在使用。
联合国发言人法尔汉・哈克21日在例行新闻吹风会上告诉记者：“不存在危险，气体是由下水道散发，无害。明天游客参观项目和联大会议将恢复。”
哈克没有说明东河潮水如何破坏了下水系统以及是否有污物溢溅。但他说：“清理工作正在进行。”新华社发

description.hltext_display: Del Nido tomará medidas
description.content:
Sevilla Es evidente que el Sevilla no pasa por su mejor momento y la afición se encuentra pesimista ante los malos resultados ligueros. Pero su presidente Jose María Del Nido, siempre oprimista, no para de lanzar mansajes con el fin de subir la moral a sus aficionados y jugadores. El dirigente señaló que, "al margen de que coyunturalmente en estos momentos podamos estar atravesando en el plano deportivo del primer plantel un momento difícil, un momento delicado y un bache sin igual en las últimas temporadas, es sólo un momento coyuntural porque hay plantilla y jugadores y habrá medidas para que más pronto que tarde salgamos de esta situación".
Nombre propio
Entre las medidas a adoptar está reforzar la plantilla. Así, en el mercado de fichajes de invierno el Sevilla tiene como objetivo número 1 a Anthony Annan, jugador del Rosenborg. Todo está pendiente de un acuerdo entre Del Nido y el presidente del club noruego para que el futbolista haga las maletas con rumbo al Sánchez Pizjuán. Annan, de nacionalidad ghanesa, tiene 24 años y juega de mediocentro defensivo. Su coste podría rondar los cuatro millones. De fichar cerraría las puertas al madridista Gago, que también está en la agenda

description.hltext_display: Liikenteessä kuoli useita tuiskuisen marraskuun aikana
description.content:
Tieliikenteessä kuoli lähes tuplasti enemmän ihmisiä marraskuussa kuin vuosi sitten. Kuolleita oli yhdeksän enemmän ja loukkaantuneita 96 enemmän kuin viime vuonna, kertoo Tilastokeskus.
- Viime vuonna marraskuu oli aika lailla musta. Nyt lumikelit ja liukkaat säät tulivat aiemmin, sanoo aktuaari Raini Östlund Tilastokeskuksesta.
Tieliikenteessä sattui marraskuussa 474 henkilövahinkoon johtanutta onnettomuutta. Niissä loukkaantui yli 600 ihmistä ja kuoli 19.
Kuolleista 15 oli autoilijoita. Lisäksi kuoli kolme jalankulkijaa ja yksi polkupyöräilijä. Valtaosa kuolleista oli miehiä.
Marraskuun kuolleisuusluvut muodostavat vain pienen piikin tilastoissa. Tieliikenteessä kuolleiden määrä on jatkuvasti laskenut viimeisen kahdenkymmenen vuoden ajan, kertoo Tilastokeskus.

description.hltext_display: Nyati Group builds more toilets in labour camp
description.content:
After a sustained campaign by residents of Nyati Enclave Co-op Housing Society Ltd and Nyati County Mohalla Committee (NCMC) in Mohammedwadi, a series of toilets were constructed by Nyati builders for labourers in the camp belonging to the group.
Residents of the area had been complaining about the nuisance of open-air defecation by labourers on an open plot just behind their society that also belongs to the Nyati Group. DNA had highlighted the problem on November 10 and December 2 this year.
Member of NCMC, Capt Deepak Sethi, had raised the issue at the sanitation committee meeting held on December 4 in Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) where all representatives of various ward offices and mohalla committees were present. The meeting was presided over by deputy municipal commissioner (sanitation), Suresh Jagtap, and president of the National Society for Clean Cities (NSCC), Satish Khot. A follow up action was also assured in the meeting, he said. Meanwhile, pressure on the builder was also mounted by the Hadapsar ward office, which had sent a notice to the group vide no. 4163 (November 10, 2010) to take care of the squatting problem. While Nyati failed to reply to the notice, a second reminder was also sent.
Confirming the action, health officer of the ward, Suryakant Deokar told DNA, We have sent a second reminder. If there is no response, we will take the matter to higher authorities. Our sanitation inspector is following up to resolve the issue. On December 18, Capt Sethi informed DNA that 10 toilets made of tin, 5 for males and 5 for women had been constructed there. There was also a watchman posted there, he added. Expressing satisfaction, the complainant, Poonam Bharti, said that united action by citizens and others had led to a positive outcome.
