description.hltext_display: Another View: If education fails, nothing else succeeds
description.content:
TO believe California education isn't in trouble is to deny reality. It is. It has been for years. And the future doesn't look bright.
Despite the billions we spend - critics say lavishly - on education, this state spends less per student than all but three other states.
Roughly 40 percent of the state's general fund budget goes to K-12 education, but in the past two years, school funding has fallen by $21 billion.
Among the results: teacher layoffs, crowded classrooms, cancellation of summer school and a shorter school year.
Student enrollment is expected to turn upward in the coming years, but the teaching force is declining, from about 310,000 teachers two years ago to fewer than 300,000 today. The drop in the number of novice teachers is even greater. About one-third of the state's teachers are 50 or older.
In the past seven years, the number of college students enrolled in teacher preparation programs has dropped by 40 percent, from about 75,000 to fewer than 45,000. There has been a 33percent drop in the number of teaching credentials issued in that same seven-year period, from about 27,000 to about 18,000.
How are we going to keep them teaching?
"Invest we must," a new report that studies the teaching profession, concluded, "or soon risk facing the same circumstances that placed our most vulnerable students a decade ago in schools with the least
prepared and
experienced teachers."
The report goes on:
"Additionally, this state spends less on K-12 education than on many other public services, relative to the national average in each area.
The state faces a massive and seemingly ever-growing budget deficit estimated at $28 billion over the next 18 months. Every government operation, every program is being squeezed, from keeping potholes filled and bridges repaired to keeping dangerous criminals incarcerated and police on the job. Certainly, cuts have come to our classrooms.
No more do we hear school trustees and other officials declare that they will keep budget cuts as far from the classroom as possible. The evidence is visible to anyone who walks onto a school campus.
But the thing about cutting school resources is that it endangers the great economic engine of our future. There are few government functions more important than education. National defense and police protection, perhaps, but even those functions depend on an educated work force.
California must find a way to reinvigorate its
education system, from kindergarten through
graduate school. It's too important to do otherwise.

description.hltext_display: Washington, DC: America's Convention City
description.content:
Washington, DC, the nation's capital, is a vibrant city. Washington and its environs serve as home to around 5.4 million people. It is the hub of the Federal Government but is more recently becoming a fast-rising location for private businesses.
Much of the businesses that operate from within the Washington Metropolitan Area are directly or indirectly linked to government activity. These businesses include law firms, independent civilian and defense contractors, trade unions, lobbying firms, professional organizations and non-profit organizations. Those that are not involved with government entities include universities, research organizations, science and engineering work, and high-tech industries.
As the home of the United States Federal Government and a lot of foreign organizations, Washington is an ideal place for conventions and meetings. Easy access to the corridors of power and people in the know are the primary reasons why a lot of government and non-government events are being held in and around Washington. Hotels, convention centers and other meeting spaces in the city and the metropolis are really held valuable by a lot of entities.
A Washington DC meeting space conveniently puts you near some of the most important locations in the world. Some of the meeting spaces are situated close to key government facilities, including the White House itself. These spots are well sought after by event organizers from everywhere.
Another good thing about a Washington DC meeting space is its proximity to transportation facilities and their connection to the city's two major airports, this means even if you're from another state the other side of the country, you'll be able to go there in a matter of hours. A lot of meeting spaces can be accessed via the Washington Metro, a rapid transport system of the city. Others can be accessed by taking the fleet of buses and taxis that operate within the city.
The next time your bosses decide to hold your meeting in a Washington DC meeting space, it should not be a surprise to you anymore. Washington's charm and its rising status as a hub for both government and non-government activities are more than enough reasons for events to be held there. Washington, the nation's capital, is truly America's convention city.

description.hltext_display: Yule tree kicking leads to arrest of two Muncie residents
description.content:
MUNCIE Apparently Scott D. Smith wasn't in a holiday mood Monday night -- and the female of the house wasn't happy about it. Smith, 41, and Marla D. Davis, 38, each listed at 23 1/2 W. Orchard Place, were arrested on preliminary charges of domestic battery, while Smith was given an added charge of strangulation.
According to the probable cause affidavit, Davis told police that Smith got angry "about a Christmas 'thing' that came on TV," leading the Muncie man to kick their Christmas tree.
Smith said Davis became upset, pushing and grabbing at his shirt collar, causing pain. Davis contends Smith retaliated by choking her, according to the report.
Local court records reflect no recent criminal charges or convictions for Smith or Davis.
Smith (under a $7,500 bond) and Davis ($2,500 bond) were being held Tuesday at the Delaware County jail.

event_or_fact.property: Davis became upset, pushing and grabbing at his shirt collar, causing pain
Smith retaliated by choking her, according to the report

description.hltext_display: Los pasos sobreelevados son correctos
description.author: MIGUEL ÁNGEL MARCOS
description.content: Una auténtica desgracia. Así califica el alcalde, Rafael Mateos, lo ocurrido con la obra de los pasos sobreelevados de peatones desde que el equipo de gobierno decidió acometer el proyecto para reforzar la seguridad vial en distintos puntos del casco urbano. Y es que a su larga tramitación administrativa se unió la renuncia a los ocho meses de la primera empresa a la que se adjudicó o el sistema que utiliza la actual para realizar los trabajos. El motivo de su comparecencia era dar a conocer el informe que solicitó al ingeniero técnico de Obras Públicas municipal, Agustín Caldas, tras la petición que hizo el PSOE de no recepcionar la obra por entender que los pasos no cumplen la normativa. A la vista del contenido del informe el alcalde lamenta la «falta de rigor» del portavoz socialista, Lino González, puesto que no es exigible la aplicación de ninguna normativa que diga como tienen que ser esos pasos. En ese aspecto incide el técnico, que recalca que no existe normativa de obligado cumplimiento en las vías de titularidad municipal, y que cada Ayuntamiento puede tener su propia ordenanza al respecto, si bien en éste no existe ninguna. Asimismo recuerda que solo hay dos normativas, una de Fomento aplicable a las carreteras del Estado y otra de la Junta de Extremadura a las suyas. Después explica que la orden que dio a la empresa constructora es que se construyeran los pasos sobreelevados de acuerdo con esas normativas «en lo relativo a la definición geométrica para una velocidad máxima de 30 km/h, pero siempre teniendo un cuenta que estamos en vías de titularidad municipal y que por tanto no son de obligado cumplimiento». Unas medidas concretas Las dimensiones establecidas para esa velocidad son 10 centímetros de altura, con una oscilación de uno arriba o abajo; cuatro metros de longitud de la zona elevada y de 1 a 1,5 metros la longitud de las rampas. No obstante apunta que con el objetivo de que la configuración geométrica se adaptara a esas normativas se modificó el proyecto inicial respecto a la longitud de la zona elevada en todas las calles a excepción de la carretera Nacional V, pasando de un ancho de tres metros a cuatro «para que sean mucho más liviano para el paso del vehículo y a la vez cumpla con su objetivo de minorar la velocidad». Poco más dijo el alcalde, que insistió que en este caso quien tiene que pronunciarse es el técnico, que afirma que todo está correcto aunque personalmente tenga la sensación de que es diferente cruzar unos pasos a otros. Sí reconoció que le hubiera gustado que a medida que se terminaran los pasos se fueran pintando, pero que cada empresa tiene su sistema y ésta, Calme, lo ha hecho de otra manera, esperando al final para pintarlos, lo que ha supuesto un perjuicio para los conductores. Una auténtica desgracia. Así califica el alcalde, Rafael Mateos, lo ocurrido con la obra de los pasos sobreelevados de peatones desde que el equipo de gobierno decidió acometer el proyecto para reforzar la seguridad vial en distintos puntos del casco urbano. Y es que a su larga tramitación administrativa se unió la renuncia a los ocho meses de la primera empresa a la que se adjudicó o el sistema que utiliza la actual para realizar los trabajos. El motivo de su comparecencia era dar a conocer el informe que solicitó al ingeniero técnico de Obras Públicas municipal, Agustín Caldas, tras la petición que hizo el PSOE de no recepcionar la obra por entender que los pasos no cumplen la normativa. A la vista del contenido del informe el alcalde lamenta la «falta de rigor» del portavoz socialista, Lino González, puesto que no es exigible la aplicación de ninguna normativa que diga como tienen que ser esos pasos. En ese aspecto incide el técnico, que recalca que no existe normativa de obligado cumplimiento en las vías de titularidad municipal, y que cada Ayuntamiento puede tener su propia ordenanza al respecto, si bien en éste no existe ninguna. Asimismo recuerda que solo hay dos normativas, una de Fomento aplicable a las carreteras del Estado y otra de la Junta de Extremadura a las suyas. Después explica que la orden que dio a la empresa constructora es que se construyeran los pasos sobreelevados de acuerdo con esas normativas «en lo relativo a la definición geométrica para una velocidad máxima de 30 km/h, pero siempre teniendo un cuenta que estamos en vías de titularidad municipal y que por tanto no son de obligado cumplimiento». Unas medidas concretas Las dimensiones establecidas para esa velocidad son 10 centímetros de altura, con una oscilación de uno arriba o abajo; cuatro metros de longitud de la zona elevada y de 1 a 1,5 metros la longitud de las rampas. No obstante apunta que con el objetivo de que la configuración geométrica se adaptara a esas normativas se modificó el proyecto inicial respecto a la longitud de la zona elevada en todas las calles a excepción de la carretera Nacional V, pasando de un ancho de tres metros a cuatro «para que sean mucho más liviano para el paso del vehículo y a la vez cumpla con su objetivo de minorar la velocidad». Poco más dijo el alcalde, que insistió que en este caso quien tiene que pronunciarse es el técnico, que afirma que todo está correcto aunque personalmente tenga la sensación de que es diferente cruzar unos pasos a otros. Sí reconoció que le hubiera gustado que a medida que se terminaran los pasos se fueran pintando, pero que cada empresa tiene su sistema y ésta, Calme, lo ha hecho de otra manera, esperando al final para pintarlos, lo que ha supuesto un perjuicio para los conductores.

description.hltext_display: “十字弓食人魔”连杀3名女子
description.author: www.hexun.com
description.content:
精通心理学
被判终身监禁
英格兰北部城市利兹的一家法庭昨天裁定一名英国男子的谋杀罪名成立，判处他终身监禁。法庭终审判决书说，这名自称“十字弓食人魔”的凶手诱骗、杀害了3名女子。
凶手毫无悔过之意
史蒂芬・格里菲思，现年40岁，现为英国一所大学谋杀心理学博士生。今年6月，他被控谋杀3名从事色情服务的女子，利兹刑事法庭21日对这一案件作出终审判决。
法庭上，格里菲思对自己的谋杀罪名供认不讳。
他承认，在2009年6月至2010年5月间，他将3名女子诱骗至自己位于布拉德福德的寓所，而后将她们杀害并肢解抛尸。
路透社21日援引法庭文件说，3名被害者分别是36岁的苏珊娜・布拉迈尔斯、31岁的谢利・阿米蒂奇和43岁的苏珊・拉什沃思，三人均在格里菲思寓所附近的色情场所谋生。
法庭判定格里菲思谋杀罪名成立，判其终身监禁。
“凶手毫无悔过之意，甚至连一句对不起都没有对死者说。”法官彼得・奥彭肖说。
“爱好”连环谋杀案
连环谋杀凶案今年5月底在英国警方的一次搜查中浮出水面。当时，警方在布拉德福德的一条河流中打捞出装有人体组织和肢解工具的几个旅行袋。后经法医验证，这些人体组织与一年来这一地区报失的3名女子完全吻合。后来警方认定格里菲思为凶手，此人曾多次犯罪被捕。
英国媒体21日不惜重墨报道格里菲思一案，但除却案情，媒体更加质疑社会风气和人们心理被忽视的现状。
格里菲思获得一所大学的心理学学士学位，此后又获得犯罪学硕士学位，现在正攻读谋杀心理学博士学位。他在调查过程中自称从小就对连环谋杀案十分有兴趣，但他的这一“爱好”，在广泛的社会交往和屡次被捕的监禁过程中，却没有引起任何人的重视。
【免责声明】本文仅代表作者本人观点，与和讯网无关。和讯网站对文中陈述、观点判断保持中立，不对所包含内容的准确性、可靠性或完整性提供任何明示或暗示的保证。请读者仅作参考，并请自行承担全部责任。

description.hltext_display: Tulospalkkiot piti maksaa laittomasta lakosta
description.content:
Työnantaja ei olisi saanut jättää tulospalkkioita maksamatta laittomaan työtaisteluun osallistuneille, katsoo korkein oikeus. Se määräsi Stora Enson Inkeroisten tehtaan maksamaan tulospalkkiot noin kolmellekymmenelle vuonna 2006 lakkoilleelle työntekijälle.
Yhtiö oli kirjannut tulospalkkiojärjestelmään ehdon, jonka mukaan laittoman työtaistelun aiheuttamat menetykset vähennettiin siihen osallistuneiden tulospalkkioista. Korkeimman oikeuden mukaan yhtiö pyrki näin laittomasti rajoittamaan työntekijöiden yhdistymisvapautta.

description.hltext_display: Foodies fight with film school for space in LA
description.content:
LOS ANGELES -- For a few weeks this month, Los Angeles' arugula-munching set confronted a threat that seemed as potent as any malicious insect, pathogen or pesticide-tainted produce.
Where would they get their lovingly grown, locally sourced fruits, vegetables and artisanal edibles if a parking dispute with an adjacent film school forced the Hollywood Farmers Market to move or close?
The Los Angeles Film School, which has held classes in its nine-story Sunset Boulevard building since 1999, had refused to sign off on a permit for the Sunday farmers market because it blocks an entryway into a lot where the school's growing number of students park.
In this photo taken Sunday, Dec. 19, 2010, a merchant sells oranges at the Hollywood Farmers Market as the Los Angeles Film School, left, is seen in the background, in Los Angeles. The market has been granted a three-month reprieve to give it time to overcome a challenge to its permit. Los Angeles Film School officials have refused to endorse the permit because it blocks an entryway into one of the school's parking lots for several hours each Sunday.
- Mark J. Terrill /AP Photo
In this photo taken Sunday, Dec. 19, 2010, Tezozomoc, right, of the "Save the Hollywood Farmers Market Coalition" hands a leaflet to Julio Dominguez at the Hollywood Farmers Market, in Los Angeles. The market has been granted a three-month reprieve to give it time to overcome a challenge to its permit. Los Angeles Film School officials have refused to endorse the permit because it blocks an entryway into one of the school's parking lots, seen in the background, for several hours each Sunday.
- Mark J. Terrill /AP Photo
In this photo taken Sunday, Dec. 19, 2010, a car drives into to a parking lot attached to at the Los Angeles Film School as tents from the Hollywood Farmers Market are seen in the background, in Los Angeles. The market has been granted a three-month reprieve to give it time to overcome a challenge to its permit. Los Angeles Film School officials have refused to endorse the permit because it blocks an entryway into one of the school's parking lots for several hours each Sunday.
- Mark J. Terrill /AP Photo

description.hltext_display: Aksa Enerji plans 105 mln lira share sale
description.content:
* Aksa to sell 104.7 mln lira shares to foreign investors
* Aksa Enerji to use proceeds from sale for power plants
ISTANBUL, Dec 22 - Power producer Aksa Enerji AKSEN.IS, whose IPO this year was hit by weak demand, plans to sell shares worth 104.7 million liras to foreign investors next year to boost capacity in energy hungry Turkey.
Aksa said the shares could be sold via a capital increase or through a sale of shares owned by Kazanci Holding.
The company plans to use the proceeds from a capital increase to raise capacity at its power plants, for new plant investments and for new business opportunities, it said in a statement late on Tuesday.
Proceeds from a sale through shareholder Kazanci Holding will be injected back to the company via a capital increase, it said.
One of the two share sale options would be used in 2011. Aksa Enerji hired Garanti Yatirim to manage the sale and TSKB will also take part in the process, according to the statement.
Growth potential in Turkey's power production sector is huge as the country needs to invest $3 billion to $5 billion annually over the next five years in order to prevent power shortfalls, as demand is seen outstripping current capacity.
Scant investor interest earlier this year forced Aksa to cut its IPO to 5.2 percent of capital from 13.5 percent. The stock has risen 4.5 percent since its debut on May 21, lagging gains of some 21 percent in the Turkish equity market .XU100.
